Reviews.Title: “Decent with some major issues”
Reviews.Author: cancun123455870
Reviews.Content: This hotel was adequate if a bit tired and ready for renovation. Two major issues for me were parking is $31/night and they charge you for their bottled water in the room, which was never said to me, it isn't even written anywhere in the room. The staff however, was very friendly and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThiesHH
Reviews.Content: The hotel was old, located directly at a bridge, which opens with lot's of noise several times a day. The valet service is poor. You need to call 15 minutes in advance and then the car will not even arrive after 30 minutes - waste of money. The rooms are fairly old, but the quality is okay for the age. Only the bathrooms and should be refurbished. the hall was very ugly smelly - smelled like sweat

Reviews.Title: “Not so happy camper!”
Reviews.Author: re3ver
Reviews.Content: After working 12 hours on my feet at a conference in the ajacent venue I arrived back at my room to find it had not been serviced. I called the front desk and the phone just rang and rang and rang with no answer. Then I called housekeeping finally got someone on the phone at 7:15pm and explained that the room had not been cleaned and I at least had to have some clean towels. At 8:45 I still did not have towels. I called the front desk and quit counting the rings after 50, someone finally answered and I explained the situation. I finally got towels but nothing else, no coffee, no clean glasses, etc. I had a very early flight and had to get up at 3am. I was not a happy camper. I also do not like the partial wall divider between the sink area and the beds. It lights up the whole room when you turn on a light to wash your hands. The tub drains so slow that when you take a "quick" shower you are standing ankle deep in water. DO NOT stay on a lower floor, the road traffic and especially the traffic over the drawbridge will keep you up all night. People smoke right out side of the main doors and you can not help but breath in second hand smoke going into the lobby. YUCK!

Reviews.Title: “Warm, Friendy, in the heart of downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: hscheff
Reviews.Content: Brining in a conference is always a matter of matching Associtaion needs with hotel offereings. The staff was attentive, understanding of our special needs ans was already prepared to offer their carefully thought out plans for what could fit where. The sleeping rooms are spacious and well decorated. The meeting space is all on one floor which makes for a good flow. Pre-fuction areas are also spacious. Restaurant and eating areas within the hotel are good and modertely priced. Wiat staff were most cordial and efficient. Other eateries in walking distance or a short ride. Shops within strilling distance. Meeting isn't until 2013 but we feel we have a good start

Reviews.Title: “Could not be any worse...”
Reviews.Author: Steve Z
Reviews.Content: First of all, I had requested an "early check-in" because my flight left home at 6:45am and I needed to change and freshen before my 2:00pm business meeting. Upon arrival at noon, I was told that there were ZERO rooms (out of 600+) available from housekeeping. I was forced to unpack a suitcase in the lobby men's room to change. Speaking of the lobby area, it shows a lot of wear and tear for the price that I was charged. The next issue that occurred was an item left in a meeting room the following day. A "keystone cops" scenario followed where security blamed sales, sales blamed housekeeping, management blamed the city of Miami and finally 2 weeks later, the general manager told me that all items left behind were discarded. Really? That is the training you provide your staff?! Never again at a Hyatt property. This place is a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Showing a lot of wear and tear”
Reviews.Author: thm202
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here for work three times in the last year or so. Were it not a company-approved hotel (with a company approved rate), I would find another hotel in downtown Miami. The good: The lobby is very nice and modern, and offers convenient access to the MetroMover. The breakfast at the hotel restaurant is also pretty good (if not a bit expensive), offering a wide variety in the buffet as well as a decent a la carte menu. Valet parking ($31/day) is efficient, and the only option that has in/out privileges. The not so good: Guest rooms (and guest floors) are long in the tooth. The decor and layout needs to be updated from the late 80s/early 90s look. There is a half-wall that separates the bedroom from the bathroom, the bathroom itself (with the tub/toilet) is tiny and has no vent, the outlets aren't convenient for either charging a phone next to the bed or plugging in the iron and the balconies are inaccessible from the room. The driveway is narrow, and often gets filled and difficult to navigate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Joef22
Reviews.Content: I booked this last minute on priceline and got a great price for a sunday. When i checked in the lady gave us a free upgrade to a suite which was very roomy but the room smelled like smoke. The Hotel was in a great location and the staff was very nice and helpful. The rooms diddnt have a refrigerator but all you have to do is ask and they will send on up for free. Took a 20 dollar cab ride to south beach which is worth it because parking is hard to find in south beach.

Reviews.Title: “C'mon Hyatt - You used to be great”
Reviews.Author: dkhay
Reviews.Content: Good Pts: breakfast buffet; walk to shopping/restaurants. Bad Pts: odd design of room with half-wall separating bed and bath rooms; one way in & out for cars; Regency Club small size & selection; serious need of remodel; balcony with no access to it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was not prepared”
Reviews.Author: KathleenRN
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the river with a lovely view and walkway out the back. Its downtown and you can walk to the marina and open air market. However, we were there for a conference, our rooms were not ready, we had to wait hours into the start of our conference to get our room, the elevators require the room key to work and many times there was a long line, waiting for the elevators. The pool is small and the shadows from the buildings prevent sun exposure at certain times of the day. The beds are plush and comfortable. The beach is about 30 minutes away and with traffic, it could take longer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...”
Reviews.Author: Josco26
Reviews.Content: Stayed at a suite there... the personal attention received was great, just because I stayed at a suite the service is a bit better... Over all a place l will come again...stayed there twice

Reviews.Title: “Showing its age”
Reviews.Author: aray213
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt is starting to show its age a bit. Not in the public areas per say but definitely in the rooms. Letâ€™s start on a good note. The staff makes this place worth staying at regardless of the aged rooms. From the minute we pulled up from the valet, to the front desk staff everyone was very cheerful and eager to help. The staff at the restaurant was just as attentive when we grabbed a quick bite to eat, which was good and priced accordingly to where you are at. When we needed a cab to head out for the evening the valet had it taken care of with a smile. Upon returning they were there still smiling even though it was either very late or very early depending on your definition. As for the rooms, ours was clean and the view of downtown was great. The Hyatt beds are some of the most comfortable you will find in the industry. However, the room is showing its age. The bathroom is very dated. Clean, but dated. This has come to be my experience with many large hotels in big city downtown areas so I'm not really penalizing the review because of it but just donâ€™t expect to walk into a 5 star room. You might be able to find a hotel with nice rooms in the area but I doubt you will find a friendlier more well trained staff.

Reviews.Title: “over-rated”
Reviews.Author: daniel b
Reviews.Content: the hotel is charmless... my room was dirty and the carpet was filthy

Reviews.Title: “Below average for the money!”
Reviews.Author: NursegalClbr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Staff was nice enough. Very few dining options, room had dirty windows, bathroom tiny with no ventilation, tiny pool, overpriced Internet fees, at least a 15 minute can ride from any beach. I wasn't impressed with Miami or the hotel. Would not stay here again, overpriced for the lack of amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for Internet fee on each device you connect - wont stay here again”
Reviews.Author: brianhopkins88
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel in excellent location. Not too expensive for location but .... their Internet policy is to charge you per device you connect! So they charged me double to video chat with my family then connect my work PC. They were nice enough to comp one when I complained, but still....really? In 2012? Won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: NatureMomma
Reviews.Content: There were several conventions booked here when I stayed last week. My room was not ready until after 9pm- as were several others'- so the lobby was packed with tired people. The carpet in the room was beginning to show mild signs of wear. Other than an overall color theme of outdated tan stripes (and the carpet), the room was in good shape and clean. The provided toiletries smelled lovely. The staff that I met were all very polite. The pool was quite small. The location on the river was pretty but not very convenient- except for to the convention center. The rooms off of the lobby for smaller meetings also looked pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dialqueen
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Lobby was busy but no wait to check in. Room was clean. Beds were comfortable. Carpet could use a good cleaning. The staff was very helpful with recommendations on places to go. Bayshore area was within walking distance. Eating (breakfast) options were within 3 blocks of the hotel. There are stores in the area if you need to purchase liquor or other personal items. Area seemed safe. I "named my price" on Priceline and received this hotel at a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Spot!”
Reviews.Author: heather_lynn_moore
Reviews.Content: My husband & I booked this thru priceline and were a bit hesitant after reading a few of these reviews. However, we were extremely pleased once we arrived. A fellow traveler on our plane took off with our luggage and we were devastated when we arrived at the hotel. The gal who checked us in, whom deserves a ton of recognition, was great. She asked how we were, I told her our troubles. She directed us to spots to purchases all our needs (CVS, Macys, etc) then upgraded us to the Regency Club level to help ease our day. She was a ray of sunshine and she helped us to forget our troubles and go back to enjoying our vacation. Our room was impecable, all our needs were exceeded and the hotel was in great shape. We'd certainly stay at this location again. The proximity was great to everything. A nice walk in a safe area! You cannot go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: LilysueCEO
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the night before going on a cruise, so it was a good location. The staff are very friendly and helpful so it is apparent that they have done and excellent job with training staff to help customers. The lobby and common areas are nice but the rooms need some updating. My first room was overlooking the river and bridge and there was lots of street noise so they moved me to another room, which was much quieter. The rooms could stand some new paint and new carpet but otherwise, they were clean and comfortable and I got a restful nights sleep. I also ate in the restaurant for dinner and breakfast and that was good and again, the employees were very friendly. For the price, there are other hotels that would be as nice and as close to the cruise ships.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Excellent Stay in Downtown Miami!!!”
Reviews.Author: AttorneyVin
Reviews.Content: Date of Stay: Sunday, 2/5/12 - Wednesday, 2/8/12 Length of Stay: 3 Nights In a nutshell, this is a very amazing Hyatt in Downtown Miami -- a perfect location for any event downtown -- and it exhibits truly excellent customer service! Now, for my detailed review: Having never been to Miami before, I was a little nervous of what to expect -- especially with some of the reviews that I have seen. But, I can assure everyone that there was nothing negative about this property, and, in my opinion, this is a truly wonderful hotel that should not be missed when traveling to Miami! The Hyatt Regency Miami is extremely easy to find; simply Exit off of I-95 South at Exit 2A, follow the long exit ramp which will end at a traffic light, and the hotel is directly on your right. Extremely easy in/out, with excellent valet staff. As for parking, this property is a typical "downtown" property, which means that parking is at a premium and is not cheap. However, when compared to some of the extremely high city parking prices that I have seen, parking here was most reasonable -- Self Parking at $19/night or Valet at $30/night. I highly recommend the Valet Parking Option, as it is reasonably priced, it allows for in/out privileges should you need to drive to other locations in the city, and the valet staff is truly quick and efficient. Upon arrival, I was greeted by an extremely helpful Valet, who took my car and assisted with my bags, escorting me to the Front Desk and waiting patiently for me as I checked in. The Check-in process was extremely quick and efficient for a Sunday evening, and I was greeted by name by the Front Desk Agent. The Front Desk Agent profusely thanked me for my loyalty as a Hyatt Diamond Level Gold Passport Member, and he quickly offered me my choice of Diamond Welcome Amenity -- I chose a nice bottle of the Canvas Merlot along with the "Free Drink" option. He explained the property and its features to me, and also informed me that as a Diamond Guest, I would have access to the Regency Club on the 23rd Floor. After a few short minutes, the Valet escorted me to my room. All-in-all, a very pleasant check-in experience. Upon arrival at my room, Room 838, I was very pleasantly surprised. It seems that as a Diamond Guest, I had been given an extremely nice Suite at the tip of the hotel. The room was in a large triangular shape, with a separate sitting area and bedroom section. It was a VERY nice room for a "downtown" Hyatt location, and I do not feel that it felt dated at all. As soon as you walk in, to your left is a typical Hyatt bathroom, with all of the standard Portico Bath Amenities. To the right is a comfortable sitting area, with a plush couch, a comfortable chair, and a decent sized table for room service dining. Further in to the right, there is a decent sized work-desk, along with a comfortable computer desk chair. Directly in front of you as you enter is what amazed me the most about my room -- the long side of the triangle was complete floor-to-cieling windows, overlooking the Miami River. It was a truly beautiful view of the Miami River, allowing me great views of the shipping in and out of the city. And, you have an excellent view of a large draw bridge in operation, as well. Then, to the left as you continue into the room you find the bedroom area, complete with an extremely comfortable King Size Hyatt Grand Bed. Finally, in the center of the room is a very nice HD flat-screen television that is on a swivel mount so that it can be easily viewed from both the parlor and the bedroom area. All-in-all, a truly wonderful and comfortable room that I was VERY happy with. I would highly recommend this property based on my room experience! As for the Regency Club, it is located on the 23rd Floor, offering a wonderful view of the Miami River -- a very similar view to that I experienced in my room. Each morning, wonderful continental breakfast options and strong coffee and juices were available. Then, throughout the day snacks and very yummy cookies were available. And, at night, a selection of hot and cold appetizers were available. I found that the hot and cold food options were honestly enough for a quick dinner. Also, alcoholic drinks were available for a very moderate fee. As for the other dining options on the property, I did not have time to experience them, as I ate at my conference each day, but the restaurants and bars on property looked wonderful, and the food always smelled excellent as I passed. In addition to those dining options, I did try the in-room dining, which I found to be extremely good -- I highly recommend the Cuban! This hotel did also appear to have an excellent pool for a downtown location; however, due to rainy weather all week, I did not get an opportunity to truly enjoy it. In addition to the excellent room, dining, and Regency Club, the staff at this property was wonderful! I experienced nothing but pure excellence in service, and I have not a single complaint about my stay. All-in-all, this is a truly wonderful location to stay in Downtown Miami and I would highly recommend it. The next time that I am in Miami, I will definitely be staying at the Hyatt Regency Miami!

Reviews.Title: “In need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: Swissworld_traveller
Reviews.Content: The room was incredibly spacious, which is always nice, and quite clean. However, the building needs renovation to meet the standards we can expect from a 4-star property. The carpeted area under the sink, for example, was probably trendy in the 80's, but poses now some hygiene issue. Even the best cleaning lady won't be able to remove everything... I am stopping short of saying that this hotel is overpriced, thanks to the friendliness of the staff and the efficient frontdesk. Breakfast good but pricey. Restaurant ok but with restricted selection. The location is good if you have business to do in downtown Miami. But I would not go there with children or someone special.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent concierge and great location”
Reviews.Author: Rowerbabe
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms, friendly service, and good food are all to recommend this Hyatt, but what really "sold" it for me was the excellent and knowledgeable staff at the concierge desk. There is lots to do in Miami, and the Hyatt is centrally located to take advantage of much. A short walk to the bus, and for $2 you are a short ride from South Beach, the Design section, or the art section. The free Metro mover connects you north to Bayshore shopping (short walk) or a great eating area south in Mary Brickell center. There are nice touches in the room like a new tube of toothpaste daily. Newspapers are free, if you are up early enough to take one from the luggage cart by the elevator or the concierge desk downstairs. If you wa.nt a downtown experience in Miami, the Hyatt is a hotel I'd recommend

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel! Fond Memories...”
Reviews.Author: Gazpacho16
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2004 and this hotel was a real treat! The hotel rooms were spacious and very comfortable. The beds were simply to die for. The view from my room was also fantastic. I could see the ocean from my balcony! Service was efficient and friendly as I also have come to expect from Hyatt throughout the years. I will definitely stay here again if I ever return to Miami. There was also a Brazilian restaurant right around the corner and after such a long time away from home, it was a real treat to be just blocks away from great food!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: SteveInMinn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from three nights at downtown Miami's Hyatt Regency. I basically had to stay there because I was running the Miami Marathon, and it was the best available when I registered for the race. Based on TripAdvisor reviews, I tried to change hotels but all were full, and I was prepared for the worst. Folks, this was far from the worst place I've stayed, even for the $219 a night price. Yes, the rooms would benefit from a makeover. Power outlets were virtually non-existent -- a frustrating thing given the number of rechargeable toys we all travel with these days. Annoyingly, the windows wouldn't open -- also frustrating, given the beautiful weather in Miami in January. But otherwise, the stay was just fine. The front desk person was exceptionally nice. The lobby is attractive and large, the elevators fast, the hotel restaurant pretty decent actually, and the pool above average for a "business" hotel. The bed was comfortable, our room (while slightly worn) was very clean, and the floor very quiet (important for a marathoner who had to go to bed at 8 p.m.) I used the workout room twice, and while it lacks windows, it's fine, folks. I've used MUCH worse athletic facilities. Much better, too, but really ... If I run the marathon again, I wouldn't say no to staying at the Hyatt again, though I might shop around for a better deal. We'll see. One last thought: an in-room fridge would've been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown Miami location, but the hotel needs UPDATE badly...”
Reviews.Author: alagad
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the ING Miami Marathon. Located is ideal; however, the hotel rooms need a SERIOUS refurbishing. The rooms are outdated circa early 1990's. Stayed at other Hyatt Regency properties with better accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: PAQ
Reviews.Content: Easy access to I-95. Valet parking is $31. Large, quiet rooms. Pleasant staff. Busy lobby. Right in the middle of all the action of Brickell Avenue and downtown and Bayside Park. Older hotel with lots of new competition around. Still a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: 2012Toronto2012
Reviews.Content: Good basic rooms moderately priced. Right downtown. The service is very good. The staff are really making an effort to be friendly and helpful. This makes up for the dated decor. Miami hotels are very expensive so this is a good budget option. It is a $20 cab ride from South Beach. The beds are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but severely dated decor”
Reviews.Author: valor155
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business recently. Every staff member that I encountered was quite friendly. They greet you and ask you how your day is going, etc. You definitely feel very invited. They call to see how your stay is. It is just overall good service and attention to detail that I definitely appreciate. However, this level of service cannot fully make up for how terribly dated and old this hotel is. I would venture to say that the elevators and rooms are completely original to this almost 30 year old hotel. Carpet is worn and ragged. Popcorn ceilings everywhere. A definite lack of power outlets in the room. Bathroom shows signs of aging and wear. Overall, not an inviting room at all. More like a room you'd find off of an interstate exit. That is too bad, because the location and service is quite good. Hyatt should spend the money and do a complete refresh of the accommodations. That would get them 5 of 5 in my book.

Reviews.Title: “I am getting nervous for my upcoming stay !!”
Reviews.Author: LRoyce4
Reviews.Content: I will be staying here from April 6 to April 13 and after reading what seems like more negative reviews than positive I am becoming very nervous about my upcoming stay at this hotel ! I will be staying there for a convention, and have added three extra days to "enjoy" the area, but am fearful that I have not made the right decision to extend the stay ! I am hoping that these negative reviews are outnumbered by positive reviews....let's face it, people tend to complain, but not necessarily place a review if their stay was positive. I am hopeful that I can find some fun things to do for the extra 3 days I will be staying.I was looking forward to being away by myself and just enjoying time by the pool !

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Trolly_dollyxx
Reviews.Content: Stayed there twice before as prices are always very reasonable and staff very helpfull. Good location for downtown miami, walking distance to the lovely Bayside Market Place. Attatched to the convention centre so good for business people. Rooms clean and modern, only thing that lowers the hotel is the pool area, pool was a bit dirty but at the end of the day its a city hotel aimed at business guests so completely understand the focus isnt on the pool area. Great stay both times

Reviews.Title: “Overall good, but rooms (esp. carpets) were really bad”
Reviews.Author: wildwestnc
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was very nice... The lobby and common areas were spacious and clean. The key-limit on the elevators was a nice touch during a tradeshow. The room was ok, mine and my peers all had very, very dirty carpets (see pictures). I didn't bother to change rooms since it seemed it was somewhat prevelant. Housekeeping was excellent, the lobby bar food was good and drinks were reasonably priced. Overall a good experience - just change those carpets or at least clean them! For the price I paid it was a pretty nasty room.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Plus2kids
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at a Respire room on the 21st floor. Check in was smooth. The room and bathroom was clean. There was a air cleaner in the room. There was a separation wall between the rest of the room and the sink. The sink is outside the bathroom. The bathroom was a tad old; think 80s 4inch white tiles. Had a room mate and between us there weren't enough power sockets to charge our 6 devices. There was just 1 socket at the desk and another 2 near the window. Ask for a room not facing the draw bridge. Even at 21st floor, it's loud when cars go over it. Room service was prompt. Check out was smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Worse time ever!”
Reviews.Author: Mari S
Reviews.Content: Well to begin with long line to check in, about 30min at least. I arrived on 01-01-2012. The front desk phone is almost impossible to talk to. Also one day they forgot towels, and I was to suppose to have dinner, 1 hour waiting and I couldnÂ´t take a shower before the dinner, when i came back from dinner the towels wasnÂ´t there, I called again and took 40min, for a towel. The hotel is really old, the carpet terrible conditions, the bathroom very very old and very dirty courtain, this time they were paiting the rooms doors so the smell of the paint was really strong. Also a mess at the parking area, the bell door not helpfull at all, the concierge didnÂ´t made my reservation correctly. I stayed at Hyatt before but after this epsode never going back. Also when I was leaving I heard a couple complaing that they lost/stole 2 luggages that they storaged.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-cruise stay-December”
Reviews.Author: lori d
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel in as many years. I get the rooms free so I can't complain about price. I had no problem with check-in other then the normal 15 minute wait. I've checked in when it was busy and hardly anyone in line never had a real problem. I must admit the room did smell when we first walked in. Almost as if it had not been used in a while. I reserved two rooms. The other room was fine. No problem with noise, but I'm a heavy sleeper! One of the pillows was stained and we did not use it! Other than that the room was cleaned each day. I can't tell you what time because (we arrived day and a half early) we would leave in the morning and not come back until around 10 or 11 at night. Breakfast was a little high, but we had to settle since someone traveling with us had limited mobility and could not walk to someplace else. The Bayside Park is a nice walk from the hotel though you will have to cross extremely busy streets to get there unless taking the pathway by the riverwalk of the hotel. I would not recommend it at night. Did not seem dangerous, but not well lit. All personnel encountered in the hotel were nice and courteous. Would stay here again especially if the rooms are free though I may try another hotel next time. We took a taxi so I cannot comment on parking, but there did seem to be a lot of congestion when first pulling up to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel right in the heart of Miami”
Reviews.Author: HNLGAL
Reviews.Content: As a solo traveler going to Miami for the first time, I was a bit leery about staying in downtown Miami, what with all the stories of crime etc. I am here to say that the staff at the Hyatt Miami went out of their way - literally- to help in every possible way. Upon checking in, the front desk agent came out from behind her desk and took me to the bellman, saying if I had any questions he is the best one to come to (wish I could remember his name) him. Very gracious reception for someone who had paid a paltry sum on Priceline for a room for 2 nights. He then ushered me up to an excellent room on the 18th floor overlooking the bridge. I loved the layout of the room - one I had not seen before - and I loved the view of the bridge and the waterway below. Only wish we could avail ourselves of the balcony but the window is sealed shut! The bed was very comfortable and the room was as quiet as a mouse. I was pleased the next morning to arrive downstairs and be greeted by name by both the front desk agent and the bellman. I had a very good breakfast in their Riverwalk (I think) coffee shop (try the Corned Beef Hash and Poached Eggs, the corned beef is hand-sliced! Best I've ever had anywhere!) and had some nice cocktails in the lounge later that day. When I asked for a good shrimp/seafood restaurant at the Concierge's desk, he recommended Trulock which was superb but very, very pricey. If - no WHEN - I go back to Miami I most definitely will stay at the Hyatt when I am departing on a cruise. If you need to be at the airport, read my review on the Sofitel Miami - it is to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Smell of Smoke in the Rooms...”
Reviews.Author: DrEitan
Reviews.Content: The title says it all...the room I was in smelled of cigarettes. Carpet could use a major change over...and the room in its entirety could use a major renovation...carpet has old stains and worn out. Anyway, glad I was not paying for this stay and it was just 2 nights...and the wait time for check in...OMG...could have used complimentary drinks and appetizers to help alleviate the exhausted traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location with great service”
Reviews.Author: Ileana79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a whole two weeks for a school function, so needless to say it was my home away from home for a while. I shared a suite with a classmate. The room was clean and comfortable. Housekeeping did a fantastic job of cleaning up the mess I left behind everyday. Staff was friendly and courteous. The restaurant and bar had good food and even better service. The pool was fantastic! My only complaint was that the Hyatt didn't have laundry facilities for the guests to use - they did have laundry service but that could become costly. In any case, we were allowed to use the washers and dryers at the nearby Marriott. Great location - we were in walking distance to the Bayside area with shopping and restaurants, and the Metro Mover provided quick access to Mary Brickell Village.

Reviews.Title: “Serious Check-in Issues”
Reviews.Author: TonyA987
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt 1/18/12-1/20/12 for business. When arriving at 6:00 PM there was a long line to check-in. After finally making my way to the desk I was told it will be about 90 minutes until a room is ready for me and it may not be the king bed I requested. After a long day of traveling, I was not happy. Checked back after 90 minutes, still no room. 30 more minutes passed and I finally got into a room. They put me in a mini-suite, but that did not make up for the delayed check-in process. It is inexcusable for a hotel of this size to not have rooms ready at 8:00 PM on a weeknight. The hotel itself was fine. I would not like to stay in this part of town for a vacation, but for a conference it was fine. I was on the 7th floor and got a lot of noise from outside the hotel, which was sort of frustrating. If staying there when they are busy, which I suspect is a lot due to the attached conference center, don't expect to get into your room until late in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Pack some Glass Cleaner”
Reviews.Author: neshumale
Reviews.Content: The warm friendly greeting from the staff did not make up for the dirty halls and room. You will want to pack your own cleaning supplies to check in; windows so dirty you could not see out, stained dirty carpet and wierld low lighting in the bathrooms. There was a shortage of towels and washcloths, and room attendants. The room was not touched until late afternoon each day. It was disappointing for such a big hotel in a major city. I am a regular Hyatt guest. This was not the typical Hyatt experience

Reviews.Title: “Good but no amazing”
Reviews.Author: AgaSzSz
Reviews.Content: Hotel has very good location and great views from the rooms. I must say that our room was realy big but unfortunately we opt for smoking and this was a big mistake. Very, very bad smell and after 2 night our clothes absorb it all. Apart form that it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe it's going to be better when finally renovated”
Reviews.Author: TamkaDen
Reviews.Content: I stayed there one night only, and was happy to leave the following day. My room was horrible, I had a feeling to stay in a stable... The bedroom and bathroom area are divided by a wall that makes kind of a strange impression for that class of a hotel. And although there is a balcony outside, and it looks like the door to it could be opened in past, now you cannot crack the door half n inch even.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: fmaspavan
Reviews.Content: Located in Brickell Ave, this hotel is perfect if you are going to spend some time in south Miami. I think is better for business plans than for pleasure ones but I still recomend it. My room was veryyyy nice, I had a Miami Suite, very confortable, lots of space. The bathroom disapointed me a little bit but I have a high standard regarding bathrooms. The service was the best, the staff incredibly kind and helpful. One thing, breakfast could have been better, I was expecting more from a Hyatt buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry no room at the Inn even though we've charged your credit card”
Reviews.Author: GypsyGirl21
Reviews.Content: my title says it all.... Arrived at the hotel at 2am only to find they given my room away. The full story is that my room was guaranteed and charged to my credit card AND I called them from the airport prior to boarding my flight to tell them it had been delayed. None of this seemed to matter and they sold my room to someone else. I ended up sleeping on a sofa bed in a hospitality suite, so no sleep at all really. I left and went to the Intercontinental which was a very nice hotel. With some complaining and prodding on my part, they have offered me a room at a later part of my visit this week to Miami, 1 night no charge. I'll update my review when I give them a second chance to deliver on what I booked the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: AlvaroMpty
Reviews.Content: Cool and great place to stay in downtown miami. Great location, near all the spots.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-cruise, this is the place to stay. Close to everything, including the Port of Miami.”
Reviews.Author: Dan9x
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations of this Hyatt property. They met and exceeded them! The front desk staff were very friendly and professional! We hit a slight wrinkle at check-in (room wasn't ready), but they were so good about caring for us that it didn't really matter. Special thanks to Frank (from HR) for the special attention, it was truly appreciated! You made a difference! If you are looking for a great place to stay pre or post cruise, this is it, look no more.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it should be for the money spent!”
Reviews.Author: Klaybarb
Reviews.Content: We were there the week before Christmas and although the pointsettia Christmas trees were beautiful and the facility seems to be great at first glance there are a few things that disappointed me and my husband. Our first room had a wet floor on the far side of the bed! So we ended up changing rooms and weren't even offered anything for our inconvenience. It wouldnt have been so bad if we hadn't already unpacked and had to repack to move rooms. Only wifi in the rooms if you have a T-mobile account. You can pay to get an account for your stay, but it's pricey. Another disappointment because we were told there was free wifi. We used the free wifi on the metro! Next there is no parking. You either pay for valet each day or you park in the garage next door and pay the hourly/daily rate each time you leave. (go with valet) The pool was disappointing. It wasn't very big and the chair area was a bit crowded. No hot tub either :( And to finish up the bad: with the 5 elevators it's quite easy to head in the wrong direction when you're trying to get to your room. The good: it's connected to the convention center and when you walk through there you can get to the metro, which is free. :) There are 3 loops, so you can get around down town miami fairly easy. We never had to wait long for a car either. Seemed like there was one every 5 minutes. If you should take a taxi to the hotel from the airport and decide you need a car for the day there's an enterprise rental center in the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service but Poor Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Pearl2012
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Hyatt for a convention. Like Many guest I assumed since this was a Hyatt, it would be great. When I arrived my sheets were dirty, all of my wash clothes were dirty, the shower head had rust on it, the bath mat looked as if someone threw dirt on it. It was REVOLTING. However I was upgraded to a suite, after complaining and compensated to a free breakfast, which was great. This was very disapointing. I hope mangenent reads theses notices and starts to look into cleanliness of sheets and bath towels. The floors and furniture needs to be updated, has more of a 90s feel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for a Convention”
Reviews.Author: stbutler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a convention November 13 - 17 2011. I was traveling with a co-worker and once we arrived, I had no problems checking in. My co-worker however was told his room was not available and it would be approx. 1 hour. He was given a voucher for the restaurant, which we used. the food was good but the service was slow. Once I checked into my room it was ok, not what you would expect out of a Hyatt. the rooms were in need of updating. I had to call the lobby to get an iron. Other than this this hotel was in a great location and walking distance to food. I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Close to venue and beach but rooms are subpar.”
Reviews.Author: Malea G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because it was the venue for a weeklong event I was attending. Hearing it was a Hyatt, I thought it would be a quality hotel. However, it is in desperate need of updates. The floor in my room was filthy; the alarm clock did not work. The remote control was dirty and had faded numbers. The bathroom was horribly outdated as was the decor. While the rooms and floors were a disappointment, the staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall but needs work on customer relations”
Reviews.Author: cchali4
Reviews.Content: The only complaint I have is that we arrived at check-in time and were told that our rooms weren't ready yet (not too big of deal if it were an hour or so). However, our room was still not ready after 5 hours. On top of that, I'm convinced the wait would have been longer had we not voiced a complaint. Again, this was the only negative.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good, but room was yuck”
Reviews.Author: DMackster
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline or Hotwire, so got a descent break of the standard rate. The room was really run down - carpet torn and buckled, floor uneven, grout in bathroom moldy, just really beat-up. About what I'd expect from a 2-star. Valet parking is outrageous at $30+ per night and self-park is $20 or so and a heck of a walk from the hotel. The only noteworthy quality is the bar off the lobby - great service and food.

Reviews.Title: “Good but needs to be freshened up”
Reviews.Author: Assenzio
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of nights since south / miami beach hotels were overbooked, and it was actually a good choice. Ocean Avenue is 15 -20 mins driving distance and the area is actually not that bad: Bayside Market is nearby. Hovewer I spent some time in other Hyatts and they were all more modern or fancier than this one: the rooms are not so old, but they are not as up to date as they should be considering the brand name. About the parking, unless you planned every visit using the local commuting services, I strongly recommend the valet service given the little price difference with the single entry; however herewe go with another hint: give the tip before the car collection, not after. In fact it can seem to be obvious but when lobby & hotel entrance are crowded, these parking guys of course tend to speed up the process of the customers who tipped them. I'm sure I'll stay in Hyatt's properties again, but probably not in this one: I tried the Hilton a week later and the ratio quality / price seemed to be better than Hyatt Regency.

Reviews.Title: “The Hyatt Regency Miami has excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Momofthree_111
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel just before Christmas the 1-800 operator who helped me book the accomodations had made a mistake and we needed a bigger room. Melanie on the front desk immediately apologized and rectified the situation at no cost to us. I was impressed with her customer service and with the fact that she is empowered to make these types of decisions on her own and on the spot. She went out of her way to ensure we were happy and comfortable and we really appreciated it. When we called for a roll-away bed a little later in the evening they were at the door within five minutes. Our server in the restaurant was also exceptional. Our youngest son is autistic and she was very understanding and helpful, which was just what we needed at the end of a very long and challenging travel day. Even the housekeeper, Marie, who made up our room during our stay was kind. She made sure that we had extra towels and always smiled and said hello to us when we met her in the hallway. The employees we encountered genuinely seemed to like their jobs and it made us feel very welcome. The only fault I can think of was that the rug in our room was in need of replacement (it was pretty worn) but, hey, I'll take excellent customer service over a new rug any day. Thanks to all the staff for their excellent service. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: ZayM
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times and enjoy it. I do find that this hotel is now dated. The location is good but has we got in late there was nothing available to eat anywhere and the room service is NOT 24HRs. The lobby area seems smaller after some construction, not sure why though. Room was clean and bed comfortable. We stayed just prior to going on a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “great pre-cruise destinatio”
Reviews.Author: workabee
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the this hotel prior to taking a cruise out of the port of Miami. I was very pleasantly surprised by the hotel and the staff. The staff was very accomodating and the rooms were clean and well appointed. The restaurant was very good and the service was excellent. It is in a great location near the convention center and the river. They provide transportation to the port for a reasonable cost. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ericmand
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after Christmas and over New Years Eve for 6 nights in total. We had a fantastic time and would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel. We had buffett breakfast included and there was a great selection and kept us full till mid-afternoon at least! We were lucky enough to be upgraded on arrival (thanks Melanie!) to a huge room - we loved it! The hotel is pretty big so there were occasionally times we had to queue at the reception or concierge a little longer than we would have liked as it ate into our holiday time! Our room was cleaned perfectly each day, although one thing - perhaps the bathroom amenities could not be replaced everyday it they have not been used - we got new toothpaste every other day and shampoo and conditioner everyday leaving us with heaps by the time we left! But thank you to all staff that made our stay so enjoyable - hopefully one day we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “It was not clean”
Reviews.Author: Annding998
Reviews.Content: We were staying in this hotel for 4 nights for Christmas holiday. We were not impressed about the cleanliness, blood stains on the bed cover, stains on carpet and bed sheets........ We were wondering why the hotel is rated at 4 star. We won't go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good cost benefit”
Reviews.Author: Gbrmil
Reviews.Content: Based on what we pay the cost benefit is very reasonable. Good bedrooms, not so good bathroom (needs to be remodeled), very expensive valet parking (30 dollars a day) bu in the end was worthy considering the 100 dollars daily rate.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay at this hotel but seemed a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: AtwoZ
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd time my wife and I have stayed at this hotel over the past few years. This time the hotel seemed a bit dated. The hotel lobby was in a different location from our last stay (I think there is some construction going on this time around in the lobby area). In the past we had a king room on a higher floor. This time we had a king room on the 3rd floor; and, that may explain why the room looked a bit dated compared to our prior stays. The rooms are very spacious; and, the Hyatt bed is always very comfortable. This was the first time we had a room facing the canal We watched a few ships manouver through the canal system (which is a pretty cool thing to see). This hotel is great because it is located within walking distance of many attractions in downtown Miami. Bayside, the American Airlines arena are all within walking distance. There is a Hertz car rental location nearby as well if you want to rent a car. Also, the port of Miami is about 8 miles away. We took a shuttle to the port this time; and, we overpaid for that shuttle (I think a taxi would have been cheaper then the $20 we paid); but, the shuttle was quick and very convenient; so, no complaints from that perspective. I suspect the shuttle was paid by the hotel; and, working for tips only; as, each traveler was being charged a different amount; so, be careful to establish the amount before you get into the shuttle (something we should have done but did not do and it may have worked out, anyway). I think people in the area are really stuggling to make ends meet; so, you can negotiate a good rate; but, you can also be taken advantage of if you are not careful. We always book this hotel through priceline for around $80-$85 depending on the time of the year. I think we once got it for around $50; but, I would not expect that to happen very often.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: poppyz
Reviews.Content: We were treated above and beyond what i was expecting. Big thanks to the hotel staff expecially Sabine. Yes the hotel is nowhere near south beach ,if you want that book a hotel there. Clean and the riverwalk cafe is excellent. Will return if visiting miami again

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: markZoom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before boarding a cruise. Nothing to fault at all. Great rooms, pool and breakfast service. Very friendly staff and comfortable public areas. Great value also. I am recommending this hotel to anyone visiting Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not up to Hyatt standards”
Reviews.Author: canbagna
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located Downtown and easily accessible from the airport. The room was comfortable and spacious, though a little bit old-stilish. No free parking in the area.

Reviews.Title: “ABOVE AND BEYOND CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravlere
Reviews.Content: I moved one of my business travelers to this hotel after having moved her from another Miami hotel that was just terrible (River Park Hotel). The Hyatt front desk person was so sympathetic to her horrible experience at the other hotel, that she voluntarily upgraded her room and sent up room service free of charge. My traveler insisted that her experience at the other hotel wasn't the Hyatt's problem, but the front desk staff wouldn't take no for an answer and insisted on pampering my traveler. This is what Customer Service is all about. This made all the difference in the world to my traveler that had traveled internationally and just wanted to get some sleep. It was 11pm before she could check into the Hyatt and they really went above and beyond to take care of her. I will send all of my Miami travelers to this hotel. We had a wonderful experience here and the hotel is very clean and nice and in a great location. Another upside is that the room was only $129/night! No need to book a bargain basement hotel when an awesome hotel like the Hyatt has such great rates.

Reviews.Title: “Views from every angle!”
Reviews.Author: Kansasfarmers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt and we loved the many views from our 22nd floor window! And the views outside by the waterway were beautiful, as well. And it is located with walking distance of other dining options, if you like. But the cafe downstairs, in the hotel serves a huge selection of foods, which is included in your room price for breakfast. The Hyatt is conveniently located to the Metro, which you can ride for free to go to the Bay side for hours of shopping, entertainment or just soak up the culture! The hotel staff was friendly and helpful!The room was ample and clean. The only downside was that there were no microwaves or mini frigs in the rooms. But I would stay there again, if I travel to Miami!

Reviews.Title: “For All of Your Business Needs, but Not For Vacation”
Reviews.Author: RPH80
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the exemplar of a business hotel. I was here for a three-day work conference and the place fulfilled all of my needs in that regard, but it is no fun otherwise. Good food, great room service and, as always, the Hyatt standard of overall service, but I would not stay here if I visited Miami on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “They need to improve”
Reviews.Author: Hellogyn
Reviews.Content: I Was a guest at Miami Hyatt Regency from december 4th to 9th! It's not the worst hotel, but should be much better! First of all, the location is not ideal for the ones on vacation! Downtown is empty at night, boring during the day and you have to spend lots with taxis all the time! Miami Beach is more charming! There's no refrigerators in all bedrooms! They charge you U$9,9 a day for very slow wi-fi! Worst of all: they charge U$30 a day for parking your car and U$ 7 for receiving each package in your name! I had a problem and one of my packages simply disappeared! But the worst of all happened the last day! My wallet, with money, credit cards and ID disappeared! The hotel was crowded and confusing that day! Thank's God my passport was not in it. Summary? I was disappointed! I expected much more from a Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Great "winter" Getaway to Miami”
Reviews.Author: RESTONTRAVELGAL
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. I won two free nights here at a holiday party last year and had to make my trip before the end of 2011. My boyfriend and I stayed three total nights and had an amazing mini-vacation using the Hyatt as our home-base for exploring. The staff here is so friendly and helpful, I have never stayed a hotel with such superior customer service. From the front desk staff, to the restaurant and bar staff, and even down to the maids and maintenance people, everyone had such a helpful and welcoming attitude. Our room was upgraded to a king-bedroom suite and it was spacious and spotless. The breakfast buffet was very tasty and included a wide variety of items - eggs, breakfast meats, oatmeal, pastries, cereal and lots of fresh fruit. The hotel location is great. The hotel is actually connected to the convention center where you can hop on the Metro Mover which will take you around the downtown area. This was great for connecting to the metro rail lines and exploring different areas of downtown Miami. It was also a very scenic ride through the city. There is a CVS right around the corner and several good restaurants and bars within walking distance. You are also close to Bayside Marketplace and Bayfront Park. The only two slightly negative things I can think of are the age of the hotel (yes it is a bit outdated) and the lack of free wireless internet. Overall, it would be my pleasure to stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but”
Reviews.Author: daveandgloria
Reviews.Content: Noisy a lot of plumbing and outside noise. The restaurant connot handle a crowd it buckles under pressure waited 20 min for a seat in a half full restaurant. Bed was very nice and Kaytlan at the desk was great. Room cleat but not a $200 a night clean. If you get a deal its good if not stay cheaper. Hotel staff is very quickly over run and connot handle the pressure no team work very one person does the work thing, example is the gentelman hailing cabs no help and over worked caused more work, asked for help and was directed to the man working the hardest.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed, carpets were stained, Expensive WiFi”
Reviews.Author: globalfish
Reviews.Content: The location is great for downtown Miami attractions and the Port (if you're going on a cruise in the morning.) Staff are polite and helpful. The bed was quite comfy. I would say 5-stars is pushing it for this hotel though. It's a bit outdated and the carpet was badly in need of replacement, which is a shame in a Hyatt. Also, I think it is chintsy to charge your "guests" for Internet. Overall a good place to stay in downtown, if you get a good deal on the room, which we did.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NYCROTARYROCKET
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights and it was delightful. The front desk staff are super friendly and helpful, we were able to check-in early and everything was immaculately clean. Samira from front desk even gave us a call to make sure our room was clean. The view from our suite was awesome-right in front of the water where the drawbridge is. Our stay included free breakfast buffet and internet. The food at the buffet was great and the wait staff are kind. The hotel lobby/waiting area is beautiful. The hotel is located near lots of drug stores, restaurants and shopping stores. The Bayside Marketplace is within walking distance or one stop away when taking the Metro Mover. Will be staying here for our future trips in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, nevertheless, there is no parking”
Reviews.Author: virtual2
Reviews.Content: i arrived at the hotel and for my surprise there is no parking! You have to leave your car at the valet parking for US$30 per day. So, planning on visiting this hotel? Add US$30 to your room rate. The front desk was nice and the check in process was fast. The room size was ok. I only have one complaint about the bathroom... the wash didnâ€™t drain well, and nevertheless the house keeper went every day to clean this was never fixed. Regardless that the hotel is good, donâ€™t you dare request room service. The rate for such service is incredibly high.... Keep in mind that when going out request your car a couple of minutes ahead, so you donâ€™t have to wait in the lobby....

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Ronlexus
Reviews.Content: Parking a bit expensive as in downtown. Otherwise great place

Reviews.Title: “soooo friendly, great service”
Reviews.Author: auntkaren4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went over to Miami for the Thanksgiving holiday. The service and friendliness of the hotel was like nothing I've ever experienced, from Kaitlyn at check in, the engineer who came to look at the air conditioner in our room (we did have to switch rooms and received 2 breakfast buffets for the trouble), housekeeping and the staff at Riverwalk Cafe everyone was friendly. The area was ok, I walked to the Bayside Shops which most were open on Thanksgiving. The rooms were very clean. I signed up for the Passport program (free) and received a room upgrade (mini suite) and free internet in room. When back in Miami the Hyatt Regency will be our "go to" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Ann K
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this Hyatt prior to cruise. Extremely polite staff. Clean rooms which were a bit small. Could hear TV in next room. Great location to shopping and cruise port. Exspensive food and drinks, long wait for dinner to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: tylerb83
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency on business for 3 nights. Can't comment much on the location and nearby amenities--there's certainly food, shopping and parks nearby. However, much of this seems to be concentrated in Miami Beach. It is on the river and this provides a nice place to take a timeout. As for the hotel, it was one of my best stays. First and foremost, the staff are incredibly nice and it's obvious that they pride themselves on this. You won't be disappointed when you need assistance or have questions. Secondly, the room was exceptionally clean. Finally, the overall ambiance and decor of the entire hotel was comforting and calm. Since I usually travel for pleasure and pay out of pocket, I'm more concerned about location and nearby amenities. However, since this was a business trip and I spent most of my time indoors for a conference, I found this hotel to exceed my expectations in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hyatt Regency Miami”
Reviews.Author: Fitz B
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Miami Hyatt are outstanding especially Kaitlyn on reception she made our stay at the Hyatt Miami, which also happened to be my wife's birthday extremely memorable and enjoyable. Kaitlyn was exceptional in her customer service delivery and her attention to detail from our arrival to departure exceeding what could have been reasonably expected of her. All staff at this hotel were ever so friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monk657
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our visit to Miami. Big hotel located in downtown. Not much located close to the hotel. We had to walk a fair distance to get to the shops/restaurants. Parking garage is a bit of a walk too from the hotel but you can't expect much considering the downtown location. Room was very nice and had a nice view too. Bed was also very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS MY BUTT!”
Reviews.Author: domsis
Reviews.Content: So tired of lies and reviews that are not honest. This hotel is absolutely magnificent. I truly believe that some of the nicest people in the world work here! The rooms are magnificently clean, spacious and well appointed. The undertones of music give one a feel for Miami. The food is fantastic in the restaurant. I cannot say enough about the Hyatt! First class act all the way! Thank you everyone for treating us royally!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hyatt Regency Miami”
Reviews.Author: ellet1
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hyatt Regency Miami for a one night pre-cruise stay. The location was very convenient with access to the Bayside Marketplace. CVS Pharmacy is a short walk away for last minute purchases. The hotel is undergoing construction at the front entry but it did not bother us. The rooms were clean and the beds very comfortable. Our rate included breakfast and you had a choice of hot buffet or ordering off the menu. The food was fantastic. I can't say enough about the great customer service we received here; the staff at this hotel is excellent! I would definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sonja F
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt was such an excellent place to stay! The service was out of this world! I was treated like a queen. I would definitely stay here again! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, very convenient for a couple night pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: BSilverthorn
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, we booked it as it was close to the touristy areas we needed to be such as cruise port, American Airlines arena, Bayfront park/Bayside Marketplace. The hotel is attached to the Knight Center and the MetroMover (free) is accessible without having to even leave the complex. The MetroMover took us one stop down, dropped right into Bayside Market area. A cab from hotel to cruise port was less than ten dollars. Check in was easy, polite efficient clerks, there is some construction going on at the main entrance so you had to go through an alternate entrance about 50 feet to the right. Lobby was clean, huge, well decorated and had LOTS of seating areas. The restaurant and bar area were nicely done. Lots of seating in there as well. Breakfast buffet foods were hot and well presented, if a little un-inspired in the selection. Typical eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, bagels, benedicts, several cereals, pastries, juices, fruits. We were far from starved though and ate there both mornings. Elevators were quick and all functional. The room was regular room, SUPER SUPER comfy king bed with higher end linens. Everything worked in the room except the toilet did keep running every now and then, so we closed the door and no more bother. From the previous reviews I was expecting a lot of outside noise, especially as we had a river view right on to the draw bridge. We had the 19th floor, and never were bothered by the bridge at all. There is some traffic noise, but that was from - yes, you guessed it, the traffic in the city. Really now, how could one of the top 10 largest cities in the USA NOT have traffic noise at a downtown hotel? It was no bother at all. Other reviews also stated that rooms were old and outdated in decor. Well, the carpets, linens, furniture were all beige or browns, solids and some tame stripes, the wall art was typical inoffensive tropical plant images, bathroom had a toilet, sink, good countertop space. Closet was very large and the safe worked easily. Maybe if you are an interior designer you might be offended by the lack of imagination, but I cannot see how anyone could truly take offense at a very bland, ordinary and neutral decor scheme. The TV was not (Gasp!) a flat screen, but it worked perfectly fine, there was a functioning remote, and it had any channel I could care to watch plus movies for PPV. Everything was clean, there was no stains or dirt or bugs or anything out of the ordinary. Didn't use the pool or the gym, but saw those areas and they looked fine. We did not park a car, but it did have a high cost which I guess is typical for Miami. There was a charge for internet access but we did not use that either. Overall, very comfortable, friendly staff, a trouble free stay that we would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoldCoast01traveller
Reviews.Content: This is obviously an older hotel, so the main criticisms were the aircon system being noisy, and lack of noise reduction from outside, so lots of traffic noise. It was clean and tidy and staff were helpful and mostly very friendly. Bed comfortable, but horrible jet lag so didn't sleep much Rooms felt cramped, even the larger suites (colleagues staying in top floor suites) decor looks fresh painted and clean but is definitely dated...pebbled ceilings, drop out beds in the wall...back to the 60's! Wifi was included in my conference package, and was pretty quick and uncrowded network. I would have (and always do) complain at paying for wifi when I'm staying. Overall I was there only for a conference (so ideal location for the Knight center) and probably would not stay again

Reviews.Title: “Maybe this was a great hotel one time Not now. Can be fixed though!”
Reviews.Author: goldstn
Reviews.Content: Hotel allows smoking everwhere out front, so no way to enter or exit without breathing secondhand smoke. My complaints landed in deaf ears. Given room with no hot water. Hours later after I complained, I was told that engineering knew about this the day before, but not the front desk staff. Saving grace, junior staff apologetic, couteous and professional. Also, food was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “WAO! Never pay to stay in this dump.”
Reviews.Author: ltorres93
Reviews.Content: Locally I was there for a pharmaceutical meeting and did not have to pay for my 1 night stay. What a terrible hotel. First off there is construction on the entrance of the hotel. Check in was very impersonal and unfriendly. They have a line for Hyatt reward member but when I asked it is only for platinum not gold despite the fact there was a sign there stating Hyatt passport members. Rooms are very basic and have an old feel to them. Bathrooms are ridiculously small. When i went to take a bath the shower looks dated so it gives you the feeling you don't want to put your bare feet in there. Noise level on floor 17 was bad as well. In the am at 700 I called front desk with my only request which was to extend my check out one hour until 100pm. They even declined this stating they were fully committed that day. Basically ugly, dated rooms combined with poor service does not work for me. Across the street there is the Epic Hotel which seems to be very nice..

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location for money”
Reviews.Author: DisplacedIslandSoul
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency Miami. The location is unbeatable, within a couple blocks of downtown Miami and the waterfront scene. The hotel itself could do with some updating (bathroom fixtures, televisions, etc.). Having to pay for parking is also not the best, but it seems that it is becoming common, especially in big cities.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency Miami”
Reviews.Author: Sandra H
Reviews.Content: 60 stars, This was one of the nicest,cleanest, staff was so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: gommax75
Reviews.Content: A standard hotel located in Downtown. Rooms are huge, and I've been upgeaded with complementary internet Wifi because I subscribed to Hyatt loyalty program (as suggested by guys at the reception desk). Hotel forniture a bit too old. Their map for people keen on jogging is a really nice idea!

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience”
Reviews.Author: KAREN J
Reviews.Content: The location was fine for my family. The food/service was excellent. The staff was fabulous. The room was fine; didnâ€™t notice â€˜odorâ€™ that I have read in the other reviews. Great value for the money. First hotel where I cannot open the door to the balcony. No significant complaints. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old and expensive.”
Reviews.Author: ppfiuza
Reviews.Content: I didn't like the hotel. ItÂ´s old, and the location (downtown) is not my preference...

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown Miami location”
Reviews.Author: iluvvindaloo
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt has top rate service from a staff that has been with the hotel a very long time. They really, really treat you right here. However, the guest rooms are showing their age, and are badly in need of an update. They are very comfortable, it is true. But the corporation really needs to get with it, and install new carpets and drapes in very single room. This hotel is a good value in a good Miami location, but it is a Hyatt Regency, for crissakes! Let's spiff it up, right away please!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!!”
Reviews.Author: lilchunk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location in downtown Miami. Everyone was so nice - great customer service, which I'm very picky about. I had purchased a package that included breakfast every morning, and on the day I was leaving, I wasn't going to be able to have breakfast. I didn't care, but the front desk person still made sure that I at least had coffee to go before I left. The room was very clean and the bed was SOOOO comfortable!! Loved loved loved it! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wear and tear, but a good value.”
Reviews.Author: wmbarnes189
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay, so we knew what we getting. Upon arrival, there was a sign saying that valet parking was full, so we went straight to the parking gagage. Big mistake. Very long walk in a building across the road. At checkin, they explained we should read the fine print, because they always reserve space for hotel guests. When we went to get our car the next morning, the car next to us had a smashed in window and glass was everywhere. Use valet, always. That is pointer number 1. We got a $99.00 rate including breakfast and upgraded for $35.00 to a "Miami suite". They use the term suite very liberally. The room is bigger, it had a great view of the Miami river, and a hot shower. Now the bad side. It was one larger room with a flat screen TV on a credenza in the middle. The TV swivled 180 degrees. King bed on one side, queen sofa bed on the other. Did I mention that the back of the credenza had fallen off, so we got to look at the inside of the cabinet. Lots of general damage to the furniture. Kept the AC at 63 degrees, because it could not keep the room comfortable, otherwise. Sink is behind a head high wall saparate from the toilet and shower. At $99.00, we got what we paid for. The $35.00 upgrade, not at all. It was a worthy of $35.00 and should not be called a suite, in my opinion. That is point #2. Now for the buffett breakfast. Because it was included, we were very satisfied. Nice fresh fruit and a good selection , but often the serving bowls were empty. Staff needed to keep up with demand. If we had been asked to pay the $18.00 breakfast buffet, I would have refused, because it was no where near that value. I did have to go table to table to find creamer and went into the service area to get coffee, because staff was overwhelmed. Point 3 is don't buy breakfast there if you have to pay for it. All in all, for $99.00 in downtown Miami, it is good value, but this is not up to the Hyatt standard. It is a very dated and tired hotel. Great location and views. Just don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Property is Dated, But My Stay was Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaRes
Reviews.Content: When you enter this Hyatt property you feel as if you have entered a relatively new hotel. However, once you get to the room floors you definitely feel as if you are in a somewhat dated hotel. The property is not run down, it just is a bit dated. That is not a complaint, but an observation. My rate was great, and the room furnishings were up to standard for a Hyatt Regency. Everything worked as it should, and my stay was an excellent. No complaints. A special kudos to the staff. My colleague mistakenly left his phone in our car when we left it with the valet after returning from a dinner meeting. When the car was retrieved my colleague immediately went to look for the phone, the valet told him that he had placed the phone in the center console (to put it out of view). A nice touch, and definitely deserving of a decent tip. This Hyatt property is a fine choice in downtown Miami. It is not the sexiest property around, but the price and Hyatt quality definitely make it worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby is deceiving”
Reviews.Author: KristopherKest
Reviews.Content: Although the lobby is updated and modern, the rooms are not. They were certainly clean and neat, but not nearly as nice as I was expecting based on photos on the hotel website. We had a balcony, but no door to open to get to it - quite frustrating. Had to pay for wireless internet in our room....or so we thought. After calling the front desk several times with no answer, we finally just decided to pay for the internet service. Turns out they did not put charges on the bill, but that did not help the frustration the night before. As I mentioned, no answer at the front desk at 7:30p, even after letting it ring for at least a solid minute. this happened twice in the same evening. Never experienced that before. ' Overall, an acceptable place for a business stay, but not as nice as we had been lead to believe. On the positive side, the breakfast is good, if overpriced, and with attentive-to-a-fault service staff.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trip A
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel were pretty decent. However, check in was a nightmare. It took 4 hours to finally get a room because airline employees occupied the rooms and did not check out. We were given $20 per person for dinner. After being told we would get the night for free they miraculously could not refund any money because it was booked on hotels.com. Wasn't worth my time arguing. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Super service”
Reviews.Author: uncpig
Reviews.Content: Our stay was awesome...never had better service! Upgraded because it was our anniversary to a nice suite. Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Weird rooms, not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: kbugs24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hyatt for three nights for a business trip. Overall, I thought that the property was kind of weird, the rooms were old, and the value wasn't there, although the common areas and restaurants were really nice. The good: The restaurant had really good food for a hotel bar/restaurant. The salads in particular were yummy. I went a couple times and the server and bartender remembered me, which was a really nice touch. The conference I was at catered from the hotel, and all that food was really good too. The common areas are nice - modern, sleek, and relaxing. If only the rooms were like that... The location is really good - close to a ton of restaurants and nightlife. The bad: The rooms are small, which doesn't make a lot of sense to me in Miami, where space is not as much at a premium. They're also really really strangely configured, particularly the bathroom nook (carpeted - ew) and the walk-in closet, which I found to be totally unnecessary in a hotel room, particularly one lacking in usable square footage. The rooms seem very old, and the one I was in did not appear to have been updated in at least 15 years. That led to an air of shabbiness. I'm fine with staying in an out-of-date hotel, but not when it's branded as a Hyatt Regency, and not at the price point of this hotel. The staff (apart from the people in the restaurant) were mostly indifferent and not particularly friendly. All in all, the hotel was not bad, per se, but was a disappointment for the price paid and the Hyatt Regency flag.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: bhavana_praveen
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation just the previous day to our arrival, and we got the best rooms.....it was above our expectation, rooms were so spacious and neat, I would recommend everyone to stay at this hotel.the food is delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Rafaelplatino
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business meeting, great location , walking distance to a great dinning experience, bayside marketplace and other atractions, excelent service and breadfast buffet included was great

Reviews.Title: “How can the Hyatt justify a 5 hour wait for a room?”
Reviews.Author: rodbybronze
Reviews.Content: I waited 4 hours for my room, (arriving at 5 pm) others waited as long as 5 hours. Staff provided no plausible explanation. I can't believe a Hyatt could be run this poorly. If you value your time in Miami, avoid this place at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rebec-PDX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this H.R. Miami in October 2011, and I thought that the location was great. It was within walking distance to the Bayside marketplace where there is shopping and lots of restaurants. It was about a $25 cab ride from the Miami airport. The staff was very helpful and checked in a couple of times, making sure that I had everything that I needed. The food at the hotel was good, but I thought it was a little over-priced. My room had a view down to the Miami River, which was pleasant. The beds were quite comfortable and I got a really good night's sleep. The room had a hairdryer and ironing board, but it did not have a fridge or a microwave. The bedspreads were white and looked very clean. I gave it only 4 stars for rooms and cleanliness because there was some chipped paint and worn carpet, but these really didn't impact my stay. I used the pool and exercise room. Overall I liked this hotel and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location! Easy access to MetroMover!”
Reviews.Author: rrdist
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay in Downtown Miami, this is a great location. We stayed 2 nights while in town handling a legal matter. We were pleasantly surprised considering this was the same hotel where my high school senior prom was held back in 1983. (I was told the hotel opened in 1982) We booked our room through Priceline at a great price over regular online rates. Jessica was very helpful at check in. Our room (1816) was nice, it was nicely appointed and we had a view of the Brickell Bridge / Miami River. Like some other reviews have mentioned, the carpet looked a little worn. We parked our car with valet, and while it is $30/day - this is comparable to other hotels in downtown. Also the $30/day allows you in & out privileges. You can Self Park for I think $18/day, but you have to pay that each time you come into the garage. Take the car out once and come back you've already spent more than $30. The bellmen were helpful in getting our luggage to our room promptly. Afterwards we stopped by the concierge desk to see what things we might be able to do. They suggested taking the Metro Mover - which is FREE ( http://www.miamidade.gov/transit/mover_stations.asp ) to Bayside - a shopping area. It was very convenient to catch the Metro Mover from the hotel - it is a short walk through the hotel to the Knight Center Station where you pick up the tram. It was a short ride to College/Bayside station where you get off & then a 2 block walk to Bayside. We felt safe travelling with our 3 year old son and enjoyed walking around Bayside before heading back to the hotel for the evening. While reviewing the Metro Mover map we noticed that there was a stop near the courthouse where we needed to be the next day. The concierge was able to confirm for us that we could take the Metro Mover right there - the station was across the street from the courthouse. How more convenient could that be?
