The second day when we returned back from our meeting @ the courthouse we decided to get our car from Valet and take our son to the Childrenâ€™s Museum a short drive away. It was maybe a 10 minute drive. Before we arrived at the Childrenâ€™s Museum we noticed several black ants in the door wells and our son in his car seat was complaining they were crawling on him. The ants were not biting, but sure enough when we took him out of the car seat you could see the ants on him. They were also in the door wells and a few in the trunk. Anyone with kids knows there is bound to be food crumbs, etc from where the kid has dropped something so at first we thought this was the issue. We searched the car to see if we could find what might be attracting them and really could not find anything that they seemed to be feeding on. We went inside to the museum and hoped maybe the heat would cause the ants to relocate, but no such luck. As a result we cut short the remainder of our afternoon to go back to the hotel to show Valet. When we returned to the hotel, Jose talked to us - we showed him and he was concerned with the issue. It was raining the evening we arrived. We asked if maybe the car had been parked under a tree or near a bush that the ants might have swarmed and found our car as new refuge - he did not know. He promptly said he would take care of it for us and they took the car to be vacuumed. A little later Jessica from the front desk saw us in the lobby and asked how our stay was going - we informed her of the ant situation and she apologize and said she would follow up with Jose, which she did. They offered to pay for a cab to take us somewhere if we wanted. We decided to stay in for the remainder of the evening. We saw Jessica later that evening and she had confirmed with Jose they were working on it. They mentioned they were going to spray the car, but decided not because of our son - which we appreciated. That told us they were being considerate. When we left the next morning, the inside of the car had been completely cleaned out - it looked great. We took off for our 6 hours drive back home. Unfortunately when we stopped along the way - we were surprised to find ants crawling in the door wells. While not as many, it appeared they were coming along with us for the trip. We could not say 100% that the ants came from the hotel, but considering we had not been anywhere else we could not think where else they might have come from. The hotel only charged us 1 day valet and cleaned the inside of the vehicle for us. We feel they did as much as they could to resolve the matter. We are only mentioning this in the event someone else has/had a similar situation. Maybe with some detective work they could find out how this is happening on the property. Our last evening there we decided to eat at the Riverwalk Cafe. The restaurant staff was excellent! We both had the Latin steak, sorry canâ€™t recall the name of it and it was great! Kids under a certain age (cant recall 12 or 16) eat free with paying adult so we could not go wrong. When my partner had to take our son to the restroom the person who I presume was the Food & Beverage Manager offered to put their food under the warmer to keep it warm until they returned. Steak dinner for 2 and free childrenâ€™s menu came to $60 - we feel a reasonable amount for the location; we know you can easily spend more if you want. We did use the pool once. It was adequate for our needs; I would not expect a hotel in this location to have some huge water fall pool, etc. It was clean & towels were provided for guests. Yes this property is older compared to the newer ones that surround it. Other comments on this site from hotel management indicate it was refurbished in 2008 and apparently they will start bathroom remodeling of the rooms this fall, this will boost the overall property even more. We have already recommended this property to others as a result of our stay. We would welcome another stay at the Hyatt Regency on our next trip to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Hotel! Sensational Staff!”
Reviews.Author: deewr
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hyatt Miami in August 2011 with my two sons. In keeping with the high standards of the Hyatt namesake, our stay was superb right from the parking valet, the front desk staff, the lovely accommodations to the delicious buffet breakfast! We also had the Regency Club access which I would highly recommend as an e-standby upgrade! I really cannot say enough about our stay...it was truly fantastic and would not hesitate in recommending this hotel. In fact...I am staying there again in October!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shaynenunnery
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently at this wonderful hotel on the Miami River- the staff are so friendly and helpful- from the front desk, valet, bars and restaurants , we had a very nice experience, rooms are excellent. It is within walking distance to the Courthouse and many law offices- as we were on business- but even with it's central location I would stay there again! Thank you again for a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the Hyatt name”
Reviews.Author: Aholm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hyatt in downtown Miami in the summer of 2010 and it was not very good. Granted, I'm used to nicer hotels, but also nicer Hyatts. This one just isn't up to the normal quality. The hotel is old! Even though they redid the rooms they still feel old-it's just something they will never be able to fix. While it was on the river in downtown, there is not much in downtown except office buildings and condos. Plus the crime rate is very high in Miami to the extent that it is sketchy in the daytime. Another HUGE drawback is the parking. To get from your room you have to: go down the elevators, through the lobby, through the convention center lobby, though an indoor walkway over a road, and into another building, then its parking garage. My mom questioned the safety of walking to the car, day or night. They NEED a garage in their hotel. Overall the hotel is average but you could find much better in the city for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “impersonal and average”
Reviews.Author: TrinidadSuz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in September 2011 on a 3-night business trip. It is situated close to downtown bordering the River walk. The room was basic although it was on the executive level. The carpet had seen better days. I had some work to do and found the lighting very poor. The toilet started to malfunction on the last day. Also there was no full length mirror. I had to pay for use of the business center because I did not bring my computer...it is not free for guests. The staff were rather impersonal and one I encountered to make arrangements for transportation was not helpful at all. I think they should try harder. I choose to spend the last night at another hotel. I would only recommend this hotel for short business trips.

Reviews.Title: “No good for a holiday”
Reviews.Author: SkipperDevon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of the city miles from any beaches and surrounded by very tall buildings, we found the staff very friendly and helpful, it is also a none smoking hotel, large rooms and they were cleaned every day but not very good

Reviews.Title: “On My Way Part 1 Will Let youknow how it goes stay tuned....”
Reviews.Author: Charlie B
Reviews.Content: I am a liitle nervous because of the up and down reviews but I'm going to give it a shot and I will let you all know how it goes. Any recommendations what floor is best to stay on? Stay Tuned.....

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt, you can do better”
Reviews.Author: Zimarkus
Reviews.Content: Hyatt always have proven to be good, safe bets. The Miami Hyatt Regency must be one of the old ones where all bets are off. The staff could not have been nicer. The room could not have been larger. Then all the mediocrity kicked in. Dirty worn carpeting. Lights so dim it was difficult to see properly. Wifi which cost $14.95 for 24 hours and then stopped working 12 hours into our 24. A safe which did not work. A bath tub which did not drain. Had enough? So had we. Hyatt you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: Alvaribus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located for business, in the financial district of Miami and sorrounded by banks, restaurants and good bars. I was in a petit suite in the 18th floor with wonderful views over the channel. Perfect for meetings.The bathroom was a little old so as the carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Potential on the road to exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Mrs F
Reviews.Content: Hotel well located. Upon arrival, check in was at 3pm, room was not ready until a quarter to 4. Had a long trip and was ready to lay down and relax. We were upgraged to a miami suite. Not sure if i would call it a suite, but the gesture was appreciated. The other issue was the wait to retrieve our car from Valet. It took them close to an hour to bring our car to the front of the hotel. With a daily price of 35 dollar, without tipping the worker, i was not happy. Other than that, i was ok with the stay, but due to the inconvenience im not sure if i would consider the Hyatt Miami in thte future.But the hotel was clean and the service was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Wow... 1 big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: BojanLo L
Reviews.Content: Too bad the big names don't deliver. Again a big name hotel that doesn't deliver (king room). No microwave, no fridge, no free parking, no free internet... and the audacity to charge you $6 for a small bottle of water. The room was clean & ok, the bed was alright, but all the things missing make you wonder why you're spending your money on Hyatt. Too bad!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Service - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Conal O
Reviews.Content: In my career I have travelled globally for work spending over 1,200 nights in hotels. With that being said, I firmly believe itâ€™s very important to provide feedback in situations of extremes weather praise or constructive feedback. I must admit I am partial to Hyatt because they consistently have provided excellent service and maintain high standards across all their brands. I had booked my reservation a few hours before I was set to arrive and they were almost sold out. I was traveling with another guest and needed a room with two queen beds. At the time of the reservation they only had king rooms left so I called the hotel directly to arrange for a roll away bed. When I checked in the staff was extremely courteous and I mean EXTREEMLY courteous. Fortunately, they were able to switch me to a room with two queen beds. I understand hotels cannot â€œmakeâ€� a room but it is so easy to be courteous. Unfortunately at a lot of places courteous service seems to be a thing of the past itâ€™s so refreshing when you receive good service nowadays. My room was extremely clean, updated with new bedding, iPhone alarm clock and LCD TV. The bathroom was on the larger side, also as clean as the room. The WiFi signal was very strong and easy to log into. I did notice at some point the rooms all had access to your own small balcony what I liked even more was they were now sealed with windows that were sound proof â€“ especially to me as I donâ€™t sleep well and have sleep apnea. The hotel parking garage is operated by the city of Miami and the first day I was slightly overcharged by the garage. When I inquired about this at the front desk the individual was extremely apologetic for the Cityâ€™s mistake and was insistent they reimburse me. Check out was effortless and all charges were correct and on my departure was greeted by name a wishing me safe travels In summary, great hotel, great location and great service! I highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, needs to be updated.”
Reviews.Author: avapopelectric
Reviews.Content: Check-in was easy and quick; we were given a room on the 6th floor which smelled bad, really bad! We stayed in that room for 2 nights, but on the 3rd night we were ready to cancel our reservation and go to the Intercontinental (stayed there in 2009 and it was great). However, we booked a non-refundable room and they couldn't refund us. But, we were moved to the 23rd floor, where the room didn't smell and we got free breakfast and snacks around 5pm, as well as coffee at all time. The room on the 23rd floor looked a bit better than the one on the 6th, but really, Hyatt needs to update their rooms. The bathroom was tiny and old. The pool is okay but it is small and they should replace the tables with more lounge chairs at they were all taken around 2pm. I have to stay, there is a weird smell even when walking into the hotel. Not sure what it is; I wouldn't know how to describe it. I would have given 1* to the 6th floor, but the 2nd one was better. Service was great and everyone woking at the Hyatt was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “4-star in the 70's”
Reviews.Author: EM0110
Reviews.Content: There is no other way to put it. This place is a dump. There was no valet available when I pulled upat a slow period and the self park garage involves venturing through some underworld to get back to the hotel (don't take the stairs). The front desk was deserted while the two staffers were messing around in the back. My first non-smoking room reeked of smoke. The desk moved me to the hypo allergenic floor where the room admittedly did not smell of smoke. Unfortunately, that is the only positive thing I could say about it. The design is a disaster with some wild west swinging half door creating what is theoretically a closet, the bathrooms are vintage (not in a good way), my toilet was broken and running repeatedly all night, the windows were cloudy from someone having partially ripped off some adhesive coating. To top it all off, the vending machine was stocked wrong and gave me a regular Pepsi when I wanted a diet. Avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special but a great location”
Reviews.Author: tsmd2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency because of its location and we got a great deal for the night. The hotel is nothing special; but it is what it needs to be (they have good service, clean rooms, etc). The location is wonderful; Its right downtown, walking distance to lots of great places. Cab ride to Miami Beach was about $20.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place”
Reviews.Author: Naddd
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before and we just love this place!!! Clean and spacious room, great service and delicious room service:-)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service & staff”
Reviews.Author: Ilana_31
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency hotels are already known as very good ones, but what really impressed me more was the amazing service from the amazing staff. Everybody was so friendly! We didn't receive the room we had ordered because we arrived 8 hours after the expected, so they gave us the best suite they have + free breakfast. A+++

Reviews.Title: “Perfect pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: cabanna59
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, walking distance to restaurants. The rooms are beautiful. They are clean and modern. The front desk staff was very nice. We got it through Priceline so the rate was really good. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was Okay...”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugs204
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is located in downtown Miami, although I got a good price through priceline, the rooms were quite dated and it felt like an older hotel. It also didn't have a pleasent smell Self Parking was around $20 /night which is expected for a business district. I would likely stay somewhere else next time I'm in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Gross and poorly managed.”
Reviews.Author: Noelle153
Reviews.Content: We reserved two double bed rooms at the Hyatt Regency Miami, and upon arrival at 7:30 p.m., we were told that our rooms had not yet been cleaned. We were assured it would be ready soon and offered a free drink at the bar, and assured someone would come get us soon. Well, after an hour of staring at our empty drinks, we went up to the front desk. At the desk the lady did a little fumbling around, typing into a computer, and then says "so, your rooms will not be available, what we have to offer you are some roll away beds, a sofa couch, and a murphy bed." Obviously we were upset, we had made these reservations over three months ago and had confirmations, but the hotel was booked and had nothing else to offer us, so up to the weird club floor non-real bedrooms we went. So those weird murphy bed rooms? Stains on the floor, burnt out lights, large grease stains on the sofa, no comforter, only a sheet, no shampoo, no lotion, nadda. So we called down to ask for pillows, a comforter, etc. at 9:00 p.m. Exhausted and frustrated with this place we went out to dinner. We returned at 12:30 p.m. to, yup, no bedding. I called again, finally someone brought a scratchy thin blanket and one pillow. Are you kidding me? Also, these walls are PAPER thin, not more than 30 minutes of sleep were achieved that night. The next day we got real rooms with real beds. Turns out all of the rooms are dark and riddled with stains. Stains on the floor (was it blood? I don't want to know), stains on the chairs, stains on the sheets. Even worse, there is absolutely no ventilation in these rooms, there are balconies, but a window that is completely sealed off in front of them, rendering them useless. Oh, but what was funny/gross, was the greasy faceprint and set of hands on that window (someone must have really wanted out). The lack of ventilation made the rooms feel damp and smell bad, and on that note, we learned very quickly that if one is to go #2, one goes to the lobby bathroom - no fans in the bathroom. The only positive parts of our stay were the bar and restaurant, the bartenders were very nice, the food was fresh, the view lovely. If only they could make the rooms and hotel services match.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: herburlness
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night here for a Miami Heat game. We loved it!! We loved the rate we got on Priceline even more!! It was so convenient to the arena. We took the people mover to the game and after the game walked over to Bayside to continue our party. It was late by the time we were ready to head back and the people mover had stopped service. So we hoofed it back. It was not near as long of a walk as we thought. It was actually quite pleasant. We stopped at the Opera House and sat on their outside furniture finishing up our drinks we took with us and continued to the hotel. The lobby was very nice and our room was wonderful. The view overlooking the bay from our room was absolutley beautiful! The beds extremely comfortable, I wanted to sleep in all day the next morning. We didnt get to use the pool but it looked nice. Will be going back anytime we are going to be at the arena for a game or concert!

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst stay in my life”
Reviews.Author: demidov48
Reviews.Content: This was the worst stay in my life. And this words are true. I was never in a worse hotel in my life. The smell in the rooms was SO intensive and unpleasent, that we were not able to sleep even with opened room door. The windows were completely locked, and nobody opened them when we asked. we stayed there in summer 2009

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: jardito
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and thoroughly enjoyed my experience. The location was great, close cab ride to South Beach and nice to walk around downtown as well. Service was great, food was great, the conference was a huge success. I will be back if in downtown Miami again.

Reviews.Title: “Good But Doubt I'll Return”
Reviews.Author: MissWorldExplorer
Reviews.Content: We arrived two hours after the check-in time, and were advised that our room was not ready. I ended up speaking to a manager who finally had a room for us 30 minutes later. The staff gave us free breakfast due to the inconvenience they caused us. That was nice! The room was okay. Nothing out of ordinary. It had a musky smell to it but most older hotels do - nowadays. I'm in Miami 6-7 times a year (usually for fun) and I prefer staying in South Beach. The time we spent navigating to South Beach and the parking fees at the hotel ($30.00 a night) were annoying. If in town for the beach, fun, and festivities, stay away from the downtown area and just stay in Miami Beach. It's less stressful and less costly (believe it or not).

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: SCook17
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just needed a place to spend the night after I picked her up from the airport in Miami. The room "suite" had furniture from the 1970's, the room was dirty and the sheets were worn.I even found a straight pin on the carpet that I almost stepped on! Room service took forever, and after calling regarding a computer cord that was left in the room, no one called me back with any information. This place reminds me of an old Holiday Inn!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: Vacation154995
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt July 15th pre cruise trip. Service was excellent, our rooms were uprgraded plus a free breakfast because of a 2 hour delay with checking us in. Will stay there again .. walking distance to alot of the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JKSKFultz
Reviews.Content: I was expecting Hyatt luxury and was greatly disappointed. We stayed before we left on a cruise from Miami. Bathroom was outdated and very small. Beds were okay. Towels were rough. Just not the Hyatt standard we have come to expect. Not a bad place for one night, but not for an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel...the BEST customer service”
Reviews.Author: tnn1970
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time staying at this Hyatt hotel, and just like the first time I stayed, I have nothing but good things to say. I do wish that the rooms had refrigerators though. Maybe some of their rooms have refrigerators, but neither time I've stayed here did my room have a refrigerator. But I really have no complaints at all. Huge hotel. Very elegant. And the staff everywhere in the hotel (from the front desk, to concierge to the bellmen) display the best customer service. It's cheaper to stay downtown in Miami than to stay on the beach, so that's I have stayed in this hotel a couple of times. It's a quick ride down to the beach and an easy walk over to the Biscayne Bay shopping area and restaurants. Perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with great rates”
Reviews.Author: colony
Reviews.Content: Busy, busy hotel, but excellent valet and front desk service upon arrival. Upgraded to a club suite and it was worth it. One minor problem at check in but it was resovled quickly and very efficiently. Location was great. Loved the restaurant. Fabulous wait staff. Attended events at the hotel. Catering staff not as efficient and well trained as restaurant staff.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel and definately will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Deelauren
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a five star hotel for such an amazing price. It was super clean, the rooms were beautiful. The staff very nice. Everything was in walking distance. We go on cruises every year and we always go to ft lauderdale or miami and this hotel absolutely tops everywhere we have stayed, we will always stay at this hotel for now on.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bob34141
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff, great food. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable, the valet parking were friendly and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: CatherineSNewYork
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a suite at this hotel. We found it comfortable and clean. The staff did everything to make our stay pleasurable. The breakfast was very good. The hotel needs some updating, but overall, we had a very nice time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from the Hyatt.”
Reviews.Author: KT121
Reviews.Content: The staff is really nice, the location is nice aside from the smell outside in certain areas. The lobby was amazing, the rooms were not. The carpets were dirty, holes in the sheet. Most channels on the television were static, the bathroom was tiny and the toilet seat was broken, small amount of mold in tub. To top it off my non smoking room smelled like, you guessed it, someone has smoked a carton in it and no one bothered to try to get it out. Beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dij1112
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Miami for a week in May and I would definitely return. All staff members I encountered, especially housekeeping and room service, were polite and lovely. My room was spacious with a nice view, always clean and the staff made me feel very welcome from check in to check out. I would definitely recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good room rates, expensive additional services”
Reviews.Author: Traveltype31
Reviews.Content: Rooms are up to a very good standard, spacy and clean. Good bed and silent airco. Noise isolation not that good, hallway and next door noise is audible but not a big nuisance. Downtown Miami Location is very good, we stayed for $120 per night and had a 75$ budget booked via expedia which we used for the breakfast buffet ($18 per person) which is up to a good standard. Valet parking is expensive at $30 a night, nearby parking lot asks $19 for 24 hours. On a short walk to the Berkill region you'll find some excellent restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Miami home away from home......”
Reviews.Author: arstenor
Reviews.Content: I have made this hotel my second home as I travel to Miami twice a month. The staff remembers me by name and actually remembered the name of my dog on the last visit. The location is great with easy highway access, which is a big plus. The last plug I have is the tap beer in the bar is Stella, my favorite........staying again tonight! LOL

Reviews.Title: “Very good location downtown attached to convention center”
Reviews.Author: Tampawolverine
Reviews.Content: Always stay here for work when working in Miami. Consistant service however high parking fees but worth the price. Great value in low season.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Downtown”
Reviews.Author: globalflyereal
Reviews.Content: I had to attend a conference at this hotel in June 2011 for two nights. I chose to check-in via the kiosk and it was a great service...I love self service kiosks. The hotel is located at the convention center. Downtown Miami has really turned around and quite nice! Really felt safe! The hotel is quite old and showing its age at least in terms of the guest rooms. They really do need renovations and the noise in the hallways are quite loud. All in all it is a great hotel. With a little facelift it could go quite far.

Reviews.Title: “Service and ambiance make this a good, not yet great, Hyatt.”
Reviews.Author: Louis59
Reviews.Content: Service at the front desk and in the restaurant and lounge outlets is what makes this a good Hyatt to visit. Curtis, the desk staff member, walked around from behind the desk to shake my hand and welcome me, and to give me my keys and information on the hotel. Katie, the waitress, apologized when the wine we ordered at dinner was not available and brought back a better choice, at a lower price. Andres, a food & beverage manager, came to the table to introduce himself, ask about dinner, and engage us in a discussion about our favorite wines. Everyone we encountered at the hotel was as friendly and helpful as could be. As previous reviewers have said, the hotel is dated and rather worn. The front desk staff did tell me tonight that the hotel will be proceeding with bathroom upgrades shortly, which are very much needed. The guestrooms are generally well appointed, with flat screen TV, single-cup coffee makers, wireless internet (at $9.95 per 24H) and clock/radio with iPod docking station. The bed is comfortable, a/c adequate. Curiously, while the bed sheets are smooth as silk and of obvious high quality, the towels approximate sandpaper â€“ hard, scratchy, small, and thin â€“ not what one would expect at a Hyatt. The lobby is â€œcoolâ€� and workable, with interesting dÃ©cor, ample space to move around, high energy music at an appropriate level, and â€œwe proudly serve Starbucksâ€� coffee easily available. The food and beverage quality in the restaurants is far better than the average hotel outlets, no doubt a result of the hotelâ€™s general manager being promoted from food & beverage director, according to the hotel staff. This is one hotel where itâ€™s actually a treat to stay and enjoy the restaurant. Try the mojito Chilean sea bass for a tasty, unusual dinner. All in all, the hotel is solid and once the needed renovations are completed, it will regain its place among the most enjoyable hotels in downtown Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal does not adequately describe it!!”
Reviews.Author: JaniceWa
Reviews.Content: This was the most fantastic hotel stay of my life. It was like being in a fairy-tale where everything goes right (just about!). It was our 29th wedding anniversary and we had bought tickets for a concert at a venue near the Hyatt. We had flown 7 hours to have a long weekend in Miami and see the concert so we were disappointed that our king room wasn't ready. We waited an hour and a half and I was cranky. When I went back to the desk to find out what happened to our room, Kaitlin at the front desk immediately upgraded us to a suite, which was ready and waiting. We also realized that the Hyatt is attached to the James L. Knight Center where our concert was. We only had to walk through the hotel to get to it. On the night of the concert we were having some drinks at Pure Verde bar in the hotel and mentioned to one of the staff (Andres Gonzalez-Iski) we were there for our 29th anniversary and were going to the Ruben Blades y Gilberto Santarosa concert. He gave us champagne and desert and chatted with us about the concert. The next night we saw Andres again and he gave us two more glasses of champagne. Lyn was our server and she was great. We had such a fantastic time and these small things just made for the nicest anniversary we have ever had. I am still waiting to wake up and find out this phenomenal experience was not real (but IT WAS!!) If you get the chance to stay here at this Hyatt--do it. Don't hesitate. I'll be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Not good in any sense.”
Reviews.Author: Juanfer79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the same building of the convention center and they leverage on that fact to attract customers. But that means that when there is an event the hotel is overcrowded and the service is far from a 4Star requirement. The rooms smell old and humid. I sent a package prior to my arrival, call them in advance the day the package was arriving and still they managed to make me wait for 50 minutes, so they can fin it. I also left a book in my room but apperenly it was mistaken with garbage because they couldn't find it. If I have they choice I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location low class guests dangerous area”
Reviews.Author: jimena68
Reviews.Content: Looks good, only from outside.the hallways are darkgive the sensation of dirtyness and old.the rooms had a balcony, now they are sealed out.,noisy,not clean, at all, for what they charge, its a ripp off.mades are always screaming each other on hallways...i do not recomen it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business but not pleasure”
Reviews.Author: KeithnAlly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in Muami for work. Hotel Is clean and nice but not what I expected from a Hyatt Regency. I am Platinum with Hyatt so chose to stay here while there but regretted it quickly. Unless you pay for the valet parking the parking garage next door is really scary for a woman traveling alone. Dark, dirty and lots of unsavory people around. Nothing is within walking distance or at least that is what the concierge told me. I basically ate in my hotel room or the hotel restaurant the whole trip. The food was very good. If going to Miami to have funor see the sites I suggest staying on Biscayne or maybe even South Beach depending on what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Latoya10025
Reviews.Content: Horrible, Horrible, Horrible...Never will stay there again, I called to make a reservation they said there were rooms available I would be able to walk in and do an over the counter reservation. I get there and they tell me it's sold out, I called reservations again and they told me they had plenty of rooms, i made the reservations through the phone went back up to guest services and they checked me into a room with a molded bathroom, then moved me up to another bathroom which was molded as well.....I just won't never stay here or at any hyatt...The JW Marriott Marquis was the best....=)!

Reviews.Title: “About what you'd expect from a Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: SunshineStateGuy
Reviews.Content: The place is a little dated. The room design is very awkward and you will immediately say, "What were they thinking?". It was clean and comfortable, lots of places to sit. The shower was a tub/shower combo, not my favorite. No fridge, and the balcony is like: "PSYCH"! Trying to open it is like pulling the sword from the stone. I've since learned they sealed them shut during a construction project in the past. It's a shame because I had a nice view with a corner room facing the waterway and the bay. The pool kind of looks like something form Friday the 13th. It is small and too shady. No hot tub. Staff seems friendly and genuinely caring. Parking is the usual super duper expensive, 30 for valet or 12 per come and go in self parking. The location is okay, but you could find better in the area. Perhaps closer to the bayside. This hotel is not bad, but I probably would not choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to the Chilean Consulate,”
Reviews.Author: Sav-Knight
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it is very close to the Chilean Consulate, walking distance in fact. Everything was great and reasonably priced for the area. we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to hate, nothing to love”
Reviews.Author: paulwoe
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is in an awkward location in downtown Miami ... not the beach, not the arts district, not the residential core ... once you're there, you're simply just "there". It's a basic, business class hotel that probably draws a lot of it's business from the attached conference center and auditorium. Upon arrival, valet parking was a challenge since they had a sign out that said it was full, but they waved me up and took my car; one wonders about the folks who don't push to get in. The lobby is quite impressive if anonymous in the way most shopping malls are anonymous. Check in was swift. The room (on the 8th floor, overlooking the drawbridge) was suprisingly dark for Miami, and that bridge was noisy through the night. While the furnishings were updated and in good shape, the room simply felt "tired", The bath/dressing area was awkward (saloon half doors separating the dressing area that was half walled off from the sleeping area. Fortunately there was good wi-fi because the outlet by the desk did not function, so if one wished to use it, the choice was to plug in computer or the desk light -- not both. Food service was solid. Friday eve is fajita night so a coworker joined me in the bar for mojitos and fajitas; better than average for mid priced hotel dining, and the two for one drinks were good. Breakfast buffet was modest, but sufficient. Final impression was not great -- I got in my car and at my first stop had to pay to park and all of the quarters I leave in the ashtray for meters were gone!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable but unmemorable”
Reviews.Author: lorexstevex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Miami for two nights as part of our honeymoon in April 2011. We arrived fairly late at night but both check in and the restaurant were open. We were also able to book an Everglades tour with pick up from the hotel for the next morning. The room was bigger than we expected, with a large window, comfy bed and nice bathroom. The view wasn't anything special. There was no fridge in the room - or if there was, we couldn't find it. We stayed on a weekend and as the hotel is in the middle of the city business area, there wasn't much open in terms of shops or restaurants. However there was a bus stop nearby so we took a bus to and from South Beach. It did take some time but we were happy to save money on a taxi. On the first night, we had the paella buffet dinner at the restaurant and the meals were large, satisfying and well priced. On the second night, we ordered room service and while the soup was average, the burger was the best I tasted in the US. There was nothing wrong with this hotel - it was good value, the restaurant food was tasty and the staff were helpful - but there is also nothing to set it apart as it has a large, impersonal, conference feel. I'd say it is good for short stays or business trips but if you want a more touristy experience stay at the more expensive South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: radiolarian
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stopover on my way to Nassau. besides being a first class hotel on 2 occasions during my visit the staff made a very posititve impression. First, i arrived late, had work to do so I ordered room service. The total came to $31.00 so when the meal came I pulled 2 bills out od my pocket to pay and began to enjoy my dinner. Within a few minutes theere was a knock onmy door inquiring if I had realized I had given a 50 and a 20. ( I thought I had pulled out 2 20's. From my perspective this was beyond expectations and i will choose Hyatt when I can because of the staff honesty. Second event was the next morning when the bell staff was extremely helpful to me getiing a fedex document shipped to the UK. This was 5 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff, very clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ashman13
Reviews.Content: The most helpfull and friendly staff I have ever experienced in a hotel. They went out of their way to help us through an emergency health scare with our son. I will be staying there again when I am in Miami. Rooms were prestine, comfortable beds. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “went out there way to accommodated us”
Reviews.Author: tracy54
Reviews.Content: travel day was May 21 2011, over nite stay before cruising to the Bahamas. We drove from Macon Ga and arrive at the hotel at 10:30 AM, pretty much thought we had to wait to get to the room because of other reviews , our room was ready, when ask why we where here i told the receptions it was taking my mother on a cruise for her birthday, she told me she would send my mom something , i thought maybe a flower are some candy , they sent my mother a bottle of white wine @ salsa and chips for free. what serive , the car car valet was 30.00 a day but trust me it was worth it each time you wanted your car they just being it to you, and on the floor where we where the 23rd floor we had contential brunch , supper @ breakreast , what a treat, will use a gain if ever in the city of miamai

Reviews.Title: “Bathrooms need refurbishing badly; a cockroach on the buffet table greeted us upon arrival.”
Reviews.Author: honilandia
Reviews.Content: HOWEVER, this being said, I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, and the public transportation to be close by and convenient. The bed was extremely comfortable and we did not get bedbugs. The walls are thin, as in most hotels, and we heard loud conversations and arguments next door. South Beach was easily reached by a $2.00 bus.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was better than several negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: RBStubbs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two (2) nights prior to a cruise. After making the reservation through Priceline, I then read several reviews, some good, some bad. Our overall experience was definately above average. Got to the hotel about 2:30 PM and had reserved a non-smoking king room. None were available and they looked to see if a suite was available. One was available on the 17th flloor and since the room was pre-paid, we expected to be offered the room at an additional cost which did not happen. They gladly upgraded us (and another couple who checked in with our group 1 hour later). Needless to say, the staff were very helpful. The room had a nice view and layout. I wished there was a fridge but there wasn't. The carpet was a little dirty but didn't impact our stay. The pool area was clean, water nice and clear, bar service was very fast. Ate breakfast in their dining room and although the buffet was a little pricey, it was what was expected in this type of hotel. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tippi_K
Reviews.Content: I got a really good deal on this hotel through Priceline but was worried about bed bugs due to some previous reviews. However, the room was very clean and bed bug free thankfully. Rooms are tidy and have your basic needs, but are a bit outdated compared to the lobby area. They have internet access but there is a fee. The hotel is within walking distance to the Bayside Market for food and shopping and a short taxi ride to South Beach. I got my money's worth through Priceline but don't think that I'd pay full price for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location downtown - great service”
Reviews.Author: urbandivaLondon
Reviews.Content: The location was very convenient and close to lots of shopping and food places. The hotel itself needed a refresh and TLC, but was comfortable enough. What made the stay great was the staff and service. They were very helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble! Shame there was no free wi-fi, it is a paid for service and quite expensive which was dissappointing. Otherwise, had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, Excellent staff made it a treat.”
Reviews.Author: rtw123
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, there was no King Bed available, so we had to stay with two full-size beds, but the receptionist gave us $50 food credit, which was nice. The next day there was a mix-up with moving us to a room with a king bed, but the supervisor put us on the club level with free breakfast and free hors d'oeuvres and gave us two coupons for free drinks, albeit the room was still two full size beds. But, the freebies made up for all other stuff. So, very good experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of wifi charges!”
Reviews.Author: hugnm
Reviews.Content: If you use your iphone and laptop to connect to the wifi in this hotel, you will be charged twice, even if you bill it to your room for the same 24 hour period.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very enjoyiable hotel. Clean room, room service was excellent! The only inconvienance was the parking lot for the hotel. As a guest you have to pay leaving the lot every time as a normal visiter, it's not near the hotel you have to walk about 5-10 min away from hotel to get to your car. Overaul it was a good experience I will recommend to friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “All in All not Bad”
Reviews.Author: lochman88
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights post cruise April 16th, Hotel lobby very nice, helpful staff, quick and efficient check in. We were in a room on the 7th floor overlooking the front of the hotel. A little noisy due to the busy road in front of the hotel. The room was spacious with a very comfortable big bed, standard items in room sofa armchair desk etc. Other reviewers have commented on strange smells and indeed there was in our room also, smokers in the room perhaps? But with the air conditioning on it almost disappeared. The dÃ©cor just seems a little tired just needs brightening up a little as the milky coffee colour used in all the corridors and in the rooms is a little boring. Staff in the hotel restaurant were very polite and helpful, although the food was just average. There were no bed bugs in our bed or room and would have no problem recommending this hotel as a pre cruise place to stay. It is just a short walk down to the Bayfront Park and Bayside Market also a short taxi ride to the cruise terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Property”
Reviews.Author: mrspeta
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for two nights before leaving on a cruise out of Miami and we could not have been treated better. Everyone was very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “The staff did my trip...”
Reviews.Author: JanH15
Reviews.Content: ... perfect. The airline company, Delta had lost my luguage and I didn't get i back until my vacation was over and I was back home. The story starts here: The staff help me with everything I needed, the food was good, room was big and nice and the rest of the hotell was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay on Miami's river walk!”
Reviews.Author: LeBois
Reviews.Content: A very nice stay on Miami's river walk! We had a delightful stay at the Hyatt Regency Miami for a one night post cruise experience. We arrived early from the ship and the hotel took our phone number and made some suggestions for a short walking tour. We found a great Nicaraguan restaurant just a couple blocks away with fabulous fresh-baked rolls, a hearty split pea soup, shrimp with jalapeÃ±o, and delightful Cuban coffee. By the time lunch was through, our room was ready. We were presented with keys to the VIP Suite on the 23rd floor which is the Regency Club floor (key-protected in the elevator) The suite (it's actually two very different connecting rooms that wrap the corner of the building) is beyond spacious and includes a bedroom with a very comfortable king bed, living area, desk, bath, and a walk in closet. The connecting living room had a large dining table for four, an additional full bath, and a large living area. The highlight of this suite is the commanding views from the seemingly endless windows that envelop the entire suite. Both couches have a fold-out bed.Â  We appreciated that the room was completely "set" when we arrived. The lights and music were all just right and there was a lovely food and wine pairing ready to be enjoyed compliments of the General Manager. A much-appreciated gracious touch. As I mentioned, this is the club floor so there was a nice evening offering of hot and cold foods including asparagus wrapped in phyllo and grilled peppers in the lounge down the hall. It was nice to have this just a few steps from the suite.Â  The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially Jessica at the front desk and Winston at the bell desk. You could tell they would do whatever it takes to make your stay special. Thank you to the staff of the Hyatt Regency Miami for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel Stay in Downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: irieisle
Reviews.Content: Note: I am a picky traveler since I am on the road about 60% of the time. I would stay here again if I had to but it wouldn't be my first choice. I am not a fan of the layout of the rooms (see pics) with a demi-wall separating the sink and bathroom areas. Closet is a wallk-in to give you more room for clothes and luggage. I had to switch rooms because the original room had a smoker in it. I couldn't bear that for 3 days so the front desk staff patiently helped me find another room. I don't like to be near the elevators (noise) so I was given a room at the end of the hall and it was very quiet. I also got an upgraded room with a view of the river - this is the plus about this hotel in that the staff really does their best to make you happy! I used the gym - modern and clean - but a little small. A co-worker later told me that all guests are welcome to use the commercial gym across the street and that it was very nice. Valet is expensive but the runners are great. Overall, decent hotel but don't expect luxurious accommodations. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “How could you?”
Reviews.Author: stet44
Reviews.Content: Service is great; every and all of the staff could not be more generous of spirit and enthusiasm. Sadly, other than the most visible, namely the lobby, the rooms are in much need of renovation and, disgustedly, a large amount of chlorine; there was mold in the shower, dead bugs in the over sink lamp, and overpaints on chipped paint; I may well have been staying in a HoJo on 34th St, Manhattan, i.e., crap. All that aside from the fact that there was no fridge..., not even an alarm clock. Again, the staff were great all around: at the Reg desk, main restaurant, and valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “What a way to vacate!”
Reviews.Author: keeshagurl
Reviews.Content: Dont want ot be in the heart of it all, need your peace and quiet in the day and stillw ant to light up the night!, Then check into this Hyatt Regency, you have the best of both worlds. The staff is so attentive and the rooms are QUIET, Neat and CLEAN, you may bot want to leave! I was meeting my girls for a Girlfriend trip, but wanted a few days of peace before the party began. Staying here in the Miami Suite over looking the Bay ave me just the retreat i was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: ccouls01
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel on March 24, 2011. We woke up in the morning and found bed bugs!!! YUCK!!! Immediately went to another hotel. Bed bugs are extremely difficult to get rid of if you get them into your home. Other complaints: Pool is very small and the hotel is not in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the big bucks!”
Reviews.Author: IRENE206
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights prior to us cruising on Celebrity Eclipse on March 17 + 18, 2011. What a big mistake, don't be fooled by the elegant foyer! The room was not ready so we left our luggage with the pushy porter and went exploring. When we arrived and walked into our room the smell almost knocked me over! The carpet was worn and dirty and the bathroom needed a "make-over", very old and the shower curtain was gross. I asked on 3 different occasions to please spray the room with some freshener, they of course did not comply and it triggered a migraine. Don't spend the big bucks, find another hotel, I am so sorry that I stayed at this Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Tishani
Reviews.Content: This hotel is average, nice reception very large and most of the concierge were helpful. Found the rooms to be ok, they are dated but the beds were very comfortable. Shower room was good and everyhitng was pretty clean! had a look at the pool, but didnt go in, it looked very basic. I enjoyed the breakfast, sime of the hot food wasnt brilliant but they are happy to make you whatever you want and they are all so friendly! We went there around christmas time and this hotel was one of the cheaper options, all in all i would go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Do NOT Recommend”
Reviews.Author: STfromCT
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at nicer hotels during college spring break 2 decades ago. I expected more from the Hyatt chain and assume our meetings planner had no idea how horrible the rooms actually were. This place was obviously very old and (despite what I was told was a recent remodel) the rooms definitely felt like they had seen better years. I am usually not a picky traveler but my room, as well as the rooms of a dozen colleagues also on this business trip, smelled very damp and the scent was covered up by a lot of powdery Febreze-smelling air freshener. I appreciate the effort but the rugs were spongy and moist. The showers did not drain (and this is based on multiple reports of my colleagues as well as my own personal experience). During my stay there was a CSI Miami incident at the hotel and one business colleague walked out of his room to a pile of dog defecation (I could not make this stuff up!). I asked the concierge for some assistance at the desk and he was supposed to follow-up with me with some recommendations that never came. The only bright note was the restaurant food and service were actually very good. But would not stay there ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: KK50HHC
Reviews.Content: It had been years since I went to Miami and the Hyatt, what a change for the better. Great lobby, bar and restaurant. Renovation of all these areas was outstanding. Would go back in a split second. Great service, genuine approach by each staff member.

Reviews.Title: “Super rooms, Super Service, but far from south beach”
Reviews.Author: Tanmay
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, rooms and the staff. Reception staff were really great specially Shavonne, she gave us a free upgrade to a mini suite. The room was really very large and plush. We were on 17th floor, so it had great view of the marina. Comfortable living room area. There was a separate closet area along with the bathroom, which was useful. Hotel was also grand and huge. It was very clean. It is attached to a conference and exhibition hall. The downtown inner circle skybus station is interconnected to the hotel through a covered walkway, which is helpful to travel around downtown. There is also an Enterprise Car Rental office in the hotel, which was easy to hire a car for Key West. Though Miami's public transport system is among the worst, access to South Beach is difficult from the hotel, unless you take taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eventplanner99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business meeting a few weeks ago. Considering this is Miami, I've definitely stayed at a few hotels that are nicer than this one. It's adequate for meetings and such if you're a business traveler and is ideal if you want a downtown location instead of being in South Beach. I thoght it was fairly expensive considering it's not on the beach, which slightly lowered my rating of this hotel

Reviews.Title: “One night stay before cruise”
Reviews.Author: chaz34
Reviews.Content: Good location for stays before or after a cruise, within walking distance to Bayside Market Place, a little scary at night. Short drive to Port of Miami. Rooms are clean and spacious enough for two. Small Breakfast buffet and expensive, food quality below average. Front desk service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: ColoKids
Reviews.Content: Very elegant hotel. The rooms were very clean, well decorated and more comfortable than most. We were there on New Years Eve, not intending to party as we had to be at airport at 4am (not nice), but despite that it wasn't surprisingly loud. Great service in room, bar and restaurant. Very accomodating and beds very comfy. Quick ride from Cruise ships and airport and easy walk (if you are in good health) to the Marketplace for food and shopping. Even though the price was steep by our standards, it was average for the area. We would easily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: radams_199
Reviews.Content: Nice Rooms, most of the staff were friendly. I liked the security of guests having to use the room key to go on the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, great service”
Reviews.Author: Suitcasers
Reviews.Content: Pros: probably most comfortable sleep, close to monorail and shopping. Cons: not much to do in the area on a sunday evening as most places are closed. We stayed here after a cruise and the hotel was great. Clean, quick check-in/ check-out, spacious standard room, very comfortable beds, concierge was very friendly. Location was close to monorail which is pretty convenient for bus to/from airport. We got a great price and if we need to stay in the business area would likely choose here because it is connected to a conference centre. The exterior and lobby are not spectacular, but the sleep is definitely worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review...”
Reviews.Author: ToughCritic4Sure
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after coming off a weekend 3 day cruise. I am a Platinum member, and so I stayed using my Hyatt Points. Check in was flawless and quick. I received an early check in (9am) which I purchased prior to arrival, and then also received a room upgrade to a nice suite. The lobby area was very nice, and the bartenders very friendly. The pool is next to the river, and there is a LOT of city noise and boat traffic/clanging bells for the nearby drawbridge, etc. If you're going for poolside, bring your ipod to drown it out (I didn't hear much from inside my room though). The pool area was clean and well-maintained. Waited a long time for the food/beverage folks to bring me ice water. 25 minutes the first time, 35 minutes (and then a reminder call) the second time. A bartender brought out a sample frozen drink for folks to try one time - that was nice and it was delicious! OK, back to the room. I was SURPRISED to see one of the pillow cases on the bed with at least 7 or 8 VISIBLE holes in it. I cannot believe their housekeeping staff could have missed this! One of the bed throw pillows also had a hole in it (cigarette burn?). Bathroom had four dark hairs visible - one still stuck to the side of the bathtub, two on the floor, and one large and long one on the bathroom counter. Yuck. Attention to detail is clearly not their forte. Bathroom door needed to be painted, baseboards as well, and bathroom door could not reliably be opened from the inside (nothing like getting locked in your bathroom with no phone to call out!). Such a pity, as a quick paint brush and a maintenance guy would have fixed these obvious/glaring ugly spots and mechanical issues. Again, attention to detail lacking. Bed was EXTREMELY comfortable. There was a clock radio next to it with an iPod docking station. Nice. Never could get TV remote to work accurately...trying to check out impossible via TV for this reason. Room temp hard to cool down. Had on 66 and there is no way it got much lower than 70/71. Friend came to visit, and parked his car in front of the hotel via the valet. Six hours later when he left it was a $60 parking bill. Seriously? $60? Capitol Grille is across the street - walking distance. We could have driven there and valet parked for FREE with restaurant validating. Gift shop had limited selection of items. Fitness center VERY small. Basic equipment. Front desk staff were extremely pleasant - always greeted me by name - very friendly. Very professional and beautiful African American woman checked me in. She was very classy. Did not get her name, but she was fabulous. Double billed on my room upgrade...had to call and get this corrected - which they did with no big problem. Overall it was ok, but not what I expected from a Hyatt in one of their best rooms at what they charge. Probably would stay there again but it wouldn't be my first choice for the money? To note: Hyatt to Miami Airport in a taxi is approximately $24 plus tip (about 15 - 20 minutes away if you are not in rush hour). It's not far from the cruise port (about 2 miles) but in the rush hour traffic a taxi cost about $15). This hotel is connected directly to the convention center. I could see a sliver of the Bay from my room. Beach is a long way away. There is an Avis rental car shop not far from the hotel. WIFI is $9.99 for a 24 hour period. Seriously? At what they charge it should be FREE. At least in their lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: traveler6376
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband while attending a convention in Miami. The hotel was right downtown just off of the highway. The staff was excellent. Every person I dealt with went above and beyond to make me feel comfortable. They were always pleasant, polite and helpful. As soon as we stepped outdoors the bell hops called a taxi for us. We never had to wait. There is a nice little river walk outdoors on the back side of the hotel and a nice little cafe to buy breakfast items to go. There were a few minor drawbacks. The furniture could use a bit of updating (though the bed was very comfortable). There was no internet access unless you paid a fee for the in-room hook up and brought your own lap top, and the resturant was pricey. The superbowl was on and was blocked on the televisions in the room. In order to see it we had to go to the bar. As soon as the Superbowl was over the channel was unblocked. Also this hotel is right downtown and you do hear airplanes flying overhead at night occasionally. Overall though, this hotel was fine and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I won't be returning”
Reviews.Author: sweetebear345
Reviews.Content: First of all I did not realize that the hotel is over a half hour from the beach. It was a headache to rent a car and spent way more money on parking than originally anticipated. The beds are very comfortable and the room was big but the bathroom looked like it was falling apart. The first morning we ordered breakfast from room service...never again... it took over 30 minutes the eggs were runny, the bacon was undercooked and everything was cold. I normally like hyatt but this one I will not be returning to

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Pre-Cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: webster117
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of nights before boarding our cruise ship. The restaurant for lunch was fantastic. Their birgers and appetizers were the best. I read a lot of bad reviews about the service, but since we were out most of the time, we didn't run into the staff enough. Our room was clean during our stay, although we didn't get a knock on the door for room service which I would expect every day especially from a hyatt. Overall.. Great stay. Convenient location close to cruise lines, but away from the miami beach scene. Great service and food at the restaurant with beautiful views of the ships passing in the canal.

Reviews.Title: “The Epitomy of Absolute NO bang for the buck, and lies, lies, lies”
Reviews.Author: LR12
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with a group for a school residency for 2 weeks there. There are no words to describe my dissatisfaction, including dissatisfactions expressed from fellow students. From day 1, it was a barage of lies, poor customer service, dissatisfactory assistance, and questionable professionalism. When I called to reserve my room, I was informed I would not be charged one dime until I checked out. Throughout the entire thing, myself, my roommate, and many other attendees were charged 1000.00 holds on our cards (multiple times), with no calls to authorize this-and many, like myself were running on a debit card. So, until the holds were released, there were no funds in our accounts. Nothing was signed to authorize this. We were promised a continental breakfast every morning-this too, was a lie. I was told 'there was a glitch in the system'. I was told by many of my colleagues that their rooms were not cleaned, and bugs were found. Many of us developed food poisoning, presumably from the hotel lounge, and many were very ill. The cleaning supplies this hotel uses are putrid, and are very difficult to breathe in in certain common areas. The gym is incredibly small for an establishment this large, and a preverbial sweat shop where you had to stand in line religiously to use a machine-even at 6:00 a.m. I for one, and I know for certain many others, will never stay in a Hyatt regency again. For being such a large corporation name, and for being as costly as it was, I expected more. I was severly dissapointed, and would advise anyone needing to stay in the greater downtown Miami area to find other accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Room 2012- The room from HELL”
Reviews.Author: flacachula
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel to find a Pubic Hair hell.... From just walking into this Ghetto room you can see the mess of pubic hair all over the place, From the walls in the bathroom and on top of a made bed- it was like someone went pubic hair confetti.... I have lived and traveled to alot of 3rd world countires and have NEVER seen such a nasty nasty room- and yes it was a Hyatt... Imagine that? We call the front desk to have a very patient young lady try to help me...So her first words to me was, I can send someone to clean the room and bathroom- I then told her, with all the pictures I have just taken and the love I have to write reviews maybe you should think twice before sending a housekeeper to this room.... One minute later, I was told that they have a cleaner room for us- did I mention we checked in at 4am.... So before they send us to the new room they went to check on it... Of course overlooking the fact that all of there rooms look the same- Like CRAP only this room had no pubic hair mess.... They did give us late check out and the comped our parking $12.00... I have to admit that they did some upgrades to the lobby but forgot about the rooms.... I have lived in Miami my entire life and moved away 10 yrs ago.... I can tell you that this hotel lost 2 stars about 20 years ago... it should be a 2.5 star hotel.... nothing higher... I would NEVER EVER even think about sending anyone to this hotel.... NEVER and forget about the location- you cant even open the sliding glass doors as they are bolted shut... to enjoy the semi nice views of downtown.....

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt was perfect for our purposes”
Reviews.Author: WJ912001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in December, prior to embarking on a cruise from Port of Miami. The hotel's location, between MIA and the port was ideal for our needs. Taxi was $16 from the airport. Check-in was efficient, and we were even upgraded to a suite! Our room was a bit oddly shaped (triangular), but had an expansive wall of floor-to-ceiling windows. We faced the intracoastal waterway and had a nice view of boats going up and down the river. Also a good amount of sunlight in the morning. The room's decor was intriguing...mostly modern funishings (bed, desk, pullout couch, flat screen swivel TV), but a few reminders from the 90s remained (armchair, pillar in middle of room encased in --was that formica??). Wifi was available, but unfortunately, only for a fee. The bathroom, along with the room, was clean and well-maintained. For dinner, we walked across the street to dine at Zuma, a Japanese restaurant at the Epic hotel. Although pricey, it was no more than a 5 minute walk and absolutely worth it. Checkout was also extremely easy, and the hotel manager was friendly and courteous. We inquired about the nearest Bank of America ATM, and he directed us to take the tunnel to the Bank of America tower. Unfortunately, the ATM there is no longer affiliated with BofA, so we traipsed a few blocks around downtown Miami before heading back to the hotel. To be honest, downtown is not very pretty nor tourist-friendly, but guests should not fault Hyatt for its location. If you're looking for South Beach, book a hotel in South Beach! All in all, we were very satisfied with our stay and the level of accommodation. If I had business in downtown Miami or needed to be near the port, I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff, downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: runlolaLebanon
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through priceline, so we didn't have much of a choice about picking the hotel. We wanted to stay in south beach to be in the middle of the action but after all we are glad that we didn't stay there. the room was very clean, spacious and had a nice view over the downtown. At the reception we were greeted by Rhonda who was very sweet, helpful, and pleasant, she put us on the executive floor and eventhough we didn't pay anything extra, we still had the free breakfast for two days. there is no free internet in the room, and that's not very appropriate for a 4star. The parking is a pain, and we had to pay $12.5 for an overnight parking, but once you park you can't take out the car again, if you do then it will be $2per hour (after 6pm) which is honestly not so bad (when you live in chicago). the location of the hotel is very practical if you are in town for business or for shopping, we didn't care much about staying in south beach because it's very touristy and crowded and we didn't care much about the beach (it was raining anyway). the staff in the hotel is extremly helpful and polite, eventhough the hotel was packed, we were still getting a great service, the receptionist recommended a great pizza delivery place for dinner. in one word, the hotel is very "practical" . Some people might find the parking to be a problem, but honestly we come from chicago and there is no way that a hotel in downtown will give you free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: ndntelliott
Reviews.Content: I won this bid for a 4 star hotel thru priceline. I was some what disappointed with my room. The front desk staff were nice and helpful. The lobby and front of hotel were very appealing. I was abotu to go to bed and checked my bed around 8:00pm. There was hair all in the bed and the pillow cases were dirty. I immediately called housekeeping. It took abotu 30 minutes before 2 ladies who barely spoke englsh came to change my linen, That meant that the bed had not been cleaned. Had I not checked it, I would have slept on the same dirty sheets someone else slept on. I was afraid to take a shower becasue the tub did not look clean. The carpet was filthy and I had to walk around with slippers on. Could not relax because the room next to me had a lot of noise. I called the front desk and complained however noise continued. The self parking lot did not look safe at all. The breakfast food in the lobby restaurant was very pricey. I went out into the neighborhood for breakfast and was amazed at the sites. Homeless people were everywhere and the sidewalks smelled of urine. I expected more for a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nabilaer
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. All the staff were nothing less than phenomenal. From the staff at the check in desk, to the housekeeping staff everyone was very professional and could not do enough for you. I want to mention Madge and Eric, who made sure our breakfast was wonderful . Our room was beautiful. I could not have picked a nicer place to stay and when we return to Miami , we will stay here again. Thank you Bill and Nancy

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service - Average Room”
Reviews.Author: mayaya11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay here. For a 4 star hotel the room was slightly disappointing. It was clean enough, but the little things like stains on the bed spread and carpet did not warrant 4 stars. The location is great and if I was on a business trip im sure the facilities would have been convenient. What I would return for is the service. The staff were, friendly, helpful, and very kind. They gave advise on where to go and what to see and do and when I fell ill and had to extend my stay they very quickly found a room at a nearby hotel (as they were full) and arranged for us the check in at 6a.m. I haven't seen such genuine niceness from hotel staff in a long time and for this reason I would stay again. One last thing - if you are going to use the valet service ($30 a day) it is worth not having the hassle of parking in downtown Miami BUT call down in advance to retrieve your car. Waiting 1 hour in the morning for the car was not fun, granted it was at check out time.

Reviews.Title: “Much better deal possible”
Reviews.Author: cjc029
Reviews.Content: I got reservation at this hotel via price line bid system. This hotel charges $12.50 for parking which was not included in the original bid price when I booked the hotel via price line. While checking-in I saw another group of customer who realized that they have to shell out more money for multiple entry back into the parking. The hotel management told the customers that they should have gone with valet parking if they had planned to do multiple entries ($30), sounding indignant that they have to deal with such cheap issues. Further it charges another $11/day for wireless internet. This hotel is in smack downtown area and it charges for this basic services which would be needed by 80% of its customer. Further there are no simpler option like being able to access wireless service for 1-2 hour which is all that most of the customer actually needs. A 4 star hotel should be making money via providing a better stay experience rather then publicizing teaser rates and then charging for everything else. I would have never stayed in this place had it not been for the teaser rates. It is a disgrace to Hyatt brand. It would be a high time for them to rethink there business model. An interesting thing which I noticed was that the trash bin in the room and under the sink etc. do not have plastic liner in it. i.e. the trash touches the plastic container itself. I do not think that it is hygienic at all.

Reviews.Title: “I caught scabies and informed hotel. They never called me back! YUCK!”
Reviews.Author: staceyhall07
Reviews.Content: This was my worst vacation EVER! Scabies is like lice. The hotel doesn't clean there comforters. My husband and I stayed there one night in Nov. the next day I woke up and was very ichy. I thought it was the soup so we thought it would go away. Within a few days I was covered in bumps. When I got home I went to the emergency room and the Dr. told me I have scabies. My whole family had to be treated for it and my home. They invade everything. Your house and other people. It's disgusting. I called the hotel and wrote them to let them know and they never contacted me back. This hotel is the dirty!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lalaelaine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Miami for the art fair with that was there this past weekend. We were looking for a downtown hotel and thought the Hyatt would be a good choice because of the location and for their reputation. This is the worst Hyatt I have ever been to. The lobby was beautiful , but when you got to your room, it was like a 1 star hotel. The towels were threadbare and they gave us one washcloth. I guess we were supposed to share. The bathrooms was nasty looking. These rooms need a big re-do. We would never choose this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Good only for corporate travelers”
Reviews.Author: sammyHou
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here if you have kids or are visiting Miami for leisure. Parking is expensive (even after the hotel knocks off $7), the rooms are not that great - we got two full size beds (for 2 adults and 2 kids), No Fridge/Microwave, everything costs $$ - internet access, use of business center (printing), Breakfast. We stayed here for 2 nights after spending 4 nights at Hampton Inn Dadeland (which is perfect and very reasonable). Should not have moved, what a regret.

Reviews.Title: “worst Hyatt I have ever stayed at..Period!”
Reviews.Author: tampabuckeye
Reviews.Content: Room. As soon as I opened the door, the smell hit me immediately. Mold & Smoke. The carper was filthy. The brown & yellow decor screamed 1980's. The balcony was not accessible as the sliding glass door was removed & replaced w/ a window. The tint film on the window was peeling off. The drapes were so dusty it was un-believable. The laminate-striped furniture is as joke. And to top it off, the half wall seperating the bathroom w/ the bedroom....who decorated this place...a blind person? The $30 valet parking is rip-off. The pool deck was dirty as was the balcony. A good power wash is needed. Also, it looks as if the outside of the hotel is in neeed of a paint job. And finally, they charge for wi-fi. The Hyatt needs to get rid of this property or blow it up & start from scratch. Save your time & money & stay across the street at the new JW Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was awesome !”
Reviews.Author: naynay79
Reviews.Content: The check in was pretty speedy. The rooms was very clean , the bed was comfy and had very nice soft pillows. The room was pretty large. We was just going to order in but we run into a worker named John. We he heard we was going to order in he asked if we went to their restaurant yet. We said no. He said that we should try it. When we said we didn't have that kind of money. He said order whatever you want and its on the house. We was taken back by that but did as he said. The food was wonderful and so was the service. We would go back if we are ever in Miami again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.. Very convenient to Downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: blonde83
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Stayed in Miami only one night. The restaurant food was great. The cocktail lounge was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Quality but not a Resort”
Reviews.Author: jfdjr
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here while in Miami for an athletic event. I am a Hyatt regular so I am kind of biased. This Hyatt is a high-volume and convention hotel attached to the Miami convention center. Just know this going in. It's a large hotel. There will be lots of people here. It will be busy at times. They handle all this pretty competently and efficiently. The hotel suffers a lot of wear & tear so it's not as pristine as some of the other Hyatts I visit but it is still pretty decent. Staff is helpful & friendly. Restaurants are of normal Hyatt quality. Rooms are decent. I had a nice downtown Miami view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Miami”
Reviews.Author: reneelynns
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weekend at the Hyatt Regency! Everything was very clean. The employees were very helpful. The location was perfect and it was easy to get to from the airport. It was also easy to get to the University of Miami where we have a daughter going to school. We enjoyed the pool and the workout facilities also. We do wish they'd have free internet though.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly Attentive Service”
Reviews.Author: Sparksy58
Reviews.Content: The staff at this place is top notch. We we here for a conference and when I lost my reading glasses, they went out of their way to find them. The concierge and doormen were friendy, polite and professional with every interaction. And our room - a corner suite on the 10th floor - was large & comfortable. We highly recommend this place if you're staying in downtown Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: jessyfort
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Hyatt in August. We were pleased with the property. We received a cheaper rate by booking through Resorts Plus International. Walking distance from Bayside and wonderful staff. Hope to stay again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good for bussiness trip”
Reviews.Author: MariaLodz
Reviews.Content: A convention hotel with location in Miami Downtown. The area is not very nice especially at night but only the short walk to Bayside. Also bus going to Miami Beach is not far. Service is friendly and helpful in every situation. The rooms are large and clean but with a traditional design. Breakfast food was good quality and excellent service. Equipped with facilities in addition to standard items (desk, LCD TV) are iron, ironing board, iPod docking station. I recommend for business travel. When we ride for pleasure better find a hotel in Miami Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy my stay!”
Reviews.Author: redhotruby42
