Reviews.Content: The hotel is upscale suits the star level. Upon arrival and checking in the hotel the queen bed non smoking room was unavailable so, the front desk staff upgraded us to a king suite. When we went up to up to our room. The room was just as big as one bed room apartment. The king size bed, the flat screen TV on it huge console/dresser combo. The couch and chair with coffee table. There is the office desk and couple of chairs. Separate closet and bathroom area with all fine amenities. The room was exceeded the expectation and the price that was bids on priceline website. Totally, unexpected. We loved our room with the balcony ( unaccessible ) probably due to safety issues. They have a restaurant there but we didn't get to utilize it because, we were out of the hotel most of the time while we were there. The parking cost 12.50 each time you are in and out. I did a lot of research prior to this trip so, we didn't rent a car while we were there. Except the next day while we rented a car from Miami Airport and used it for a few hour and returned the same day. Taxi cost $21 plus we gave the driver a tip (too much tip for the attitudes that he has) so make sure you stack up some of $1 dollar bills because, we didn't have it so we ended up gave him $5. We were supposed to be on NCL Sky the next day after we returned the vehicle we took the taxi back to the hotel somewhat it cost more. I guess because, starting point was from MIA for the final cost was $29 with his tips. The next day Taxi to the Port of Miami cost us about $15. What we did while we were there? We walked about 20 minutes from our hotel to the Bayside Market. It was really not that bad to walk at all. Nice working out.. We enjoyed spent sometime at the Bayside. More like tourist trap but I loved shopping so I won't mind. When we finish we were walking back and taking some short cut downtown miami. It is not a good option and we didn't know this until we did. The off streets are not "SAFE" .. Don't walk there alone!!!! or evening when it is getting dark. The homeless, drug dealers, etc are hanging out. We saw some street working girl there, too! We walked as fast as we could. We don't look at anything or stop anywhere just continued to walks. Hope this help anyone who is planning to visit Miami or taking a cruise and staying any of the downtown hotel location. Forgot to mention that they do have the transit you can use. But we are from the city that we don't have a pubic transit. So, go figure that we are not familiar with how to :)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: MsScotland49
Reviews.Content: Took our two teenaged girls with us this time for a short vacation before start of school. Girls loved the short walk to Bayside and the cigarette boat ride. They loved the shopping and the live nightly entertainment. They also found the Marshalls and Macys conveniently nearby. Husband and myself spent time in pool area. Very well maintained. Lots of towels available at all time. Breakfast at the Riverside Cafe was fantastic. Soooo much to choose from. We found that we did not need to eat again till supper time. I should also mention that we were upgraded to a junior suite because the concierge recognized us from previous stays. All in all a very pleasant experience, just like the ones past. Will definately keep returning for short vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Winston is the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: SpartanQueen51
Reviews.Content: Spent some `girl` time with my friends at this hotel. We were left quite impressed with the personal service we recieved from all the staff. Winston, the doorman, was so friendly and went out of his way to find us the right taxi for where we were going. He also arranged to have the same taxi pick us up at the designated location and time. We felt very safe and secure. The chambermaid was generous with our request for extra toiletries and towels. We really liked the security feature of having to use our door card key in the elevator. We never stayed at this hotel before, but will be using it again on our next girltime getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time”
Reviews.Author: Nravenwolf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency in downtown Miami. The staff wasn't the best, they didn't seem to care much and were pushy when trying to force valet parking down our throat. We stayed in a parking garage (long walk) and saved $6.00 over having the stuck up valets park our car. Yes, they were stuck up AND rude, that is why we didn't park our car with them. The bed was really comfy, the bathtub was stopped up and the shower and facet ran at the same time meaning less water pressure. The place was really expensive for food and drinks and really in a crappy part of town. Nothing to do and shady at best. You are 9 miles away from the beaches and it's a hairy onramp from the hotel. Really, spend the extra money and get closer to the beach. This place sucks. Oh yeah I'm also trying to get some extra charges resolved. My folio stated I owed a certain amount and it was doubled when I checked my bank account today. I called and the guy said nobody could help me until Monday. Oh yes and the gym SUCKS. Really, don't bother. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Beware when paying with credit card!!!”
Reviews.Author: tina_esl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency in July. The hotel itself is in a boring location. There's nothing to do or see after 6 pm.... Everything is closed and if you're traveling with small children, you will really be bored here! Now, one a more SERIOUS note... We stayed at the Regency floor and (we didn't know this nor we told upon check-in) we were allowed to eat breakfast ONLY at the regency floor. We went the first morning downstairs (regency floor breakfast ends at 9:30; downstairs breakfast is until 11) and had our breakfast only to be served a bill which we were told "Will be taken care of by the reception upon check-out...If you are on a bed&breakfast rate (as we were) this charge will be deducted from your total" So we believed. The next morning we again went downstairs for breakfast and again were served the bill which we were FORCED to sign because nobody leaves that restaurant without signing their bill! I asked at the reception why did we need to sign a bill for a charge we had prepaid initially... We paid a substantial amount of money beforehand for bed and breakfast and were curious why we needed to authorize a charge for eating breakfast only to be "deducted from our total upon checkout." The reception tried to convince us that we were informed of the rules upon check in (which we were not...they rushed to check us in, as were checking in a whole group of convention-attendees and didn't have time to speak to us for longer than 2 minutes)... He also said we were allowed to have breakfast only at the regency floor but when I explained that were were honestly not aware of this, the reception guy told us he would annul the charge and we would not be charge for these two breakfast days! We checked out the day after, paid for our parking ($30 a day for a total of 90) and were given a copy that all is paid for (only the $90) and we were ready to leave. When I arrived home I checked our credit card statement to find: a. Charge of $90 on 10/07 (we checked out on 9/07) b. Charge of $65 on 12/07 (WHERE DID THIS COME FROM?!) My only explanation is that the breakfast room doesn't coordinate ANYTHING with the reception so they make their own charges....or reception is ignorant enough and the people working there don't share with each other their decisions... All in all, I have written a complaint to Hyatt. I am very disappointed by the misuse of my credit card and most importantly by splitting the charges in 2 separate payments on 2 separate days thinking we would not notice them and would let them pass... Whatever! So, for all you fellow travelers out there... Chose a different hotel... This one is way dated, far from everything and there's MANY more nice ones out there for the same price! Stay well!

Reviews.Title: “Boring location but reasonable priced”
Reviews.Author: olups
Reviews.Content: As the title says, the location in Miami Downtown is very boring. There is just nothing really to do if you don't count the Bayside Shopping Mall. However the room prices with just around 100 $ per night very quite reasonable and the bus station going to Miami Beach is not far. Hotel itself is not exciting but this also means: nothing particulary bad. There was free Internet but it was unclear if this was temporary or is always available.

Reviews.Title: “Solid business hotel - great value”
Reviews.Author: gemdomer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hyatt Regency many times due to its close proximity to my company's office and have always found it to be reliable, pleasant, and reasonably priced. The hotel has undergone extensive renovations in the last two years and is much improved. For the price paid ($95/night on this trip) you really couldn't ask for more. The service is always attentive and polite, greeting guests and they enter and leave the hotel. The bellboys are very quick to assist and the front desk staff is cheery, quick, and helpful. Even when the hotel has a convention and is full, I've never waited more than five minutes in line at the front desk. I noticed on this trip that the service seemed even more attentive and friendly than before. Also the hotel has significantly streamlined their menus, both the room service menu and the breakfast buffet. Neither is quite as fancy now but there are plenty of good options. The room service was very quick and they even called later to make sure that everything was to my liking. Rooms are spacious and recently updated. I like the fact that all rooms have a safe, as well as iron and ironing board. Large flat screen TV's and comfy beds are a plus. My room this time had an iPod docking station; I don't remember seeing this in the room previously but I enjoyed using it. Bathrooms are spacious and amenities are top quality. My only complaint is that there is no full length mirror anywhere in the room. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to a business traveller and even to tourists or families. The location right on the river is excellent and the service is pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “The room was very spacious, and the bed was extremely comfortable. Staff were friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Engineer_Germany
Reviews.Content: I had a very good time at this hotel, even though was there only about 5 days for a conference. The room was very spacious and the bed was very comfortable. An iron and ironing board was provided within a dedicated section of the room that was segregated from the bed area. The staff were extremely friendly and ordered me transportation from the hotel to the places that I wanted to go. One downside I noticed was the availability of food for my requirements. The location was also good. I managed to find some time to go to the beach area which was not so far away. All in all, it was a super experience and I would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious room for one person with queen bed. Extremely friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Engineer12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, the best thing being the spacious room and amenities within it such as an iron and ironing board and a space to leave them open ready for use in the morning. I was on a business trip to attend a conference so did not have time to check out other features of the hotel much, but it is very elegant to walk into. One down side is there was only a starbucks near the conference area which leaves one with not much choice to grab something to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Experience”
Reviews.Author: Gery-Ann13
Reviews.Content: We've stayed on Hyatt Place, Hyatt Summerfield, and this time at the Hyatt Regency, and we never regret. They always have a wanderfull service. On this hotel the room was beautiful and comfy. Very clean. We got a AAA deal for three days for a very very good price, with breakfast included (we didn't know that the free breakfast was only on the lobby, and asked for breakfast in the room every day, but still they forgot it and didn't charge anything). Since we have gold passport membership we could have late check out at 2 pm. They called everyday to make sure we were comfortable, if we liked the breakfast service, etc. The only two things that were not free were the internet and parking. We recomend this hotel 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Visit; Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robpie
Reviews.Content: Sig-other and I stayed for a few days pre-cruise out of Miami in April 2010 and November 2009. We found the Hyatt quite nice, comfortable & clean; staff friendly and helpful. It has become our PREFERRED choice for staying pre-cruise. Downtown Miami is a short walk- there's a Macy's, other shops for last minute purchases. Got my glasses fixed and we both had a mani-pedi to get ready for our cruise. Ate at a local Peruvian place. Delightful, relaxing. Contrary to other reviews, we had no noise problems. Nor did we have problems checking in or out. Back at the Hyatt, we had drinks at the bar; nice view of a river(?) Ate the breakfast buffet. Service was excellent. Lobby was good for people watching. Both times we were able to get great rates on Priceline. Anytime we're cruising out of Miami, this is where we'll be staying beforehand. And, the port is a short cab ride. No rent a car need.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is bad”
Reviews.Author: benjamin056
Reviews.Content: For 180$ a night, breakfast was not included. The room was really noisy from the street's traffic, the air conditioning, the maids talking loudly in the corridor, the other guests. The cleaning maid would enter the room at 9am, not leaving me time to answer a knocking, and I ended up naked in front of her! She was rude to us every day, urging us to leave the room so she could "clean" it. The room was not clean, the coffee bags and stuff was filthy, with some body fluid on it and hair. The room service waiter was not discreet when bringing the food, looking around the room for minutes. The bathroom is so tiny I could barely fit between the bathtub and the toilets to dry myself up. The furniture and room layout was not better than a regular motel (not what you expect when you stay in a Hyatt). The temperature in the hotel and the rooms was freezing cold. The elevators system is terrible. Have to insert room key to press the button, so the time to take it out from my wallet (not easy when your arms are full) I had past my flour most of the time. The worst part was that there was a convention that started the day before my last night at the hotel. From that time on, we really felt that the whole hotel was only there for the young people of that convention. There were poster of naked man hanging on every wall and in front of the hotel! The hundreds of young people would hang out in the lobby constantly, making it really noisy and hard to get in and out of the hotel. There was a 1h wait time just to take the elevator (and staff refused us to use the stairs). Restaurant was constantly full. The people were yelling in the corridors. So basically I didn't have one good night of sleep, and left the hotel exhausted. So we fled the Hyatt for the Hilton in downtown Miami, wich was only 80$ a night and was what you expect from a hotel of that standing. (The view was great, and the bus terminal was really close making it easy to go around or to Miami beach)

Reviews.Title: “Good for business trip - a few tips to avoid”
Reviews.Author: RockvilleMD
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency for a week for a trial in Miami. The Pros: - Staff is WONDERFUL. They provided assistance with FedEx, with courier services, were friendly, and really went out of their way to make us feel at home, even giving us a free evening in the Regency Club when our travel plans got thrown astray by an interesting ruling by the judge. - Spacious rooms. I could set up my laptop, my materials, and other things at the desk in the room and felt like I had plenty of room to work. - Cleanliness. Excellent job by housekeeping. - Gym and pool. Nice gym. Just a few machines, but good machines. Also, a friendly tip - avoid the $3/bottle of water charge, bring your own Nalgene bottle, and hit the water dispenser in the gym for a fill up. Didn't get a chance to go to the pool but it looked like it was very well-used. - Proximity. $5-$8 taxi fare to downtown, to the restaurants and shops at Bayside and Mary Brickell Village. Actually makes it cheaper to take a taxi than to rent a car. - Restaurant. Reasonably priced for a hotel restaurant with above average food. The bar also had some good Happy Hour specials for a quick after work drink. - Lobby. Spacious lobby with waterfalls and just enough ambient noise that you could do work in the lobby for a change of scenery without being distracted. - The beds. Very, very, very comfortable. - In-room coffee. A single-cup coffee maker standard in business hotels, but the blend of coffee provided was terrific! - Wireless Internet. $10/24 hours. Not an unreasonable price for business travelers. Plus you can pay for your entire stay at once. You don't need to buy every day. Things to avoid: - Business center. $10 or $15 just to log onto a computer and get 15 minutes of time. $1/page for black and white printing. Nearly $3/page for faxes. It's worth your money and time to grab a cab to the FedEx Kinkos nearby and get done what you need to. And the business center wasn't always staffed when they said it would be staffed. - Handicapped accessible rooms. I had one for the first portion of my stay. It was not very conveniently laid out, lacked the chair and ottoman that other rooms had, and just wasn't as comfortable. Of course, they're there if you need them. - Rooms near the elevator. They are noisy and face the brick wall of the adjoining convention center. All told, we got a reasonable rate, felt very comfortable and really had a pleasant experience with the staff. We'll very likely return to this hotel for future business travels to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, rooms nice, super location”
Reviews.Author: Jules307
Reviews.Content: I spent only one night at this hotel -- the main positive feature was the presence of excellent staff -- always available to help. I felt very secure, I liked that the guest elevators were activated by the room key. The room was very comfortable and nice -- the bathroom area also was good & adequate. Plenty of storage room for luggage, etc. I didn't try the pool, but the location right on the Miami river was nice. Overall I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Suitcasemomma
Reviews.Content: I did read some of the reviews about this hotel before we stayed there and I must say, we really enjoyed our time there. We found the rooms each time to be very clean with wonderful views of the city, especially the Riverwalk. Their pool lights up at night with different coloured lights, very cool indeed! The self-parking is a little hike but given the reasonable price for parking there, a small sacrafice. Their restaurant has "theme meals " on the weekends which are very nice and for a hotel, a bargain. You can even print out your flight boarding pass before you leave for your flight in their main lobby area. Frankly, we had a wonderful experience there, so please do not be put off by the negative reviews that you may read on this site. We found it to be a lovely hotel. B.T, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Not what it pretends to be”
Reviews.Author: Pippononlosa
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spatious, but no style. Bad noise isolation : - between two communicating bedrooms (although both communcation doors are closed) - between your room and the corridor (and if you happen to be just a few feet from the ice machine in the corridor, you're finished!) Limited choice or restaurants, that anyway close early. Just a big factory with beds, no more.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: RodneyHancock
Reviews.Content: I was in Miami as part of a group for business and stayed at the Hyatt, which is downtown. I got a room with a view of the freeway, so it was quite noisy. The decor was OK. The bar staff were friendly enough, the food was reasonably priced for a city hotel and was quite good, but the whole lobby area lacks ambience. Great location for Bayside and the waterfront. OK for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: YShimon
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems a little dated - even the redecoration of the rooms can't make up for what is a large 80s-type concrete box hotel with little aesthetic appeal and a cramped feeling in the corridors and rooms. The air conditioning is a little weak and less responsive than I would have liked. The bed and beddings are comfortable but the bathrooms are nothing exciting and the towels were thin and cheap. Breakfast food was good quality and excellent service. I appreciated the LG HG tv. Check-in/front desk seemed a little confused at times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Centrally Located Hotel, but beware of PARKING!!!”
Reviews.Author: damani83
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very well kept and clean. Most of the staff was friendly, with the exception of one of the security guards who was totally creepy. THE DOWNFALL: The hotel doubles as a convention center and doesn't have it's own parking. You will feel completely ripped off by having to pay $12 every time you exit the Garage. I was in Miami sightseeing for about 4 days and I spent over $324 in PARKING ALONE!!!! I loved the hotel, but I was not prepared for this. I wish they would've told he ahead of time and I would've planned for it.

Reviews.Title: “Hairy scary”
Reviews.Author: Stepjarsteve
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through PRICELINE.com what a great deal we were getting .A 4 star hotel for only $70!!! But the room was dirty and there was HAIR all over the matress and comforters....including the matress pad... GROSS!! people hair all sizes and color!!! They came in and stripped the bedding and we got all fresh CLEAN BEDDING. They also gave us breakfast on the house. That would of been $77 just for breakfast VERY EXPENSIVE breakfast!!!! not worth $77 but worth FREE!! So just be aware of the bedding you may want to inspect it first before sitting on it

Reviews.Title: “Great value for location...”
Reviews.Author: inthelifebiz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is your typical convention hotel, with nice rooms and location. We flew in for a 3 day stay before a cruise and were a bit concerned w/ the value and comments of the hotel. This hotel is understated and is terrific for everyone in the family. Hotels in the area are double what you would pay and being on the riverwalk is a perk! Shopping and restauants are all within a five minute walk, so you will find this hotel to be a pleasant surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Great if won on Priceline.”
Reviews.Author: PoorTripPlanner
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times in the past couple of years(always pre cruise). On our first visit (Oct 2008) we paid standard rates (AAA discounted). But on the last two visits I won this hotel on Priceline for significantly less. I wouldn't book this hotel directly again, but wouldn't be disappointed if I won it on Priceline if I chose to bid next time I am in the area. --however the b'fast was more expensive$$$ than the cost of the room :( so I would find a different option for b'fast. I do not recommend this hotel if you don't have a car or if you have mobility problems and don't want to pay cab fares to get around. The free tram is outside the hotel but you have to walk pretty far (for a mobility impaired person) to get there.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money”
Reviews.Author: statestreet75
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right next to the convention center and at the start of Brickell avenue where all the banks are located. As such, it's much worn and could use some refreshing. Towels are thin and lighting in the bathroom is anemic. Windows don't open which might be a problem for some. But for $130 a night in d/t Miami its not bad and its location is great depending on where you are going for the day. As a vacation spot, suggest you keep looking. Pool is tiny and in the shade all day long. The Executive breakfast is OK as well - not the best I've seen but clearly not theworst either. Avoid the 23/24 floors unless you are far from the elevators. While not overly annoying, the whine migth annoy some sensitive people.

Reviews.Title: “Your own private oasis in the middle of Downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: frannygirl123
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the location, amenities and price. We paid $150/nt incl tax. This hotel was absolutely gorgeous and all the amenities my 9 yr old and I could ask for - pool, fitness ctr, restaurant, close drive to many attractions, airport, etc. The rooms were very clean and service was impeccable. All the staff (housekeeping, front desk, bell clerks, valets, restaurant) were so helpful and courteous. I traveled for years on business to many 5 star hotels and the service at this hotel was best by far. I have paid over $300/nt for a hotel at this caliber level in other metropolitan cities. The Hyatt should be very proud of their employees at this location; that is who makes this a wonderful spot to stay. This location is close to the Miami Aquarium, Biscayne Bay, Children's Museum, Coconut Grove, I-95, Everglades, etc. Oh, and you would never guess that it is connected to the Miami Convention Center! It is nestled between all Miami's high rise office buildings in the center of the fiancial center. It is like your own private Oasis in the middle of Miami. The Miami River passes right next to the hotel and there are boats docked next to the hotel. A draw bridge lets boats pass right below the pool area and this fascinates young and old. As you turn out of the driveway you are on Rt.1 so you can meander right down to Coconut Grove or Coral Gables for a stroll around a small Floridian Artsie town with many shops and food choices. Only down side was the parking fee per day - a bit steeper than most metro hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Has some razzle but fails to dazzle”
Reviews.Author: eaglered_77
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate for this hotel via PL so we stayed 2 nights. The location is pretty good and is bang in the middle of downtown. It looks pretty busy all the time. The one thing you should be prepared to do is pony up $12 a night for parking. The parking is in an underground garage across the street and its a good 10min walk back to the hotel. Comfort wise I expected more from a Hyatt nothing really to write home about. On the whole, a decent hotel. Make sure you factor in parking.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your allergy meds”
Reviews.Author: MCNconference
Reviews.Content: The air quality in the rooms and entire hotel was incredibly poor. There is little to no ventilation and it was very muggy. There's also no vents the in bathroom. It felt like being stuck inside an enclosed basement apartment. I don't suffer from allergies but I woke up totally congested and coughing. A dose of zyrtec helped a bit. A colleague had to double the dose of asthma medication and get a new steroid inhaler and was still coughing and wheezing throughout the meeting. Only standing outside helped the problem. Other than that the hotel is very dated but the staff was friendly and the rooms were clean. But unless you want respiratory problems, stay away!

Reviews.Title: “I really liked it!”
Reviews.Author: RiverTraveler
Reviews.Content: I feel like I stayed at a different hotel than some of the previous reviewers because it was quite nice in my opinion! Background - we stayed the night after a cruise - before flying home the next day. We stayed at the Marriott Biscayne Bay for two nights before the cruise and also liked it. Disclaimer that I got this hotel through Priceline for less than half of the asking rate so I'm not sure I would have been so happy if I'd paid regular rates... We checked in quite early (around 9:30) after getting off our cuise. I believe Marla (or Maria? I didn't get a good look at her signed name on our room key folder) helped us and she was as nice as could be - very friendly and helpful. (The cab ride from the port was about $9 before tip but you have to pay $2 to get out of the cruise terminal in a cab!) They had only a double room available but we didn't have to wait so we took it. The lobby was very nice and there was a cafe there and a lounge/restaurant that overlooked the Miami river. There were stairs that went down to the river area and we walked along there. At times if felt a bit seedy but it wasn't bad. (I wouldn't walk there alone as a woman but we did pass a few women walking alone or with a dog so it must have been OK.) The room is a bit odd in that it has a 3/4 height wall that separates the bathroom and closet (walk in with a safe - it was quite nice!) and the rest of the room. The sink was outside the shower/toilet room, which is how most hotels are. The surfaces were all nice granite and the bathroom was clean and seemed new. (Surfaces in the bedroom were also granite - desk, nightstand, dresser.) Toiletries were nice (don't recall the brand) with soap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion and there was a travel-size toothpaste at the sink. There was no full-length mirror in the room, just as we'd found at the Marriott - I don't get that!!! There was also no fridge in the room. The TV was very nice - big LCD that swiveled. Desk area was nice. Nice floor-to-celing windows that looked out on what used to be a tiny balcony but was no longer accessible. The view was not nice at all - not sure if any area of the hotel has a decent view. There was internet available through the TV but you couldn't tell what the price was. My husband called the front desk but I think they misunderstood him and quoted him the wireless rate for 24 hours ($9.95) rather than the TV-internet rate. Or maybe that was correct - but we didn't use it. The free metromover was as close as could be (we could see it out our window) so you can get a lot of places for free. We did use this when we stayed at the Marriott Biscayne Bay and had some trouble getting back but I would try it again. We went back to Bayside Marketplace again on this day (we went the day before our cruise, too) because it was relaxed, easy to get to and had a nice selection of restaurants and shops. It was very easy to walk there so no need for the metromover. You also pass a CVS on the way to Bayfront park/Bayside Marketplace so if you need anything it's very close to the hotel. There was no map for the place which I thought was weird considering it's attached to the convention center! There were big maps in the lobby but only as they pertained to the convention center and not the hotel itself. If you want to go to the pool or fitness center, the "pool" button brings you there. Glad we noticed it because we couldn't figure out how to get to them! The fitness center looked very small but we didn't go in. The pool was pretty small and there weren't a ton of chairs, however the day we were there (a Sunday with so-so weather - warm enough but cloudy and windy) there was plenty of room for those using the pool/loungers/tables. There were lots of towels and there were menus hanging from several chairs but we never saw anyone come around to take orders. We had an appetizer in the restaurant and the service was good. Our server was very friendly and she was so personable and likeable that she really made our dinner! (Plus, she's worked for a (different) cruise line for four years and we'd just gotten off a Carnival cruise with dining room service so poor that we never returned after the second night (and we are NOT picky!) so she was a breath of fresh air with her great service and wonderful personality!) Check out was easy and it was easy to get a cab even at 5:15 in the morning (looking out our window at 4:45 I could see three waiting in the lobby area). They have a computer to print your boarding pass right in the lobby next to the front desk but it was pretty slow. Still worth it, though, because our airline gave a discount for paying for bags before getting to the airport! I believe the cab was around $25 to the airport but I don't recall exactly (somewhere between $25 and $35 for sure, including tip.)

Reviews.Title: “Most under-rated restaurant in Miami”
Reviews.Author: loge54
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of this hotel which is always very clean and well-staffed with trained personnel. The beds are well-dressed and very comfortable. But the best "secret" about this hotel is the little restaurant in the lobby. I have had several meals in the past year here and each continues to impress. Last night I had the Black&Blue Swordfish entree and it was sublime. A perfectly cooked swordfish steak was served grilled with a side of mashed sweet potato and a corn/salsa garnish. Fresh Vegetables, also perfectly cooked complimented the order. Service is gracious, friendly, and professional. The bar is also improved with nightly happy hour specials from 5 to 7pm. On Tuesday, I had a delicious burger with a glass of Stella for only $10! The glasses of wine at dinner could use a little help - they do tend to be short pour. You can do a whole lot worse than choosing this Hyatt, located centrally Downtown on Brickell, well within safe walking distance to touristy Bayfront to the north or the much better Mary Brickell village area to the south. Good job with this one, Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: newyorkmanhattan
Reviews.Content: this hotel is the worst hotel I've ever stayed.I really don't understand some of the positive reviews of this hotel.I have never wrote a complaint about a hotel before. we got the hotel around 10 pm and checked in.at reception we were told that we had to wait 40 minutes to have a room.Check in begins at 3pm.we booked a room a month ago.we were very tired and wanted to take a shower. also had a plan to go to miami beach for dinner. we killed time at a sleazy restaurant at the lobby floor. we went to the reception again and said that we had to wait 1 more hour.we were upset but we were here for fun.we waited 1 more hour.after 1 hour, we were said "there are no available room tonight." we were just shocked. why didn't the receptionist say it first?we stayed at a conference room at the night!!I wouldn't stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, Mixed Quality, Wouldn't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: usflyer
Reviews.Content: We got this room using Hyatt Points, so I won't comment much on the price other than to say I wouldn't pay more than about $75 a night to stay here. Definitely no more than 3.5 star hotel. GOOD: - Staff let us check in 2 hours early and had our requested room type available. - Front desk staff very helpful with directions, faxing, etc. - Location is OK, I guess depending on what you are there for. It was a decent 5 minute walk to the bay. No particularly impressive views to be had in this hotel from what I could see. Taxi to the cruise port was $9.75 on a Saturday morning meter and very quickly and easily called from valet. - Bed had down comforter and was very comfortable. - Nice sized flat screen TV. - Nice working desk. - Overall hotel has a modern feel. BAD - Breakfast prices are ridiculous. About $15 for any of the items in the restaurant. Thinking that was crazy, we ordered from the cafe and found that a large Starbucks was $3.75 and a bagel w/ cream cheese was $3.50. - Not enough elevators and still malfunctioning after visit 2 years ago (lights randomly flash, cards not accepted, etc, etc.). - Asked for a quiet room on a Friday night when the hotel shouldn't be too full and they put us in a room right next to a couple with 3 young boys who ran, screamed, and banged on every surface area. The connecting room doors have huge gaps and must be hollow because they block no sound. - Weird bathroom set-up where the sink is outside a small little room holding the shower and toilet. Bathroom hasn't been remodeled and really old. Drain hanging out onto tub floor, weak shower head. Just not great. - Bar staff took 15 minutes to serve us drinks even though it was not full and many were just standing around chatting. We got a great deal with our points, but this place just wasn't awesome. Frankly, for a cruise the next day, I will probably just spend the same money on trip insurance and fly out the morning of.

Reviews.Title: “needed updating and or a good cleaning. Rooms very stuffy no ventalation”
Reviews.Author: tbirdhs
Reviews.Content: Nice staff and valet parking. Hotel needs major up dating, rooms very stuffy no fresh air, outside of windows so dirty and stained could hardy see out.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: LIV4JESUS1
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed one night . Loved the Hotel, very nice & clean. The food was great!

Reviews.Title: “Where is the food”
Reviews.Author: JenniferIllinois
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Miami Hyatt Regency hotel. I chose the hotel due to its proximity to the Port of Miami. Our flight was delayed which put us checking into the hotel at 11:00 PM. Unfortunately, by the time we were checked in and put our bags in our room, the hotel bar/grill had closed. They also closed room service. We had to order a pizza that took one hour to be delivered. The hotel beds were good and rooms were okay but I felt that a hotel in downtown Miami would have more options for late night food.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: ophelia_sez
Reviews.Content: Got a decent price on this hotel through hotwire (under $100) but was very disappointed in this Hyatt. Room was small and dowdy. My daughter commented on a "large black hair" in the tub when she went to take a bath (ugh). The bathroom floors looked grimy and the woodwork was painted sloppily, paint splashed onto the adjoining wallpaper. Beds were reasonably comfortable. Breakfast the next morning was a disaster -- too few wait staff, too many customers, waited 1/2 hour for my bowl of $7.00 oatmeal. I overheard a worker in the elevator complaining that the hotel was too cheap to hire more help, even though they were very busy. Our cab driver advised us (two females) not to walk outside the hotel at night. A real let-down. You can DEFINITELY do better in Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK. Nothing special. Good Location for downtown”
Reviews.Author: tacath
Reviews.Content: I don't know about you, but it seems to me that hotels should offer two things free. Parking and internet service. Valet parking is $30 a day and Internet $10 a day. Make sure you put it in your budget. I got the room through priceline for $90 a night and did the self park option. That was $12.75 a day and is nearby. The room was ok but nothing spectacular. The carpet had seen better days and the bathroom in the surfaces where the floor meets the walls could use a good scrubbing. I asked for a room high up for the view, however, the windows were too dirty to really have a view. There seemed to be some film material on the window which made it look more dirty. Room does have half wall separating bath from sleeping area which is nice. Large closet with ironing board, iron and safe. Bed was comfortable. Has walkway to metromover which is very handy to get around Miami FREE! Staff was friendly and efficient. Good location for Miami. Wend to the bar for a drink but left with and returned to the room as the bar was loud with techno music and very annoying. I asked if it could be changed and the choices were the music or the tv. I would have preferred the later. The bartender indicated they were catering to a younger crowd. I'm not sure this hotel who's normal room rate is $199 a night can cater to the younger crowd. There was an area called Terrace which was essentially just an area along the river. No seating or other services. Pool looked nice, but there was no sun in the afternoon so was not enticing in cool weather. Nothing spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Never again- Club Level a rip off”
Reviews.Author: TakeMeAwayNaples
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband with an overnight Valentine trip to the Miami Boat Show. Chose this hotel because it was close to the Boat Show, had decent TripAdvisor reviews, and my Visa Signature card got us a great rate of $165 for a club level king room. What a joke! The hotel is very old, not recently updated as many reviews stated unless you count sticking a 42-in plasma tv in the crappy room updated. The ceilings have that old popcorn ceiling look and there is not a full wall dividing the bathroom and the bedroom. So you can hear all hair dryers, running sink water, etc... while in the bedroom watching tv. The club level was the worst I've seen. They charged us for two alcoholic cocktails! What?!?! When I mentioned this upon check out the front desk staffer merely looked at me and replied, "Well, maam, then everyone would be taking lots of free drinks all day." Helloooo .....isn't that the perk of a club level? the club concierge was trying to assist us with Valentine dinner reservations and when I asked about two restaurants we were curious about, he said they were closed on Sundays. Well, thanks to my Iphone I found out this was not the case and made my own reservation. The hotel is full of airline pilots and stewardesses, conventioneers, and tourists spending the night before embarking on a cruise. Not that there is anything wrong with that, but want to set the scene. The parking is $30 overnight. The hotel is really too far to walk anywhere so taxis are a must. Overall, I would NEVER stay here again. I love Miami too much and there are so many other great hotels in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - A mid-grade hotel”
Reviews.Author: andromeda23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend and were disappointed in the overall quality and feel of this hotel. We were in a Miami suite, which was larger than a standard room, and had a nice view out the large (but extremely dirty) windows. The room itself was fine (the bed was comfortable) and had been updated within a few years, but it had a musty feeling. The bathroom was very plain and didn't seem to have been updated - more of what you would expect in an outdated Days Inn than an upscale hotel. Overall the hotel felt a little grimy. One of the big problems we had was the traffic situation created at the hotel and on nearby roads when there is an event at the attached convention center. On two nights we encountered massive traffic jams trying to return to the hotel since the hotel entrance and convention center parking both use the same driveway. It took at least an extra 30 to 40 minutes to get back to the hotel. The hotel restaurant and room service were adequate but not great. While staying here, we did walk over to the Intercontinental which is only a few blocks away, and thought that it looked much nicer - we wished we had stayed there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...Great Hotel Restaurant...”
Reviews.Author: HotelCritic2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency when we were in town for the Miami Marathon. The rooms were nice and clean, but nothing overly spectacular. The front desk staff were friendly and professional and happily placed me on a high floor, at my request. We were offered a 40 dollar meal certificate to be used at the hotel restaurant because we booked using a AAA discount. By the way ... ask for the AAA discount because it will also give you 40 dollars off the going rate (at least it did at the time we booked). The swordfish and steak at the hotel restaurant were very very good! In fact, that was the best swordfish that I have ever had! We would have stayed in the hotel for a second night, but they were booked ;-) The only negative that I can say about the hotel is that the self parking is a bit of a pain. Though, cost-wise, 12 dollars to park in downtown Miami is not too bad. Oh, and WIFI costs 10 dollars and is not free in the lobby or business center.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great room, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: denysed
Reviews.Content: The service from the front desk to the dining room and lunch counter was very friendy. The room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I snagged it cheap on priceline...”
Reviews.Author: hypnoticrichard
Reviews.Content: I only paid $72 on priceline. that made me happy with the $30 parking and the $10 internet. Valet was decent, you must valet you car here. They were fast. The room was earthtone and seemed rather 1980's although in decent shape. t-mobile charges 10 a day for noncustomers, but if you already subscribe you can use it here. Decent bed and pillows. We had lunch in the bar. Overpriced, no flavor and took a long time. Waitress was not very attentive, and the manager didn't get me an item he promised. Check it was tough. Had to wait over an hour in the lobby for my room.... Overall a good value since i got it on priceline, but I would have been pissed if I had paid full price. It is an average, overpriced, downtown hotel with mediocre service and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: oliverlevitt
Reviews.Content: 1. Had a standard room with 2 beds which was spotless 2. The room was large, and the furnishings were ok. 3. The bathroom was a little small, and outdated 4. The workers seemed friendly enough. 5. If you are looking for a romantic weekend or looking to party in Miami this isn't the hotel for you. 6. If you are looking for a cheap nice hotel with no surprises this one works well. 7. I never tried to park because the rates seemed to high, but did find a lot for 12 dollars a night, 1 block away. 8. The furniture in the lobby is worn, and outdated, but really, who cares? 9. Overall I would stay here again without hesitation if it was $125 or less per night( including taxes etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, great service”
Reviews.Author: Delraypete
Reviews.Content: A solid business hotel my wife and I stayed in on NYE for a local concert. Front desk service was exemplary (Dominique) and basically the reason for this review. Location is convenient with good proximity to AAA, JLKC, Convention Center, bayfront, downtown, and Brickell areas. I'd say management handled the huge influx of concert goers very well. And the sundries shop was open at 2:30AM! Room was well appointed and clean. Contemporary furnishings (incl. LCD TV) and fabulous bed. Room seemed to be a retrofit of a very strange design - the closet looks like a retail fitting room and the sink area is right behind the bed, separated by only a 6' wall. Our stay was very short and for leisure, so this was not a problem. I'd say this is a VERY strong 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, actually pretty good for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: Rafiki103
Reviews.Content: A good hotel in downtown miami, not too far from south beach - perfect for before or after cruising, only 5 mins from the port. Rooms - the rooms vary, in our party we had 3 different types of rooms ranging from the basic room to the suite as some people were upgraded. The suites are much nicer so be sure to ask for an upgrade. The rooms are quite nice, although they do not have a minibar, which is a bit annoying. Bathroom etc is basic. For some reason, there is no balcony, there used to be, but the appear to have sealed all the access doors. Lobby - The lobby is nice, but when we were there it was always too busy and noisy due to the Miami convention centre being next door, first there was a graduation ceremony, and then there was a concert... Nearby - There are some great breakfast places nearby, ask the concierge, theres no point paying $24 for the hotel breakfast. There is the bayfront mall nearby, lots of shops and restaurants. South Beach is only 15mins or less away by car, so its definitely not too far. Parking - Parking at the hotel is expensive, $39 i think it was per day, but its valet and you can get your car out as many times as you want. If you're just parking it there for the whole day, then its worth parking across the street for $16, however, you get charged each time you take your car out. All in all, a decent place, much cheaper and nicer rooms than on south beach, but not exactly 4-5 star, more like 3.5.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience”
Reviews.Author: travelmonsters4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is walking distance to Bayside (live music every nights and lots of shops and restaurant.) right by the water. Safe location to go walking late at night. Very close to metro station (right ouside of the hotel) although it doesnt travel very far. Also close to bus. Overall, the best way to get around in miami is by Taxi(about $20-$30) anywhere you want to go...The cars are super expensive to rent and also parking is a hassle...The room, bathroom and the shower could use a little remodeling but its very clean. There is a small balcony but the sliding door does not open ??!!The Club regency cont. breakfast (located on 23rd floor) which you have to pay extra for runs out before 8am (opens 6:30-9:30)!!!. If you are paying for this, better get up real early!! The gym is very small. Nice pool but no hot tub and no sauna! The breakfast buffet at the hotel cafe located in the loby is awesome!! Overall the service we received was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT VALET PARK, I WAS ROBBED!!”
Reviews.Author: OneHonestReviewer
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night and valeted my vehicle ($29) as you are forced to pay for parking. The next morning upon checkout, my vehicle came and the back window was smashed and all my wife's luggage was stolen! They did not call me earlier in the morning to notify me and seemed just too busy to even care and seemed surprised at the discovery though they say they do have security. I lost $1500 worth of stuff and was given $200 in emergency money and it took 4 hours to fix my broken window and ruined my planned trip down to Key West as I also had to spend four hours buying all new clothes and such. I learned from valet that parking is three/four blocks away from hotel in a city operated garage and three other cars that night also were broken into. Apparently, the hotel has little security and no cameras in the valet garage so this is a regular event as they acted like it happens a lot. I fault the hotel with lack of security, no notification of the event, and a very slow almost forced response to deal with the problem as at times I felt forgotten and unimportant as they were too busy making money to care or deal with their problem. It seemed like they just wanted me to go away, broken car and all. The regency club is average at best, with a fair breakfast but very limited refreshments during the day, and no desserts and a poor/abstract evening selection (where were the desserts and fresh fruit??). The hotel is surrounded by buildings so even a view from the 24th floor just shows views of other buildings and it is very bright at night (where was the bay view as described on the website??). The blinds in my room were broken upon checkin and were very cheap plastic ones. The regency room was spacious but very plain, and the bathroom area is very poorly designed. We ordered two food selections from the restaurant and were very underwhelmed as my cuban sandwich was dry, cold, and made very cheaply for $12 (very salty and very processed meat). My wife had chicken quesadillas and they were very small and not very good for $12 and seemed to be a half portion. Other Hyatts' serve bigger portions of this same dish and are much better and have better quality. This hotel is designed to serve convention guests so if you are not staying there free or at a reduced rate on business for a convention and have to endure this corporate hotel, just pass and run away as fast as you can. I know this hotel has a lot of guests for conventions and cruises however, it is very impersonal and very corporate and the emphasis is on numbers rather than quality and service. I am still waiting to be contacted on any type of settlement for my loss and I will bet I have already been forgotten as they barely had time for me in the moment to deal with this problem. I have stayed at about 10 other Hyatts' and this one was well below average. The general manager is new and the previous GM ran the property poorly and was very negative on the staff as told to me by the valet manager. Unless you are forced to stay here, I would stay elsewhere. The closest nice Hyatt is in Coral Gables about 10 minutes away and is 100 times better!! I was robbed. Don't be!! You have been warned and there are many other better cheaper alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KourtnieJ
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel. The staff was very friendly, & the rooms were wonderful. Very busy, mostly suited for young adults.

Reviews.Title: “A good value stay pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: TravelGav
Reviews.Content: I booked direct with Hyatt several months ago, so got a good deal on a club room. We were on the 24th floor with a great view of downtown and the illuminated Bank of America tower opposite. The room look recently refurbished and the bed was very comfortable with nice linens and I thought the room colours all worked well together. Being in a club room we made use of the lounge for breakfast and drinks during the day and found it small but well-equipped. It was nice to stop off for coffee and a cookie after getting back to the hotel late afternoon. The hotel is within easy walk (covered) of a MetroMover station (in the Bank of America tower) which meant that we were able to explore some of the restaurants in Brickell during our two-night pre-cruise stay. It was a good choice for a few nights and certainly much better value than staying in South Beach which we have done on four previous visits to Miami so that was not as important this time. Although it has nothing to distinguish it from any other good chain hotel, I would happily stay there again pre-cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: qns1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt from 11-21-09- 11-23-09 after getting a great rate on hotwire for a pre cruise trip. I was a little nervous after some of the mixed reviews on trip advisor, but the hotel and staff were great. The hotel is located downtown and very convenient to the cruise terminal, maybe a 5 minute drive. There were a lot of people checking in and there was something going on at the convention center connected to the hotel, but the staff handled everything professionally and we didn't have to wait long. We were on the 18th floor which had a great view of the pool ( it changed colors at night) and we actually went swimming each night and the pool was never too crowded. The hotel is in walking distance of bayside marketplace, which is a place with shops, restaurants, and live music. The walls were very thin and you have to pay to park valet is 29.00 a day, but we parked in the self parking for 12.25 a day, and there is a walk way connected to the hotel so you can easily get there. There is also a fee for the internet, we didn't use it so not sure

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: Mishatraveller
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel the night before we were to leave on a cruise. The hotel was very clean with modern decor all for $98 what a value. Located in downtown Miami and a convenient 5 minute drive to the port of Miami for you cruisers out there.

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 4 buz; clean; 4str customer service”
Reviews.Author: AceTrvlr
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in plenty of hotels over the last few years, and they all begin to look alike after a while. The service here was equal to that of a 4+star hotel. Hotel was very - very clean. Even had problems with my alarm clock at 11PM and they promptly sent someone from maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “met our expectation”
Reviews.Author: Denys222
Reviews.Content: Close to city mover train. Took the mover twice and both times we were aproched by suspecious looking carachters who took joy in trying to intimidate us.Loosers. Not much security on these people movers. Hotel staff was professinal and rooms where OK. Had a good price thru Priceline . Would look somewhere else if I had to pay full price for room. Hotel felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “A Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheapskate1959
Reviews.Content: This hotel is designed for convention goers and businessmen. The rooms were nice enough, but not special. As downtown Miami has been overbuilt and become a ghost town they have very good prices for the rooms. Like many business hotels, they do not want to deal with service -- room service menu prices were higher than the same items downstairs, and then you had to pay very stiff service charges on top -- double dipping that means rooms service is almost a 50% premium. Expense accounts might tolerate it, but not my wallet. Internet and parking were also wickedly expensive. Personally I'd pay the extra if you have to be downtown, and stay at the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but not much to do”
Reviews.Author: EfficientTraveler
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of downtown. The most impressive thing to me was the service. EVERYONE on staff was so friendly and helpful, from the front desk to the bell staff. I was impressed with the people more than anything. While convenient to the convention center (attached), there's really nothing else to do around the area; South beach is a 15 minute cab ride. The all-you-can-eat fajitas were outstanding, as was the wait staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value... great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1knowing1
Reviews.Content: Christopher (a manager) was very helpful and assited in making our stay enjoyable. Our bell person (I think his name was James), was new but was great and extremely helpful beyond the call of duty. THe only problem was Deon P. He was the conceirge who stood at the entrance of the hotel offering assistance if needed. He gave us some wrong information and then he did not keep his word to my sister and I. Happy hour included a live dj, free hors dourves and the cost of the drinks were great. While the breakfast buffet was nice, there should have been more food items to choose from. You had to have your waffles made, that was time consuming. Really, all I wanted was a waffle sent to my room, however when I called the restaurant, they told me if they sent a single waffle to the room, it would cost $21. The buffet was $23 so I went downstairs and paid for the buffet. I was supprised that they did not have a whirlppol or hot tub in proximity of thier pool. The hotel was great. The view of the water on the 17th floors was nice. The decor was attractive and the location was supurb!

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DMRetzke
Reviews.Content: I booked though priceline and got a great deal. It was rated as a 4 star, but I could say more like 3.5. There is a lot of construction going on around the hotel so we had some trouble getting to it. Upon arrival we did the Valet - $29/per day - which is average for Miami. The check in was easy....I did not like the smell in the lobby....it was moldy or something, but there is a nice bar and restaurant in it. The room was very clean (including the bathroom) and definately remodeled. I had a plasma TV, ipod docking station and a nice, large granite desk to work. The beds were FANTASTIC!!!! Super comfortable!!!! The bathroom was kind of small for my liking and there was a strang "wall" separating it from the main sleeping area. I guess it was for privacy. The location was pretty good. You could walk to Bayside Market Place - about 10 min walk & there were shops and restaurants. There is a convenience store on premesis to get snacks and beer. Overall, I liked the hotel, it was clean & comfortable and you could not beat the price I paid per night.

Reviews.Title: “smells glade freshner”
Reviews.Author: maramonte
Reviews.Content: i really did not like this hotel, so many worshops, to noise, old!

Reviews.Title: “Top-tier service helps make up for an out-of-date property”
Reviews.Author: FightOn
Reviews.Content: The positive here is that the service was among the best I have encountered (approaching the level of a Ritz or Four Seasons). Every employee that I encountered went out of his/her way to make sure I had everything necessary for an enjoyable stay. This included making sure to know me by name, even though I was only in for two nights. Its almost as if the property knows its short-comings as far as dated rooms, lack of dining options, and a pool and gym that do not come close to doing MIami justice so they make sure to compensate with service. For a full service convention hotel, the lack of dining options and paltry menu selection were disappointing, especially considering that the nearest option within walking distance is about a 10 minute walk to Bayside Marketplace. With a JW Marriott Marquis being built directly across the street, the Hyatt could use some freshening, but kudos on the service for making me feel like a valued guest. So if business has you at the convention center, don't hesitate to stay, but if you want to experience the Miami of television and the movies, head to South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed...AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: susselsprout
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at a Hyatt (not my choice. I have to stay here because of an event I am attending), and with a couple exceptions, I ditto my review of the Hyatt at McCormick Place in Chicago. Same weird floorplan, same issues with room showing wear, same stinky soap and shampoo and this time I was treated to a bar of soap covered in pubic hair that the maid neglected to remove from the shower. Yeah, nice. I've stayed at two-star hotels that were nicer and cleaner than these Hyatts. With two bad experiences under my belt, I would never at a Hyatt by choice. Just so my review isn't completely negative, I should mention that the attendant at the registration desk was very nice. But that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: FCCJ
Reviews.Content: Hats off to Hyatt Regency Miami Staff, specifically to Sandra Castano and Mariana Miranda for the special treatment and support given during my stay. The preparation of the in room lunch prepared for my wife birthday was exceptional. I have no hesitation in recommending my friends and family to this hotel as a number one choice.

Reviews.Title: “has its perks”
Reviews.Author: belladonna76
Reviews.Content: easy to find(got directions from front desk staff)...very quick and easy check in....parking situation sucked. 30 for valet, 10 to park in the garage across the street...thats 10 every time you go in or out...we found a parking meter down the road for like 5 a day...unlimited trips in or out. rooms are nice. no refrigerators or microwaves in the standard rooms. complimentary cookies and juice in the lobby on fridays. bar downstairs. adjacent to the convention center. business center charges ten dollars every fifteen minutes of internet time. beautiful area around the back of the hotel to walk. nice pool. nice gym. very nice gym actually. wake up calls prompt. ipod player in room. desk in room. reading material in room. adjacent to the metro mover which is free transportation around downtown Miami. 5 minutes to south beach. 5 minutes to airport.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed living in this buidling, only the location is nearby airport”
Reviews.Author: poorguylovetravel
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed living in this building, quiet at night, thin plat panel tv, style deco for washroom and kitchen, especially the kitchen is fully equipped. The buffet breakfast is nice, I like it. My daughter is only 2 years old, so she love the foods there. The only thing is the location is near Miami Airport, you can not find any shopping malls around this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value-Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the metro mover line, making it easy to travel about downtown or connect to the metro rail and tri rail to get to either airport. The pool was nice and the staff was very kind and helpful. The bathrooms could use a remodel, but that isn't that big of deal. Our AAA rate include breakfast and we had a delightful visit to downtown Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great Improvement”
Reviews.Author: alwaysprincess7
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel in July of 2007 and I wrote a unfavorable reveiw. My husband and I stayed at the hotel again, and I have to give it praise. The hotel staff was courtious and our room was great. It was quiet and all the construction work in the area was completed. The rooms have a nice flat screen TV, comfortable beds and pillows. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but in the past the food was always good.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal choice for a pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: Disneybears
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel, I thought the name sounded familiar, but it wasn't until I arrived that I realized this was the same hotel I had stayed at prior to a cruise in 1984. Even though it had been 25 years between stays, I found the hotel to be more than acceptable. Check-in was very efficient and the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. They assigned us a very nice corner room with huge windows with a view of the harbor area. The room itself was clean and the bed comfortable. Although the room had been fairly recently remodeled, there were signs of age in the bathtub. (They are going to have to completely gut the bathrooms the next major remodel.) We had a drink and a snack in the bar the first night and breakfast in the buffet the following morning. The price for a "designer martini" in the bar was a bit high, but the service was good and our waitress was very friendly. The buffet breakfast was quite good and reasonably priced. There is a very nice waterway behind the hotel where you can stroll and look at all of the expensive yachts. Checkout was effortless. We took a cab from the airport for about $25 and the bellman got us a shuttle to the cruise terminal for $6.00 per person. The cruise terminal is about a 5 minute walk. For a pre-cruise hotel, I can't recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Trbmaker
Reviews.Content: We booked one using Hotwire, and the low rate is the only reason we're not too upset. Few things that not impressed us in this "4-star" hotel: - dirty pool - fight for few hours at night around our room with one of guests who claimed that things are missing from her safe - air conditioner that sends cold air into the face of the person on a second bed (besides strange noise). I had to move my kid to sleep on another bed and woke up twice at night sneezing... - single coffee pack (another one is decaf) in the room with two beds - location that is not easy to find and parking in another building

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pre-cruise hotel, fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrails2U
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night before our cruise. I booked the room on Hotwire for ~$100 with all the taxes/fees. After booking, I was VERY afraid after reading all the reviews on tripadvisor. When we arrived at the hotel, I actually thought we were in the wrong place, since I expected something dated with poor service. We were given fabulous service from the moment we arrived until we left. We received great service from the bellman, front desk, concierge and any staff member we encountered. The room was beautifully decorated, clean, and we had no problems whatsoever. Our room had double beds that were rather small, but comfortable. For whatever reason, the staff at the front desk put us in the Regency Club level, where they serve wonderful hors d'oeuvres and continental breakfast in the lounge area. I have often been treated like a second-class citizen for booking on Hotwire, so this was a surprising twist. The concierge arranged a shuttle to the cruise ship port for $6/person, and the drive only took about 5-7 minutes. We had 5 people, and a lot of luggage, so this was better than a taxi in our case. For 1-2 people, taking a taxi would be fine and would probably cost about the same. We will definitely be back to this hotel, whether or not we are planning to take a cruise. This hotel is in a very convenient location for anyone going to the Port of Miami and it is walking distance to Bayside Marketplace.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for one night stay”
Reviews.Author: iamgolden
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for one night pre-cruise (I don't appreciate the other reviewer referring to cruisers as "white trash" thanks pal) Our flight didn't arrive until 10:30PM, and at check-in they tried to give me a smoking room, which was unacceptable. We ended up with a handicap accessible room on the concierge floor. The only downside was that the shower was open with no curtain for a wheelchair, and the floor flooded a bit when we showered. The room was quite nice, and we had access to the delicious free buffet on our floor in the morning. In the morning, it was an easy walk to a nearby CVS to pick up some last minute items. I got a great deal for the room on priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you're a Convention Attendee!”
Reviews.Author: jblue212
Reviews.Content: Convention Hall is across the lobby of this hotel... Restaurants are good... Swimming Pool is ok... Service is good to great! http://www.hyatt.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but HORRIBLE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: jekijeca
Reviews.Content: I work for a hotel so when we got the great hotel at a great price through a Hotel partner i was excited. our Hotel Partner Director of Sales made reservations for the 10 of us and guaranted it with her credit card. i called and switched her Credit Card to mine, however since it was a business trip my hotel provided a letter of authorization for Room & Tax and Incidentals. to the hotel for my stay. I called to verify that they received it and they told me they did. Once i arrived to the hotel to check in.. i reminded the front desk clerk that he was to use the provided letter of authorization on file.. he told me he was.. Imagine to my suprise next day that my credit card was authorized for incidentals even though they had a card for that stuff. i called the front desk about this and the desk clerks just said "well this sometimes happens we are sorry about that" i was furious.. this shouldnt even happen when you had a credit card on file. my second suprise came 2 days later when the Director of Sales that reserved the rooms originally called me and said hey did you know they charged your room and tax to my credit card?" i felt soo embarresed first of all and told her that i would take care of it.. i had to call and explain the situation the the accounting department which certainly felt like this happens all the time at this hotel according to the person i spoke to.. i asked what happened to the Letter of Authorization they received. and she told me that it must be somewhere in reservations but she would have to go down and search for it. she was kind enough to reverse the wront credit card and charge the right one.. after all that i asked to speak to the general manager and i was transfered to the catering manager. who told me she explained the situation to the GM but he had to run out and she was willing to help me . i had to explain the situation 3 times before she understood it and then she told me that she would address this issue with the GM who would call me and follow up.. GUESS WHAT.. HE NEVER CALLED!!! i think this hotel is great but seriously the left hand doesnt know what the right is doing! what happened to interdepartmental communication.. and certainly the service is definately not to the standard of a 4 star property and that of a HYATT.. so unless you like deeling with wrongly charged credit card charges... i woundt recommend staying here..

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: akeka
Reviews.Content: I stayed an extra night at the end of a business trip to visit family the next day. Got the Hyatt Regency Miami on priceline and it was well worth the value. The bed was very comfortable and I appreciated the flat panel TV. The bathroom toiletries were very good although the bathroom could have used a makeup mirror. Take the metromover which you can get to without going outside to the Bayside Marketplace for other eating options (although the Capital Grille is in walking distance). I had the breakfast buffet at the Riverwalk Cafe which was very tasty with fresh squeezed orange juice, fresh fruit, pastries, breakfast meats, eggs benedict, scrambed eggs, waffles, etc. It was pricy but delicious and I had excellent service. I enjoyed the pool and gym in the morning before checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Particularly If You Get A Bargain Rate”
Reviews.Author: dickie98
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for one night having got a very good rate on priceline. The hotel is in a good downtown location with the Bayfront area easily walkable and the metromover easy to access. Check in was quick, polite and friendly. The room was nice, although the layout of a three quarter wall between the bedroom and the wash area/bathroom was a little odd, couldn't see why they couldn't just make this a separate room (has this always been a Hyatt or is this a left over from a previous existence?) The bathroomcould do with some work - the five setting showerhead actually only had one setting and the fitting generaly needed replacing and it needed a good clean in terms of the tiles etc. The bed was comfy, and the room layout fine. The flat screen TV was good, although the signal at imes erratic. Web access was $9.95 aand wasn't a great bandwidth so ran quite slow. I never understand how budget hotels can offer internet for free and the high ends charge. The cafe downstairs serves a selection of Starbucks coffees and teas, pastries, yoghurt etc and the staff were very friendly. Valent parking is an obscene $40 a night - self parking is around the corner for $12.25 per night and there is a connecting walkway into the hotel. At rack rate this wouldn't be great but at a priceline or discount rate this is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever happened to Hyatt standard?”
Reviews.Author: Maranita
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and are Hyatt members but this Hyatt hotel was a total disappointment. The smell of old carpets hits you as you enter the lobby. The suite was quite large but badly planned and the bathroom was probably nice 30-40 years ago. The furniture were better that's why the photos looked OK, but the smell of dirty carpets was everywhere. The pool area wasn't any better, our children didn't even want to be there. If we hadn't paid in advance nothing would have made us stay a single night. (A Hyatt hotel I can recommend is Hyatt in Singapore, but this was terrible).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, old hotel”
Reviews.Author: crsampieri
Reviews.Content: Good service from hotel's and restaurant's staff, it's very close to the Brickell St. and has access to the Metromover a very good option for moving in Miami Downtown (is free by the way); We'd rented a car and the second day we returned it because we were very close to Brickell, we preffered to walk 1/2 blocks, and we went out for dinner using the Metromover (the Mary Brickell Village has very good options, you step down from Metromover in the 10th St. Station for going there), a very cheap bus service departs/goes to the Dolphin Mall from the hotel, is a good option for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Old Dorm Room feel to it”
Reviews.Author: Tita75
Reviews.Content: I just returned from staying four nights @ this hotel. I cannot say I loved staying here, the room has a musty smell to it, it really reminded me of old college dorm rooms. The beds, desk, tv and curtains are about the only things that have been "remodeled" in this room since the bathroom and division clearly dates back a couple of decades. The staff was great and to their merit do make an obvious effort to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. The parking is quite a distance away (the self park) unless you want to pay $29.00 which if you ask me is outrageous to pay since it's almost 1/3 of what you're paying for the room if you get it at a good price. I booked mine through Priceline for $75.00 a night and hence had no choice of where I would stay, but I don't think I would stay here again. Though it was cheap, last time I got the Hilton Downtown and enjoyed it more. The lobby was ok enough. The food from Room Service was not good either, the taste was bland. Try Phillipe Chow's in South Beach @ the new Gansevoort Hotel if you are traveling to Miami and want somewhat of nicer "Miami" experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: BLG320
Reviews.Content: I was a bit disappointed with this hotel for a few different reasons. The main reason is that they recently sealed all of there balconies so there is no balcony access or windows that open. There is no mini bar or refrigerator in the room. If you want to access a computer it's going to cost you $10.70 for 15 min. The bathroom is odd, the toilet & tub are in a room alone and the sink is on the other side of the door. Cleanliness is just OK. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripkim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Miami the night before our cruise. This was a great hotel and we would be happy to stay there again in the future. It is actually connected to the convention center and the metro mover so it's very easy to get around town.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, very friendly staff and well-located.”
Reviews.Author: ady111
Reviews.Content: It's a fairly large hotel. I was upgraded to a Petite Suite, which is quite spacious and well-appointed. The staff, which is now becoming almost a habit with most Hyatts, was very friendly and out to help. Special thanks to all the members of the front desk for a memorable stay. Prices tend to be quite reasonable with this property, and even though it is right off the exit from I-95, it is quiet and not chaotic. Good experience overall, and will stay here again as and when work/pleasure takes me back to the Miami area.

Reviews.Title: “not sure about the other review..my stay was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: tbchunter
Reviews.Content: as in the last reviewer i bought these rooms inexpensively and after reading the reviews here spoke to my wife about canceling them. what a mistake that would have been i have literally travelled the world on business and pleasure many times over and whether it was the Peninsula in Hong Kong or the Ritz in California i have never encountered a staff this friendly, accomodating and competent. i have to say i never give excellent reviews but in this case: the room was clean and modern and newly renovated, the air conditioning was perfect, not loud, the room was quiet and with blackout curtains pitch dark at night. the location is downtown so no nightlife... but i wouldn't trade this hotel for a south beach hip one for anything. you will not be sorry booking this. kudos to bellman michael and manager deon

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.....”
Reviews.Author: Nixjag
Reviews.Content: After bidding on a room at the Miami Hyatt and getting one for $79 a night for 4 nights, I then read the reviews on Tripadvisor...and then regretted booking this hotel.
