Despite not liking Miami itself, I must say this hotel was excellent- and I hardly ever find it warranted to gush about hotels. Every member of staff, from the valets to the bartenders, behaved like they had just come out of etiquette class. I only ate appetizers a couple of times at the hotel bar, but if they are any indication of the quality of the rest of the food then don't be afraid to eat here. The bar menu sliders were great, as was the empanada. Parking is expensive at the hotel, but try parking anywhere in Miami. At least the valet service is so good it softens the blow of the $29 a night charge.

Reviews.Title: “I was impressed with the staff”
Reviews.Author: dwalters872
Reviews.Content: Overall I was fairly impressed with the stay at this Hyatt. I just returned from a four day conference at this hotel. The room was pleasant and clean. However, I did find having the sink outside the bathroom a bit of an annoyance. My wife came with me, and trying to use the sink without disturbing her in the morning was a bit of a challenge. The most positive aspect of the hotel was the staff. Every staff member proved to be exceptional and went out of their way to see to our every need. From the front desk personnel to the concierge, to the bell captains and valet parking staff, no question was too small, no request unreasonable. They provided my wife with the information that she needed to enjoy her free time while I attended conference sessions. I intend on sending a short message to the hotel manager commending his staff. Was it the Ritz? No, but it was pretty darn good.

Reviews.Title: “FILTHY, left with bedbug bites!!!”
Reviews.Author: alymr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel to stay at the night after our Royal Caribbean Cruise. When we arrived they didn't have the KIng we had requested so we ended up with 2 beds-no big deal. I was dying for a nap. I got into my bed, and turned the pillow case around to find crusted red food particles that looked like caked on pasta sauce on the pillows!!! I was wayyyy too tired to ask for another one, so slept pillowless. We went our for lunch at around 1pm and brought leftovers to the room. Around 3 pm I put those leftovers outside our room. When we left for dinner at 8 pm, the food was still outside the room. We came back at midnight and the food was STILL outside the room. My husband moved it to the garbage can at the ice machine. When we checked out the next morning, the garbage was STILL there!! We didn't see any housekeeping staff the entire time we were there. The next day when I was getting on the airplane, my head was really itchy...by the time I got home by head was red, flaky and itchy and my entire back, stomach and chest was covered in tiny little itchy red bumps. BEWARE DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!! The hotel refunded me what we paid, but they would have to PAY ME again to stay here! This is NOT a 4* hotel, I would call it more like a 2.5*

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco? If that means tired late 80s dump”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: I had to laugh at the description of this hotel as "art deco". This is a 1980s vintage officer tower with no architectural distinction whatsoever. Tired public areas that are completely original. My room on the Regency Club Floor and had a new bed and tv but the bathroom was tiny and the carpets old and tired. This place is adjacent to the convention center so it can hold attendees hostage. After arriving on a red eye from LA I was dismayed to find no blackout curtains. My Hyatt Gold Passport Platinum late checkout was not honored. All in all a very below average hotel that I would not stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches!!”
Reviews.Author: rfung2328
Reviews.Content: Beware of this hotel - we checked in and there cockroaches in the closet and washroom. They apologized and upgraded our rooms - thank goodness that took care of the fact they had cockroaches "eyeroll". Caprets are filthy and the hotel is dated and in a poor location. Try southbeach - avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time!!!”
Reviews.Author: Colibri30
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, great location, perfect for business or romance gateway, close to port of Miami and Metromover station.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hyatt ever seen ; ashame!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MaraBrazil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a mess. The rooms are awfull, the carpet is disgusting ans the bathrooms are dirty. The bedroom windows dont open so they never opened to clean the room and change or recycle the air. The end result is that you can feel the huge dust and the terrible smell of the bedroom. If you have asthma or any breathing problems you can die here. TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE. Stay on a hostel and you will be better.

Reviews.Title: “Good stuff!”
Reviews.Author: Rigafan
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline so wasn't too sure what we were going to get, but it was a pleasant surprise once we arrived. It was a holiday weekend, therefore downtown Miami was especially quiet, but we enjoyed the fantastic view from the room and all the comforts the room had to offer. We were very happy with our room which had two double beds, both really comfy! As a European tourist I would have a bone to pick with the bathroom - NO WAY was that a four-star bathroom, even if the room was four-star standard. But as I have seen the same kind of thing in other American 4-star hotels, I guess it's just an American thing :) And in any case, the bathroom was fine, there was nothing wrong with it, but it wasn't luxurious either as you would find most 4-star European hotel bathtrooms are. All-in-all we loved Hyatt Regency Miami and would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic conference hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: JustOneBoomer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent four nights at the Hyatt Regency Miami. He was there for a conference at the hotel and I was a trailing spouse. I concur with most of what I've read about the rooms. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was so so, with a separate sink area, excellent water pressure, and a good sized closet with an ironing board. (No complimentary shower cap which I found strange for this type of hotel). The room climate controls were good, but the hall could get noisy, partly the housekeeping staff and partly teenagers staying there for an international tennis competition. We were on the fifth floor, facing the draw bridge which results in clanging bells with each opening. There was also some noise from the room next door on one side that had a door connecting to our room (locked during our stay). Nothing was intolerable, especially since we always travel with our white noise machine. The lobby was large, soaring and bustling at times. When we checked in, there was no line, but at other times, the reception desk seemed quite busy. The concierge desk staff was very helpful and the staff in general were quite pleasant. They had obviously had some training in customer service. I don't get the description of the hotel as "art deco". It seemed more like basic 1980's conference hotel architecture, to me). For Art Deco---visit South Beach. There was a smallish pool and a quite small gym for a hotel of this size. If we weren't in Miami for a specific conference at the hotel, we probably would not have chosen to stay in this location. Downtown Miami is sort of like Dallas---they roll up the streets at night. They are still building condos, but it really felt like a ghost town---even during a work- day, sort of. Our original plan was to rent a car since we also planned to see our son at the Univ of Miami in Coral Gables and to visit South Beach, but as we were standing waiting for the rental car shuttle at the airport, we had second thoughts and I'm glad we did. It was much more convenient and overall probably cheaper (or the same price) with less hassle, to use cabs (or the Metro for the University). Without much traffic (i.e. on Saturday), it was only about a 15 minute cab ride to the airport and to and from South Beach. Cabs were readily available at the hotel. As is reported by others, this hotel is a busy place---conferences, cruise patrons, air crews, social events, etc. The hotel is attached to the Miami Convention Center. The first day, we walked south over the draw bridge and thought we were literally in the middle of nowhere, but there are places to visit if you ask around. In terms of places to eat, the hotel seemed only to have a coffee bar, regular bar and a restaurant. We ate at the restaurant one night after a late conference session. It was pricey---a la carte for everything and entrees $20-to over $40. The food was good, but I wouldn't consider it a destination had we not been staying at the hotel which made it very convenient. By asking at the concierge desk, I found out that I could get to an Au Bon Pan and Starbucks for breakfast by walking through corridors and tunnels connecting the hotel to the Bank of America Building, across the street. (These are both closed on the weekend.) The Starbucks did not have internet access (?), but the hotel had wifi for $10 per day through T-Mobile. It mostly worked ok, but was occasionally intermittent. The hotel is also walking distance from decent restaurants with an outside dining at a mall on the waterfront (the name of which escapes me at the moment) from which one can also book boat tours of Biscayne. We also walked to Mary Brickell Village. The shopping part seemed like it was still trying to fill up with stores, but we had a very nice outside lunch at a French Bistro there and there seemed to be other good choices. The hotel is also walking distance from the free downtown People Mover which connects to the elevated Metro. Miami is not known for its public transportation, but the Metro does go to Coral Gables, where the Univ. of Miami is located) and a bit south of there. The fare is $2.00. But, if you wanted to visit the Miracle Mile shopping district in Coral Gables, you would need to take a cab from the Metro stop. (By the way, even if your kid is not attending the University of Miami, the Lowe Museum there is not overwhelming in size, but has a good, eclectic collection.) I believe you could also use the Metro to get to the Vizcaya estate which is also worth a visit. This is not a hotel where you would stay if you wanted to hang out on beaches, but we found a nice walk in a park around the perimeter of Brickell "Village?", a nearby island of condos. You walk across a bay bridge to get there---after also crossing the draw bridge immediately south of the hotel. (It had an opening while we were walking back, natch). The draw bridge is also a place for possible manatee sightings. (The walk to and around the island takes about an hour and a half---without dawdling, but not running, either). It was about 75 degrees when we left for the Miami Airport and 32 degrees, windy and snowing when we arrived back in Philadelphia----brrr.

Reviews.Title: “plain ole hotel”
Reviews.Author: CreoleBarbie
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 nights during my participation in a conference. Parking was on the other side of the convention center. Front desk staff was pleasant. The location is ok, right off of I-95, downtown is dirty (but Iâ€™m not too fond of Miami). The room layout was very nice, beautifully decorated with interesting dÃ©cor and a great view.

Reviews.Title: “4* downstairs but 2* upstairs”
Reviews.Author: davegaijin
Reviews.Content: The lobby, bars and generally everything at the lower level is pretty much 4*, the restaurant is a little pricey, and the staff there need some better organisation IMO. The food is good. The bar staff were really attentive and excellent. My main gripe is the quality of the rooms. They state that the hotel has had an extensive makeover, well the room I was in (11th floor) was poorly fitted out. The room was large, and the bed was great. There was a flat screen TV which was good. However, the bathroom was just appalling for a 4* hotel - I've posted pics so that you can judge yourselves. The shower was something out of the 70's, pressure was good, but the shower-head was just like a fire hose, the bath was very poorly fitted and the door was 3 different shades of brown where obvious patching had taken place. The room itself felt tired and worn - mainly because it was. The - welded shut - balcony doors are single glazed, so you get the noise of the traffic and on-going construction work filtering through to your room. There is a nice walk around the riverside, but there are a few bums who sleep on the benches - never saw them hassle anyone, and I didn't feel unsafe, but It didn't add to the experience. The general staff are very good, very polite, and work hard for you - it is a shame that the hotel rooms are letting their hard work down. I was staying there on business, but I really would not choose to pay to stay there. If someone from Hyatt is reading this - please get your act together in this hotel! You are really letting your staff down. You can even contact me for a more in depth opinion if you wish.

Reviews.Title: “Moldy Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Mil9217
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before right after renavations, it WAS wonderful then, don't look like they have cleaned the bath tub, sink, or tolet since. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay price, okay quality”
Reviews.Author: TravelerGrrrl
Reviews.Content: I was a weeklong guest attending a conference at a nearby hotel. The Hyatt Regency is in a decent location, a quick 15 mins from MIA and about 45 mins from FLL airport. Heading to South Beach takes about 15 mins ($25 taxi ride), and other shops (e.g., Bayside, downtown) are within a few blocks walking distance. Check in/out is convenient as there are self-service kiosks in addition to the regular staff. There are restaurants on-site, but I would advise scouting out locations outside of the hotel as you'll get more bang for your buck. Pros: * Spacious room with decent views (overlooks a drawbridge or the cityscape) * Comfy bed with tons of pillows * Great water pressure in the shower * Hotel lobby connects right to the MetroMover (free to ride) * Close to a lot of family-owned restaurants - great variety within a block or two * Two blocks walk from the shops at Bayside (100+ stores) * Decent price for being so close to the port/Biscayne Bay Cons: * Rooms are a little outdated and need some touch ups * Balcony doors don't open * Depending on what side you are on and how high up you are, you're either hit with the noise of the drawbridge or the street traffic * Fitness center is *tiny* * Restaurants on-site are expensive

Reviews.Title: “don't be fooled by Hyatt - balcony doors don't open!”
Reviews.Author: fx40
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it advertised balconies with a view. Well, the balcony door doesn't open to any of the rooms, contrary to what they tell you before booking. I felt deceived because I thought it would be nice to have a room with a balcony and view. Speaking of the view, I was on the 15th floor and my view consisted of the concrete jungle---looking down at roofs of other buildings. Around 11pm, staff thought it would be a good idea to pick up the trays outside rooms and wake everybody up while doing it. Hyatt Miami is listed as a 4-star hotel, but in reality it's more like a 1.5 or 2------try the Hilton instead!

Reviews.Title: “Good price and value for Miami”
Reviews.Author: misstraveler2008
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hyatt in downtown Miami and was pleasantly surprised after reading some of the reviews on this site. The hotel is very conveniently located to the airport and downtown and is just a short cab ride to all the action in South Beach. The hotel was recently rennovated -- and my room was nicely furnished. The lobby was nice and the service I experienced at this hotel was excellent. You can't beat it for this caliber of hotel in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* - more like a 2.5*”
Reviews.Author: umhao000
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hyatt for 1 night prior to our cruise. For one night and the price we paid (quite low) - it was ok - but I wouldnt want to spend more than 1 night there. The restaurant - overpriced - better to take a little walk to the people mover and go to Bayside or McDonlads. Decor - similar to what other reviewers noted - for a place that was just recently reno-ed - it look like a throw back to the 80's; dusty (beds were comfy though). Our balcony window was sealed shut. Any ways - for one night not bad, for anymore...I would rethink

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: haakonks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel eight days in April, while on a Business trip with work. I was attending a conference held at the convention center beside the hotel. The room was large and nice. I had a king bed, a table with a chair and a couch, and a work desk. The bathroom looked a bit old, but was clean. I used the valet parking service, a bit expensive, but very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “I was satisfied”
Reviews.Author: kms_denmark
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the hyatt for about a week doing business in miami. I had a nice stay, and the staff was really friendly. Very nice breakfast and a wellequiped and clean gym. Room was spacious and clean. Only bad thing to add was the fact that wireless internet access costs and parking is a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all happy with this Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: shellyaz
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent/group coordinator and decided to stay at the Hyatt Regency for a night before our cruise. In one word: Bad! The lobby was rather lovely and modern. Elevators were nice. The Riverwalk CafÃ© had a full buffet breakfast and the food was good. The dÃ©cor in the guestroom had been replaced fairly recently and it was appealing in earthtone colors. However, the cleanliness of the room was terrible. Little white specks of tissue (or something) were across the entire room, indicating they did not vacuum. The room had been irresponsibly painted and paint smears ran from the wall onto the carpet in several areas. Both beds were comfortable; however, when I took down the duvet to get into bed, little tiny black hairs were all over the pillowcases and sheets. (When the housekeeping manager came back with a maid, they both were changing the sheets and she started to leave the same pillowcases on the pillow. He quietly told her to remove them as well.) The bathroom was moderately clean, but the caulk along the entire wall and bathtub was pitch black with mold. The ceiling had mold spores that covered at least a 2 ft. by 1 ft. patch. Apparently, they had tried to paint over it â€“ which didnâ€™t help. The square light in the ceiling was rusted and orange along the edges, along with black mold spores. Chunks of the ceiling were missing around the entire light fixture and were edged in black mold. Went to make coffee the following morning and there was a long blond hair and dust inside the coffee maker water well. The hall that led out to the pool was very small and dirty. The pool area was extremely small as was the pool. The fitness area was rather nice, with modern equipment. Several times as we would walk down the halls, the housekeeping staff would be walking in rooms and guests were complaining about their rooms. A few talks in the elevator proved the lack of cleanliness was rampant throughout the hotel and not just in our room. Parking was terrible, with a 15 minute walk through the garage, the Bank of America building, through the Convention Center, up escalators and into the hotel. $12.00 per night. Valet is $23.00 per night. The Metromover was convenient to travel around the downtown area and it was free, but required the same type of walk as the parking garage. It was a little creepy, but okay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Close to Port”
Reviews.Author: RabbiWebster
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly standard: clean rooms, friendly staff, overpriced restaurant. If you're going to the Port for a cruise, as we were, it's a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Confused by the Hyatt Miami”
Reviews.Author: meetingsfirst
Reviews.Content: I am a meeting planner and have stayed at this hotel several times. When I came for a site inspection, everything was perfect. The front desk was attentive, the bellstaff were great, the sales people wined and dined me, even the General Manager and other Managers greated me and treated us like VIPs. However, I came back with my family in July, and stayed one night before a cruise. The front desk staff were ok, We had to wait over 30 minutes for our luggage to arrive to our room, then we're informed they forgot about it, the rooms smelled a little musty even though they were recenly renovated, (btw the bathrooms are not), we experienced very slow service the following morning in the restauarant. All in all, the experience was a dissapointment. Especially after the experience I had before, when I was treated like a VIP So what is it? Does only a meeting planner deserve a nice clean room and great service? Are they not in the HOSPITALITY business? Shouldn't everyone be treated the same, after all, we are all paying for the room. Why should the meeting planner get better treatment than other guests, or the regualar people attending the meeting? What kind of messages are these people sending their staff members? Give the meeting planners the white glove treatment and ignore everyone else?

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Ginnybug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I attended a dance event at the hotel. He arrived Saturday, July 12th, and I arrived the following Friday. The room was spacious with a very workable footprint and some very nice amenities. The oversized closet area allowed us to have a room free of luggage, shoes and the usual things you leave outside a typical dark, dinky hotel closet. The bed was extremely comfortable with a superb mattress and 6 regular pillows, 2 square pillows and a bolster, affording comfort whether we were sleeping, reading, or watching the flat-screen TV. The water pressure and temperature in the shower were exactly what you hope for and seldom find in a large hotel - perfect! The lavender-citrus shampoo, conditioner, lotion and soap are of superb quality and smell wonderful. They are available at a very reasonable price throught the "Hyatt at Home" catalogue in the room. The desk in the room is oversized with a marble-like top, so we didn't feel uncomfortable eating there. In addition, there was a 6-outlet power strip, convenient for charging the cell phones, the laptop and the battery of the digital camera. The light is also good for working or reading. The staff, especially our housekeeper and the staff at the concierge desk, went out of their way to be helpful - including making a couple of phone calls to see if a friend were registered at a nearby hotel. Each staff member I encountered made a point to give a gracious greeting - even on Sunday when about 80% of the hotel was checking out. There is no restaurant, but the coffee shop had lovely breakfast foods, fruit, yogurt , salads and sandwiches available from breakfast time until late at night. There were several restaurants a short walk away for guests wanting to eat outside the hotel. We didn't use the pool, but its location and that of the fitness center were well marked. There is very convenient self-parking next door, and valet parking as well. There is also a tram stop right next to the property. We were particularly entertained watching the drawbridge going up and down to let large vessels go through the canal. The meeting rooms are well lighted, nicely decorated, and kept at a very comfortable temperature (they were a little chilly when we weren't dancing, but very comfortable once we started, and that isn't easy to accomplish). I would recommend this hotel highly to anyone wanting to visit downtown Miami.l

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LarrySF0523
Reviews.Content: Clean room. Efficient front desk. Pricey restaurant. Construction across the street. Choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: CARoute66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here prior to sailing out on our cruise. This is a large busy hotel that had several conventions & parties taking place-including the Marine Corp Ball. They have a restaurant on-site which is pricey. The morning of our cruise, I took the advice of travelers who posted on the web to eat at a restaurant/hotel next door. Their morning buffet was a better deal & food was ok. No problems catching a taxi from the hotel to the port.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel for a conference”
Reviews.Author: img1972
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hyatt for a business conference. The hotel was fine - not great, not terrible. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel faciliates are acceptable. Downtown Miami does clear out at night, but there are decent restaurants within walking distance from the hotel near the marina. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: ColombiaRiz
Reviews.Content: I was in Miami for a night and booked this hotel through priceline. We got a rate of $65. I was nervous about staying at the Hyatt based on mixed reviews. Upon our arrival we were relieved. The room were were assigned was newly renovated, clean and comfortable. Although the room was new, it seemed a bit tacky and lacked coordination. The bathroom was the only part of the room that needed improvement. The bathroom was very institutional.... like a hospital bathroom. For a short stay the hotel fine... but just dont expect a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: coluv
Reviews.Content: Overall, very good customer service from employees. However, we encountered some problems not normally associated with bigger hotels. We drew the bath and got dirty water which was not warm at all. I contacted Jennifer, the desk supervisor. She was courteous and professional. She assured me that both engineering and housekeeping would immediately respond to the room. Neither happened but 30 minutes later we got a sheepish call from housekeeping saying the hot water for the hotel was not working. It got fixed within one hour. April in Florida is not as humid as the summer but I was still uncomfortable and wanted the room cooler. There is a user friendly controller for the room but I could not get it below 73 degrees. That is not unreasonable, but when you come in from a hot afternoon, it would have been nice to temporarily get it cooler. We stayed in Room 1702. There are five screw holes in the bathroom wall in plain sight; another three on the table by the TV screen. Again, the employees were nice to us.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for convention hotel...”
Reviews.Author: nbell8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 4 nights with my husband who was in for a trade show at the hotel. We had to stay here since the trade show was in the hotel but it was not bad hotel. We came in on a Saturday and the hotel price was way overpriced for Saturday ($300) but it lowered to $175 for Sun-Tues for trade show price. I thought the hotel was worth $175 but not $300/night. The bad thing about downtown Miami (which isn't specific to this hotel) is there is really no where to go by foot. We took taxis at night when we wanted to eat in restaurant outside of hotel. That got a bit expensive after a while. Downtown Miami is ghosttown after 5pm and would not recommend walking around (not many people on street and even in daylight the streets are full of bums). The metromover is connected to the hotel by walkway which was nice for sightseeing in daytime to Vizcaya (hop on the rail line from metromover) or taking mover to the bus stop in Omni for bus over to South beach (pay $3 round trip for bus to Southbeach vs. $40-$50 roundtrip for taxis). You can take the C,H,K, or S buses over to southbeach and the buses run pretty frequently. I wouldn't recommend doing this at night. The hotel restaurant was OK but were typically overpriced and you could easily get bored with the menu after 2 days. The breakfast buffet was actually good ($20 but alot of choices on things). The room was nice (up on the 20th floor) but was annoyed that the balconies were still closed. You can't go out there still. The room itself was nice and spacious. The king bed was very comfortable and gave you alot of pillows. Maid service was fine as well. You also get a free safe in the room to stash belongings like laptops. Would I stay at this hotel? Only if I had to stay here for convention or trade show and it was <$200/night. Otherwise I would stay over in south beach where you can walk around easier and more to see. Downtown Miami really isn't great (probably will be in 10 years) so its not great as tourist hotel. If your business is picking the tab up for things, then you probably won't mind this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel before cruisin'”
Reviews.Author: BeachTeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hyatt during Easter weekend before our cruise. The hotel was very nice. We were on the 23rd floor above the river. There was lots of construction outside but we didn't hear anything because of the high floor. The room was great. It was very clean and new looking. We ate at the bar one night. The food was really good but a little high. Watch out 1 soda was $4!!! We booked on Priceline and got a wonderful price. This is a nice hotel to stay at before a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “A nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: accbiker
Reviews.Content: I was here for a convention and it is every thing that a typical business hotel is (especially the prices). The renovations seem to be just about done and the previous problems reported in other reviews seem to have been resolved. I personally do not like Miami, but the Hyatt was certainly comfortable for the two days I was there and the staff was certainly attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at Hyatt Miami”
Reviews.Author: mightyquin
Reviews.Content: I had a conference at the Hyatt Miami and after reading the previous posts listed here, I was really nervous about it. Hubby and I stayed and had a wonderful time. The room was comfortable and nice and clean. After a day or two, the bathroom had a weird smell, but overall our stay was great. Smell went away also. Hotel staff is very accommodating and friendly. The MetroMover located right next to the hotel was very convenient. We took it to Bayside and Brickell. Bayside was great for restaurants, shopping, and boat tours. Not so impressed with Brickell as they are still undergoing construction. There were a few restaurants there but not quite ready for visitors. A taxi to South Beach was approx $20 and well worth it. Taxi to Parrot Jungle was about $13. The balcony doors still aren't able to be opened and there is a ton of construction around but our stay wasn't disturbed by any noise. It is a concrete jungle, but it's not as bad as some of the previous posts will have you believe.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: TonyPSP
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference...what a blah, boring, tired place...very overtaxed with conventions and cruise ship passengers. The neighborhood was glum, luckily I had a car and drove to south beach after meetings. Surprised this is a Hyatt...definite overhaul in order but this town is going through a lot of building...given the economy, who's coming here? If I had to do it over, I would commute here from south beach.

Reviews.Title: “Substandard Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: buzytraveler
Reviews.Content: I am a Hyatt Gold Passport Member so I chose to stay at The Hyatt Regency Miami, while in Miami for a meeting. I was extremely dissapointed. I was informed that the hotel has undergone extensive renervations. Instead, it looks as if the hotel has had a cheap makeover. Just some new budget wallpaper pasted on the hallway walls, flat screen tvs and sealed shut balconies to cut down the noise and mildew. However, that did nothing to eliviate the mildew problem in the bathroom nor the noise. And I was on a high floor!! The bathroom was outdated and grungy. The room was recently renovated, but it was not clean!! Yuck. And I was in one of their petit suites.!! The hotel restaurant is reminissant of a cafeteria. The pool was closed due to renovations. The hotel is located in the middle of a concrete jungle, right next to the I95 ramp. It is diffuclt, or almost impossible to walk anywhere. The only good thing was the Hyatt Grand Bed. It was comfortable. That is the only similarity this hotel has with any other Hyatt I have stayed at. In fact, Im surprised Hyatt has its name on this property at all. I have never written a hotel review before. The only reason I did so was that I was so dissapointed with this hotel that I was compelled to do so. I wrote the GM of the hotel, expressing my concerns, but did not receive a response. The good reviews here sound like the spiels I got from the hotel staff when I called to enquire about the hotel. So traveller beware!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable but safety an issue”
Reviews.Author: AK_Dublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days on a business trip. Ideal for those who are doing business in the city but not for tourists. Tourists should head to South Beach instead. The room was the standard Hyatt fair, nothing to complain about. Nice flatscreen tv. Doors to the balcony did not work however. I was in my room during a major power outage and had to desend 22 floors via the stairwell which was scary. I found an emergency exit that was blocked, tied with strong plastic ties. This left me feeling very uncomfortable about the hotels safety in an emergency.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Euroguy66
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is in a good location in Miami - close to the port for people going on cruises and just beyond the port is South Beach. The rooms in the Hyatt were setup differently from every other hotel I have been in and were very appealing. The rooms had just been renovated and still had that new smell to them. We were going to use the self checkin but there was nobody else at the checkin desk so just checked in as normal. Staff was friendly and fast at processing check in. The only area that could have used some work was the actual bathrooms. The room was obviously renovated but the actual bathroom had not been touched. The caulking around the bath tub was roughly done and the tiles were slightly greyed due to age. Not a major deal but was a noticeable difference. The one thing that was the best about this hotel was the fresh smell as soon as you walked in. There was not a trace of stale or humid air and this was a very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the worse major hotel to stay in Miami”
Reviews.Author: PandaExpress
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here because the main conference hotel was all booked up and this was the closest one. If you are paying on your own dime to stay here - you're better off staying somewhere else. First off - all the hotel rooms facing the marina aren't available due to construction. Second the staff at this hotel has got to be the most uncaring, non-attentive to detail staff in any hotel I've ever stayed in in my life. 1) Had to go back to the front desk 3 times because they kept giving me cracked keys which wouldn't work in the elevators (you need key to make elevator work) - the keys have a nasty habit of deactivating too - many times, people would try and it wouldn't work. 2) Specifically requested Wall Street Journal during my stay - never happened - had to call each morning. 3) Specifically requested turn down service each night - you guessed it! Never happened 4) Room service ran out of certain food items fairly early in the evening 5) Room had no luggage stand - I think this is the first hotel or motel I've ever stayed in where there is no luggage stand or anything besides the office chair to put your luggage on?!! 6) Hotel drapes are poorly constructed - they don't go all the way down to the floor so that in the morning bright swath of light enters the room since there is about a 2 inch gap 7) Room itself is way outdated and old - they have 1980's style faucet fixtures and were missing the H and C symbols. 8) Toilet seat was broken 9) "closet" if you can call it that - doesn't have a door - it has a crazy swinging pleated door thing - I don't even know how to describe it - but it really made it feel iike i was in a motel 6. 10) Internet service is SLOW - felt like I was on dialup - it was THAT slow Good news: 1) Fairly quiet - can't hear neighbors BEWARE 1) Hotel is used for cruises lots of elderly people around OR 2) Rowdy, hormonal teenagers waiting to go on a cruise - first floor they tried to put me on, about 10 kids were running around banging on each other's doors giggling like - well you know - kids! YIKES. With so many other hotel options in Miami - why torture yourself with this place?

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: papasquid
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times over the last few years and have always enjoyed our stays. My wife and I live in the Florida Keys and we find it convenient to spend the night in Miami when we are attending a sporting event or concert. The Hyatt is perfectly located in downtown Miami right on the Miami River where the river empties into Biscayne Bay. If you are in Miami for business or pleasure and need to have access to the downtown area and government centers this hotel is for you. The Knight Center (a convention center and concert venue) is located in the same building as the Hyatt. Miami's Metro-Mover, a clean and modern public transportation system which takes you to all the major government centers, sport and concert venues in downtown Miami has a station adjoining the Hyatt. The rooms are recently refurbished, spacious, modern and clean. Many of the rooms have views of the Miami River or Biscayne Bay. This hotel has all the services and amenities you would expect in a 4 star business hotel and deserves all 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: srfrgrl97
Reviews.Content: Good price for money, BEST location, within walking distance to Bayside shops which has Hard Rock cafe on the water and shops. Would not eat in hotel restaurant. Not enough food and took 1hour to get our food and we had very hungry kids with us.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but still remodeling.”
Reviews.Author: bigbob0708
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Hyatt Regency Miami for two nights from Feb 9 to Feb 11 of 2008. Our room was kinda of small but was clean and appeared to have just been remodeled. The room had a flat screen tv and all the small amenities. The only problem was that when we got to the hotel you could not get any ice from the ice maker. They were still remodeling part of the hotel and all the ice machines did not work, you had to go the the first floor restaurant to get ice. I complained to the front desk and they gave me a small refrigerator for two nights for free. This was our first time to miami and the bell men and service desk really knew where everything was to see. They gave great directions to all the attractions. Bayside Marketplace was only about 6 blocks away and you can really walk to it during the day. There is a CVS store close to the hotel. At night its not the safest to walk around as there are alot of bums around. I would stay there again once they fully remodel this place. The convention center that is connected to the hotel is pretty old. Self parking is not bad and its only like $12.50 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than what I've read from the Reviews here”
Reviews.Author: BBuddy
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hyatt for the Friday night before our cruise. We got in at about 4 PM and used the electronic kiosk in the lobby and had no trouble at all navigating through the screens. The lobby was very big and airy. The kiosk even printed out our room keys. Our rooms were on the 22nd floor and we over looked the convention center and northern Miami. The sliding glass door was welded shut however it didn't matter to us since we were only staying one night. The room was clean and the king sized bed was heaven to sleep in. I called downstairs to see if we could get a late check out and they said it was fine and we could leave at 1:30. The room is a bit odd since the bed is sort of in the middle of the room with a short wall behind it separating the bathroom area. We really like the soap products they put in the bathroom, especially the soap. there is construction going on in the hotel which we could see when we got off the elevator however, we didn't hear anything (we were on the other side). After going for a short walk we came back to the room to find that the hotel sent up vouchers for a free buffet breakfast for the following morning. The breakfast was fabulous! While eating we did hear some of the construction that was going on however it was only for a brief time and didn't marr our stay. I also worked out in the gym at 6 am and there was no one around. It's not a big gym but it had all the neccessary equipment I needed to finish my workout. They also have two treadmills, some bikes and an elipical. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: magtien
Reviews.Content: We just stay there for one day ahead of our cruise trip, it's a nice hotel link to the Knight Convention Center. The MetroMover is right there, walking inside the tunnel without going outside under the heat. A lot of constructions around that area. Hotel staff are very friendly. And when the check-in/out line was long, they immediately add some more staff to help you. However, the room design is a little bit interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Old 2 star hotel faking it as a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: WTMB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on Dec. 30th. I wanted a "special" night at a 4 star hotel. Well, half the hotel is under renovation and is closed. BTW, this is the half with the ocean view. We tried 3 rooms and all smelled bad. The hotel is dark and depressing. The rooms stink and as others have said they have balconies but they are shut so you get no fresh air. The pool was also closed. If you are looking for a place to sleep for one night and can get a $50 bid on priceline, it might be OK. Otherwise, skip this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service, hotel is improving with current renovation”
Reviews.Author: klarkent
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 2 years ago, and it was a dump, it needed renovation badly. I just return and I am happy to report the rooms have been nicely renovated. I had a corner room with a view of the Miami River, and all these empty condo towers that now dominate the Miami Sky Line. Rooms now have a nice plasma TV. Hyatt Grand Bed, nice seating area, and are nicely decorated. The meeting areas have also been completed. The Regency Club, Pool Area, and restaurants are currently being worked on as of 12/25/07. Food service is good to great, depends on what you order. There is decent fitness room where you can get a good work out. Customer Service was good to excellent. One thing I really liked was that the Metro Mover is just a short walk through the convention center, which connects to the Miami Metro Rail. South Beach, Coral Gables, and Coconut Grove are just a short drive/cab ride away. The location is centrally located to enjoy all of Miami. Things I did not like about the hotel: You can no longer use the balcony, and the windows no longer open. What a stupid move. Large new curtains block most of the windows; I pulled them back so I could get more sunlight, and a better view. There is a river smell in the hallways, but the air in the room seemed fine. Lobby area needs to be renovated as well; I hope this is also planned in the multi-million dollar renovation. In the end, this is more of a business/convention hotel, but if you donâ€™t want to pay the high South Beach hotel rates this will be a great place to stay once all the renovation is done.

Reviews.Title: “No Value and Bad Attitude”
Reviews.Author: Mercboy
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience! Construction across the street combined with poor sound insulation in windows. Construction on my floor (!!) with paint fumes and noise, peeled back carpet. Stayed over 24 hours and did not have room made up once. Outrageous parking charges, plus no free internet. Grumpy service - no one even asked if everything was ok at checkout. All of this for almost v$300 a night. The room had some very superficial renovation done (flatscreen, goo sheets) but the bathroom was ancient with moldy grout around sink and tub. STAY AWAY AT ALL COST!

Reviews.Title: “OKAY NOT THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: vcassidy
Reviews.Content: We had a corner room that not only smelled bad but had some sort of strange bugs in it. We only stayed one night and had it been longer would have moved. It is a wonderful palce to stay to be close to everything and the staff is really nice.

Reviews.Title: “What a smell!”
Reviews.Author: artstraveler
Reviews.Content: I just spent several nights at the Hyatt Regency Miami for a conference. It was a mostly unpleasant experience. The room had one of the worst, moldy smells I have ever encountered in a hotel, certainly in a Hyatt. I complained to the front desk and they did send someone to check on the A/C (there was moisture on the floor in front of it). There was a little card in my room that maintenance had visited, but I think the room smelled worse after they visited. The odor was pervasive throughout the hotel though, not just in the room. There was construction/renovation underway, but the odor was not one attributable to construction (though two of the days my floor also had pervasive solvent odors). In addition, these were some of the worst conference rooms I have experienced - poor lighting, bad sound systems. And for the rooms that had dividers the sound leakage from adjacent meeting rooms was so invasive that it was nearly impossible to concentrate, or hear, what was being presented in the session I was attending. I have stayed in many Hyatts over many, many years of business travel, and this was by far the worst one I have encountered. I seriously considered checking out and finding any hotel I could within the vicinity, but that was a challenge of its own. The Hyatt is completely surrounded by half-completed (and apparently halted) high-rise construction, freeways, and incredibly busy roads. It was virtually impossible to figure out how to walk anywhere from the concrete locked space. That all being said about the facility, I certainly found the staff to responsive, attentive and extremely helpful, up to the standards I would have expected and have experienced in a Hyatt. My experiences were ultimately limited to the front desk and the restaurant and the personnel was great - I commend them. Management on the other hand needs to think seriously about this property. I hope they are making it something worthy of there own staff and that the renovations will cure these ills. Check it out carefully before staying there. I would also say the exercise facility had decent and relatively new equipment. It was small - way too small for a facility this size, especially when sold out. But it was probably the nicest feature I encountered.

Reviews.Title: “No better place”
Reviews.Author: jamesunt
Reviews.Content: Just came home from a 7 day cruise from Miami. Stayed overnight in the Hyatt Regency Miami the night before the cruise. The location is only two miles from the pier. The Bayside Market Place is within walking distance as well as the American Airlines Arena. Taxis and Monorail are abundant for other transportation. The check in and check out was flawless, the room immaculate. Other reviews have stated some construction noise. This is because almost everybuilding around the hotel is being worked on. This too will pass when this part of Miami is transformed under the Riverwalk plan. Stay here!! Its great !!

Reviews.Title: “Disaster! Moist rooms... But fine service, and kudos to staff”
Reviews.Author: BetterthanBings
Reviews.Content: Another convention, another hotel. We had a nice, updated room on the 20th floor. Two queen beds, plus a walled-off dressing area that contained the closet, bathroom vanity area and separate room for shower-tub and toilet. The closet was roomy and shared by both of us. Plenty of room for a four-day trip. Nice decor, city view. Maybe it was just me, but it seemed the cityview side was drier than the water view. The first night, I got in before my room-mate, so bunked in with another friend in her cityview room. When I checked into the room we had reserved the next day, I was immediately struck by the smell of ... was it mold? It smelled of moisture. I called down to the front desk and asked if they had another room to show me. For the sake of comparison I stopped the housekeeping staff from delivering a mini-fridge before we settled on the room. Trust me, I checked out rooms on the same floor, back and forth, and chose the city view room that did not smell. I was glad, too, because as the days went on, I met people who were complaining of allergies. I asked one colleague who was really suffering, if he had a city view or water view. He had a water view room. I urged him to ask for another room on the city view side before he got sicker. But I wasn't immune on this trip; perhaps I travel with Calamity Jane. The first night, she got into bed before me and started to have an allergic reaction to the sheets. She had to take a Benadryl, but also take food soon afterwards. Long story short, there was no food because everything in the hotel was closed by then, and the hotel manager had to dig up crackers and water before she nearly passed out in the elevator. Once sheets and bedding changed, drugs properly taken, everything was back to normal and hunky-dory. Second night, same room-mate had turned in for the night (and I was out) and water started to cascade down from the overhead bathroom vanity light fixtures. While scrambling to move everything off the counter, my roommate managed to call the front desk to report this disaster. Turned out the guest upstairs had left the tub running when he left the room, overflowing onto the floors, and into our room below.... We got moved up to a larger room, thankfully. Last event: A mouse ran across the lobby floor in front of us as we went toward the elevator late at night, headed up for our room. No one screamed. I think the night manager was happy to see us leave. It's hard when a guest has those many things happen on consecutive nights...

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Experience Here”
Reviews.Author: promal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel one night pre-cruise in September and had a very pleasant experience. Our check in was quick and efficient. We were checked in by a lovely girl named Marie. We were given room 1610. The room was very clean. Our room overlooked another building being constructed. We checked in on a Saturday, so construction noise was not a problem. There are renovations going on in the hotel, but the areas being renovated were blocked off at the elevators and there was no renovation noise while we were there. The room was spacious with a balcony and the balcony door actually opened. However, neither of us stood too long on it - it was a bit scary so high and being so small. The room had a king size bed with very comfortable bedding. There was enough drawer space, a t.v., desk, closet area and bathroom area behind a wall behind the bed. The room was quiet - we heard no hallway noise at night nor any noise from our neighbors. The bathroom was small and did not have an exhaust fan, which was fine because the sink and mirror were outside the room. There was a coffee maker that made single cups of coffee. The room was bathroom (and room itself) was very clean. The only signs of wear I saw were in the bathroom - the door moulding looked like it was rusted on top of the door. Other than that, the room was just fine. There are no refrigerators in the rooms but one can be rented for $40. One of the people in our group was diabetic and had insulin that needed to be refrigerated. Marie provided a refrigerator in his room as no cost, since it was needed for medical reasons. We had a car rental and parked it at the hotel for $25 for the day. There was a Riverwalk Cafe in the hotel that served sandwiches, muffins, coffee, soda, etc. and a restaurant next to that. The restaurant was a bit expensive, so we bought delicious sandwiches at the cafe and took them to our room. We also had a nice breakfast from the Cafe the next morning. All staff we encountered were very professional and helpful. The hotel is conneected to the Miami Convention Center and there is a sundries store in that are as well as an Enterprise car rental storefront, which is closed in the early afternoon Saturday and on Sundays (a waste in my opinion - we had originally booked an Enterprise rent a car so we could leave it at the hotel when we left and take a cab to the pier. Instead, we changed our car to a Dollar rental and got a free shuttle to the cruise ship pier.) The hotel lobby are was just beautiful and there is also a small pool. Our room overlooked the river . We had read reports here of noise - the only noise we heard from our room was very fast trucks going over the drawbridge of the river and when we listened for it, we could hear the buzzer when the drawbridge went up. It did not bother us or wake us - but we also live near the landing and take off runways to JFK airport, so this was quiet to us. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed, very dissapointing Hyatt.”
Reviews.Author: EmmanLukesMum
Reviews.Content: I usually try to stay at Hyatt's when traveling for work; they have an awesome rewards program and they are usually pretty nice. I was really disappointed in this Hyatt. My room was badly in need of renovation and was very small (very clean though, kudos to Housekeeping). They were actually undergoing renovation so half the hotel appears to be sealed off. When I tried to get the elevator to go down, I kept hearing an elevator open on the other side of the construction partition, but not one that I could get to. Finally, I went up one floor to get an elevator to go back down. Also, the food in the restaurants is ridulously overpriced and just average. I ate in the lounge when I got in and paid over $35 dollars for fried shrimp and two beers. C'mon, this is bar food not high cuisine. I paid nearly $9.00 for a coffee and bagel in the lobby coffee bar for breakfast. On the positive side, their staff is very friendly and helpful and the hotel is in a great location if you need to do business in their financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Aging hotel, not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: gobux
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 2 day pre-cruise getwaway. Paying only 55.00 per night through Priceline, so we were not that upset about the accomodations. However, I am warning you that it is definitely not a 4 star hotel. Very moldy, rusty fixtures, blood on curtains, needed cleaning. Balconies are all sealed and there was a thick grease and handprints all over them. I do have to say that Cesar was more than helpful - he was a manager, and tried to make things right, but there is only so much he could do. He offered a renovated room, but those were also not up to par with a 4 star hotel rating.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid If You Can”
Reviews.Author: WestEndAvenue
Reviews.Content: NOT like all the other Hyatts. Really just a big, dirty 3 star hotel. There are so many other hotels for the same or less money in the area that are cleaner, have a better location and have a staff that acknowledges your existence.

Reviews.Title: “Nice convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: fwtexastraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four days at a conference in August. It was the convention hotel, and it's a fine one at that. The staff is helpful and knowledgeable, the rooms are updated and clean, and the restaurants decent. It's connected to Miami's downtown Metro rail system, which connects you to the nearby convention center, the financial district, and the bayfront. There are some decent restaurants one or two Metro stops away, but the hotel isn't very convenient to anything in "right-next-door" easy walking distance (except for a neat little ethnic bar and grill next door, where the owner promotes "Jeb Bush's Favorite..." specials. Wonderful place and great conversation with the owner! I can't remember the name, but it's the only restaurant that's next door to the hotel.) The hotel (and this bar and grill) front a working waterway, but the Hyatt provides no tables and chairs or other opportunities to sit right outside the hotel and enjoy this amenity. The hotel is a 15-minute cab ride to South Beach, or a 30-minute bus ride on a C or K bus that you can catch three or four blocks from the hotel. I used the bus for the ride over to South Beach, and caught a cab on the way back. There's an Enterprise rental car office on site, which is very useful, except that it closes at 6 p.m. on weeknights and isn't open Sundays. That means you have to pay to park your car overnight ($12 self-park and more in the hotel valet) if you return after hours.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Miami Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: CtheGlobe77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because I was attending a conference at the Miami Convention Center. The hotel is connected to the convention center, so it's very convenient. However, I spent more time going back and forth to South Beach for business lunches and dinners. A cab ride each way is about $20 - 25. The hotel itself is average. The rooms are clean, but the decor looks like it could use some updating. There was major construction going on across the street. The noise wasn't too bad, but the view from my hotel room looked out onto the construction site. Unless you need to be at the convention center or in downtown Miami I would recommend staying in South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: UKflightattendant
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed at any other Hyatt hotels, and I have to say, the Miami Regency is not a great advertisement for the brand. I have stayed here on a number of occasions - not through choice, I emphasise! - because of work. The construction work which other reviewers mention has been going on for at least two years - though in all that time, very little seems to actually have been constructed! There is a lot of noise in the hotel, from the traffic, (busy highways surround the hotel), other guests, (typical thin hotel walls!), and the construction work which is going on on every side of the place. Arriving yesterday, my key card didn't work. I rang down to the front desk and was told to come and get a new one as there was nobody at the bellstand and I would be waiting a long time. OK, fine, but hardly a response representative of a 4* establishment. The smoke detector in the room was hanging off the wall with exposed wiring, which necessitated a change of room. The 'replacement' was OK, though the carpets were still damp from what I presume was a shampooing, as the room was rather over-frangranced! Cleaning leaves rather a lot to be desired; it all feels rather perfunctory, with quite a lot of dust etc. and a used bar of soap still sitting in the shower. Breakfast is good and fairly reasonable price-wise, with a good selection and a pleasant, efficient staff team. Take advantage of this and fill up for the day! Smokers - which I am not! - take note: smoking is only permitted in rooms on the 15th floor so if this is important to you, confim and confirm again a room allocation. Because although there are balconies from each room, they are now merely decorative and a rather misleading feature of publicity shots! The hotel is now sealing all balcony doors so you have no access to them, in an attempt to minimise construction noise and reduce in-room humidity. However, this is a shame, as it is nice to be able to pop out for a few minutes or have a drink on the balcony etc. especially in mild temperatures. I see they make no mention of the balconies as a room feature on the website. All I'm saying is, don't let the pictures fool you! The rooms themselves are rather strange. Personally I'm not keen on the 3/4 'partition' which seems to create a cross between a dressing room and a bathroom. The sink etc. are separated from the actual bathroom - containing bath and toilet. Odd louvre door acts as both dressing-room door and closet door, depending on where you close it. I'd rather they have made the whole bathroom self-contained and separated from the rest of the room! Beds comfortable and room size is adequate enough. Seriously consider your options before committing to the Hyatt. There are other hotels of similar standard in the locality - the Intercontinental is just one - and it may be worth paying a little extra.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt reputation tainted”
Reviews.Author: cubnluvsba
Reviews.Content: date: July 19, 2007 We had an appointment at the Passport Office in downtown Miami and booked a room at the Hyatt because of its proximity to the location and relied on the "Hyatt" reputation for a good night's rest. Where shall I start to enumerate our disappointments? Although we were aware of some construction in the vecinity, we were unprepared for the difficulty in navigating in the area. If you miss the entrance (which we did), you have to go through what seemed like hoops and jumps to find it again. Parking: The only way to reach the hotel is by car, but the hotel does not offer parking. You can pay $15 for a one-time shot at a self-parking building around the bend from the hotel. We drove to it, and returned scared to leave our car there and even more to walk back from the parking garage. Granted, it was after 10:00pm, but this was r-e-a-l-l-y spooky! We opted for the other choice, paying $27 for one night's valet parking. The lobby looked elegant and the receptionist was polite. We got a room on the 12th floor. The elevator is activated by the room key - good security. The room itself was large, with two double beds (our party consisted of my husband, my 18-yr-old daughter and myself) that had good mattresses. There was a large dressing room separated from the rest of the room by a 3/4 wall - that also was nice. The room had been vacuumed but it had not been dusted for a while (you could blow the fuzz and dust off the lamps), everything that could turn to rust, had. The louvered door to the dressing room was filthy. The shower head was excellent, easy to adjust the pressure to your liking, and the water pressure itself was awesome. The toilet did not flush well and the sink drained very slowly. The towels were clean but it seemes the housekeepper had long hair, which I found on one towel, on the bath mat, on the sink, and on the top sheet of the bed. We had three bath towels, two hand and two face towels - we asked for an additional face towel and were told they keep track of their inventory and would charge our card if they found anything missing, but they did send someone with a whole set of towels. Thank you. The coffee pot was missing the carafe, so we could not make coffee in our room. Then the noise. It was horrible!!! The noise from the cars passing on I-95 was very loud and kept waking us up. They gave us coupons for the buffet breakfast. The employees at the restaurant were very nice, friendly and professional. The food was good but because they did not have warmers under the food, it turned cold very quickly. I would NOT stay at this Hyatt again. I'm not sure about other ones.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: JAD48
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency for a Convention being held in hotel. Got convention rat of $109. Nice-size corner room - but everywhere you looked outside it was a construction site. Many, many high rises being built. No problem with noise, but was out of the room all day. Food was expensive. Room service breakfast of bacon, eggs & coffee was $30. Nice take-out deli in hotel lobby not too expensive. A/C didn't work great - had to keep it at 63 to keep room cool. Very friendly staff. No where within walking distance to eat or shop. Lighting in bathroom very dim. All in all, very average city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: kelly_ar31
Reviews.Content: We checked in and left right away to meet someone for dinner. I didn't get to check over the room. There was mildew and mold on the grout and caulk in the bathroom, the finish chipped off on the handles of the sink. I did not prepay for that, so I went down to ask for another room. They sent me to look at a room, it was in worse shape. The 3rd room I took just for the fact it had less mildew then the others. The staff stated it was because of the humidity, well I live in North Port, it's humid here too. I do not have mildew, if it even starts to come, I pull out the Tilex. None of the tubs were spa. The vents didn't work. I wonder why there is mildew and mold. The room was on the 24th floor, not sound proof to the machines running on the roof. The internet access costs $10.00 a day, it is not free. There is NO Free parking period, guest or not. It was $27.00 a day. So not only are you paying a small fortune to stay in mildew, old bathrooms, you have to pay to park at their hotel. I'm use to staying at the Hampton Inn, I decided to splurge. Never again. I have yet to had a bad room there.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: fencermom
Reviews.Content: In Miami for a Fencing Tournament. Based on previous reviews I was a little bit worried but our room was moderately nice, although we were gone most of the time. The hotel is currently under remodel. Staff was helpful and always pleasant. Parking is VERY expensive but valet is quick to retrieve your vehicle when you need it. The surrounding vicinity is kind of seedy and there are no places to eat/shop near by. Hotel food is expensive ($12 for just a 6" round waffle - nothing else) but good. We enjoyed eating in the bar where the food was cheaper. Compared to hotel reviews from other travelers in our party sounds like the Hyatt was a good choice. If needed we would probably stay here again for a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “Average business hotel”
Reviews.Author: PoppyTT
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a stop over before travelling up to the gulf coast. It was ok. Nothing special. Central if you are on business. The layout of the room was odd as it had the sink in the bedroom as the bathroom was so small.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel_CMH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt in Miami due to a conference that my company was holding and I was pretty disappointed with the quality of the hotel. My room smelled very musty, there was a dirty washcloth in the bathroom and overall it was not as clean and updated as you would expect from a Hyatt. I wouldn't choose to stay here again if I had another option.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maac56
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a night before catching a cruise. The Hotel checkin staff were very professional and courteous. The bedroom was very well appointed, but the bathroom is overdue a makeover, it was like stepping back 20-30 years. Overall i would recommend this hotel and i got a very good deal by using the hotels own site.

Reviews.Title: “The Concrete Jungle”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetic_Engineer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because of a conference in this hotel. I do not recommend this hotel for anything except business trips or a one night stay to connect with a cruise ship. The hotel is showing its age and while they have renovated the rooms, the bathrooms are still small and show their heritage from a time when bathrooms were a necessity and not considered part of a luxury hotel stay. Our room faced the Bay but because of numerous condos under construction, our view was one of a concrete structure under construction. We could wave to the workers. It was also noisy. The draw bridge has an annoying way of waking you all through the night. As far as amenities, the pool is small. We never received a morning paper and there is only one restaurant in the hotel. There is no green space around the hotel. It is next to the convention center and everything is concrete. On the plus side, the food that was provided at the convention dinners was pretty good for buffet food. The chicken and beef was tender and the vegetables tasty. It will cost $27 for valet overnight parking and a taxi to South Beach is $25 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Good overnight stop before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: navigator
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight before boarding a cruise. The hotel is well situated for the port. It will cost approx $12 for a cab cab ride to the port. The hotel itself is clean and spacious, has a small shop for odd things you may of forgotten. As for the rooms, the rooms are spacious, the bath, shower and tiolet are seperate from the wash basin area where it is walled off for a private dressing area. The only fault I found was that the bathroom itself was dated and though clean, looked dirty. The free metro can be found out the back of the hotel which can take you to Bayside shopping centre. Cab is approx $8 to Bayside. The hotel is expensive for food etc but if like us, your bags have gone astray and you need to do some shopping for assentials then there are places within 5 mins which are much cheaper. If you go out of the front of the hotel down the slope to the right and look left. Approx 100 yards on the opposite side of the road on the corner is an International bakery which is great for breakfast. Come out and turn left and on the next corner you have a pharmacy. Out and left again to the next corner and you have starbucks with Walgreens opposite. Opposite Walgreens there is a little shopping centre where you will find a shop called marshalls. If you have any clothes to get then this is the place. $100 will go a long way here and it is branded wear. During the day you can walk to bayside which will take approx 15 mins.

Reviews.Title: “room reservation problems”
Reviews.Author: hwsdrea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regency one night before our cruise which seems to be the common customer at the hotel. We arrived from the airport at about 10:30 on a friday night and the line for check in was stretched across the loby. It took 45min to check in, because as it turned out the reservations people made online and recieved confirmations for were never actually reserved. Several groups in line before us checking in were told they had no room available and had to go to other hotels. We on the otherhand did get a room, however all that was available were smoking rooms. We did get a discount for the error but only after some complaining. I cant imagine being one of the people in line whose reservation was completely disregarded. I dont understand how a major hotel can have basic issues about knowing whether rooms with requested features (ie non-smoking and 2 doubles) are available at the time of booking, and actually RESERVING that room for YOU. The room was also very loud. I couldnt believe how much of the street noise we could here from the 15th floor in a "bayview room". If you do stay here request to stay on the side of the hotel away from the bridge. It is a metal drawbridge and you hear every single car drive over the grated metal surface. Additionally construction starts even on a Sat. morning very early and you hear all the trucks going in and out of the construction zone that you overlook. Out of the 4 adults who stayed in the room only one slept through most of the noise... the cars going over the bridge kept the other 3 of us awake most of the night. My parents also stayed here before our cruise and stayed on the other side of the building and had no issues.... so again TRY to request the other side of the building, although who knows if they will actually honor that request since they have trouble honoring general room reservations. Other features of the hotel were fine, nothing too special or too awful, although the bathroom was actually quite dismal, dim lighting, bare lightbulb, and tiny.... but I was otherwise ok with the status of the room. I would not stay here again, I cant imagine arrivng at a hotel with confirmation number in hand only to be told that no room was ever booked for me. After a long flight the last thing you want to do is wander around a new city trying to find somplace with available rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Dull, unexceptional, with a frown on its face”
Reviews.Author: OffTheBeatenPath
Reviews.Content: If you're used to the Motel 6, this hotel will be seem like luxury. However, if you're used to any level of service or comfort in hotels, the Hyatt will seem shabby. (Don't get me wrong, Motel 6 is great but doesn't cost $179/night at the corporate rate -- and there are hotels in the same price bracket as the Hyatt that are much better.) My main complaint was service. For example: My flight, already scheduled to arrive late in the evening, was delayed, so I arrived at the hotel at 11:45 p.m. after not having had anything to eat since breakfast. The woman at registration checked me in efficiently, but was clearly unenthused about doing so (not a single smile or pleasant tone of voice). When I asked if I could get any food, she told me room service was open until midnight but I'd better order at the bar. The bartender growled at me that the kitchen was closed; when I pointed out that I'd been informed it was open for another 15 minutes, only then did she get me a menu and let me order. Again, no smiles, clearly no joy in her job. (It's not the best job in the world, likely, but still, they are paid to be service-oriented.) Every time I dealt with anyone in the hotel over the next three days, they were borderline surly -- not a single smile ever, even when smiled at. When I got to my room, housekeeping had left the balcony door open and the lights on, so the room was humid and crawling with bugs. There was only one toiletry in the room: lotion. No soap, shampoo or conditioner. I called the desk and asked for some; an hour later none had arrived. I called again -- at 1:15 a.m. -- and only then did they bother to inform me they had none at the desk, housekeeping was closed, and they couldn't send anything up. (An hour+ of sleep lost.) The bed in the room was decent -- clearly upgraded recently to compete with other chains -- and the decor was fine, not exceptional but not offensive. On the other hand, the bathroom grout was full of mildew and the whole bathroom smelled of mold. Another plus: The fitness room was good -- not a ton of machines (basically two of everything), but what they had was new, with TV screens built in. The bar was pretty depressing -- low rent 80s decor with the clientele to match. It's named "Currents" -- which of course means it's the least current place you can imagine. (nice neon changing pastel colors behind the sign...very late 80s) If you have to stay in downtown Miami and you want a modicum of style for the same price, go to the Intercontinental. If you want to pay too much for a Holiday Inn room, go to the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “NOT 4 star worthy”
Reviews.Author: wks880
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our cruise. It is very close to the port and that was the only benefit we experienced. Our room was "tired". Walls were marked up, door to the bathroom had dirty hand prints, lamp didn't work, toilet was not level and "rocked" when a person sat down on it and the carpet was dirty. Downtown Miami is under major construction and the constant noise during the day was irriating. It woke us @ 0700 the following morning. We counted 26 cranes in the downtown area from our balcony. Use that as a guide for the noise level in the area. As well our room faced the boat bridge that alarmed EVERY TIME a boat needed through. Another cost we didn't expect $24.00/valet parking. The other option was parking in a public parkade for $12.50 without in/out privleges. Internet was not free. Disappointing for a 4 star hotel. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency - Missing A Couple Of Stars”
Reviews.Author: NYNat07
Reviews.Content: This hotel's 4 STAR rating is over-rated. One should not have to deal with issues such as soiled linens, dirty fridge (that did not work properly by the way) at a 4 star hotel. Other charges are OUTRAGEOUS - parking, phone usage etc. The room was just okay, more of what you would expect at a 3 star hotel - nothing to shout about. So the bottom line...OVER-RATED.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but nice”
Reviews.Author: flowercat13
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, but much too large for my tastes. Driving here is a nightmare and the walk from the parking garage to the hotel is very long. The lobby is so busy here. The room was nice and clean. I liked the modern decorations. The price was prettty good compared to other places in Miami, especially through hotwire. However, the traffic noise all through the night made trying to sleep here quite difficult, especially before a nerve-wracking early morning flight. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency Miami”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelmore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hyatt on 3/25 after a cruise on Carnival Valor. We had stayed here last year as well. Taxi fare from the Port of Miami to the Hyatt was about $27.00. We had early check in with no problem. We were in room 2230 which had a bay view. The first thing we noticed was there were no chairs on the balcony like last year. The sliding door was also stuck and we couldn't open it. We called the front desk to request both chairs for the balcony and for the door to be fixed, they sent some one up within an hour to fix the door. I also asked this person about the chairs. We spent the afternoon over at Bayside Marketplace, came back several hours later and still no chairs! There was also no ice bucket liner (there was a hair inside the bucket), and no ashtray (in a smoking room). I went to the front desk in person this time to ask for chairs, a liner and ashtry. In about 30 minutes the liner and ashtray arrived, and the guy said he was going to go get some chairs for the balcony. Well, we checked out at 6:00 am for our flight and we still hadn't received any chairs for the balcony, and the person at the front desk didn't bother to ask how our stay was. Luckily I had reserved this room at a discounted rate through Working Advantage for $135.00, but was still disappointed in the lack of service in comparison to last year. The room rate listed on the door was $559! They've got to be kidding! Don't get me wrong, the hotel is not horrible by any means, but I'm not so sure I will stay at the Hyatt on our future trips to Miami. They have put up three new condo's or hotels nearby since the last time I was there that you don't have a great view of the bay any more. And chairs for the balcony seem hard to come by ;)

Reviews.Title: “good but noisy construction”
Reviews.Author: sam629
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel while attending a convention in Miami. The hotel itselt was fine--even good--but the noise level from the construction all around was really quite bothersome.
