On the days we left the hotel prior to 8:00am and returned after 7:00pm, we experienced no noise. However, even on Saturday morning, there was construction. That being said, our room was large and, had there not been construction, I think we would have enjoyed the view of the bay. We had a great, comfy king size bed with clean linens and a nice fluffy duvet, a pullout coach, coffee table, desk, and chair. While the hotel doesn't want to change the towels and the sheets, we requested the towels changed daily and the sheets changed twice in our 5 night stay. The tv was located on an island in the middle of the room. There was no mini bar in the room but a some store was open very late at night--very convenient. We had plenty of towels. The housekeeping staff replaced shampoo and soap. The bathroom itself could really use some updating. In the bathroom, there was a space where there most likely was a set of shelves--it seemed wierd open and the floor and molding were in disrepair there. Newspapers were available at the consierge desk and cabs easily hailed by the bell staff. Check in and check out were quick. We did not get to the pool but it looked nice. The food and service in the sports bar were good. I ordered room service on a Friday night. It came quickly, the server was very polite and friendly, and the food was really good. This hotel adjoins the Miami Convention Center (our convention was not located here). We did walk through this convention center to take the Metro Mover on Saturday morning. A free and interesting idea, the map is a bit confusing for newbies. Saw security twice and there were cameras everywhere. I was a bit freaked but frankly, it's cleaner than NY subways and probably safe--I'm just not used to it. We had a convention rate but had to pay the full rate of $269 on our last night which was a Saturday night. Having stayed in hotels of the same and better caliber in several major cities, my feeling is this is too high for this particular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: j&kmusic
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews I was a bit apprehensive about the Hyatt, but I was pleasantly surprised. I requested to be far from the construction, and the front desk was very accommodating. I got a great room with a view and two balconies with sliding glass doors! I was impressed because they knew I was a priceline customer, and they didn't announce it upon check-in (as has happened frequently to me) and were happy to honor a room request (as a priceline user, I can say that has never happened before). The beds are excellent, the room was very nice and spacious, the location is pretty good although downtown Miami seems seedy in general and completely under construction. If you want a real vacation spot stay on the beach, but for being in downtown on business it's a good choice. Public transportation is nearby, either the Metromover or the bus system (I used both). The gym was great with individual TVs on the cardio equipment. I only paid $90/night, so I was extremely happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: lmcanida
Reviews.Content: The stay at the hyatt was great. I got the room for $190 a nite which was good compared to other hotels. The hotel staff was nice and help out in anyway possible. The noise of the hotel was average but didn't bother me because that is what you will expect if you stay in the city. the cab drivers that wait outside the hotel were rude and rip offs. we took many cabs thoughout the city and the ones that the hotel provided always seemed higher than other cabs we used from different places. if you do stay go to the gift shop. some items in there are resonably price and you can get a beer for 3.50 vs the 5.50 plus tip from the bar. the lady who works in there is pleasant and thankful. the room did harbor a little musty smell but it dissipated if you open the balcony door.. the beds in room were amazing....other than that the stay was nice for the price... PS: the crowd was middle aged and familys which is great if you want to stay away from the wild young crowd.....

Reviews.Title: “hyatt regency miami”
Reviews.Author: mihamom
Reviews.Content: I agree with others that the hotel is noisy. And I live in NY on the flight path to Kennedy. The bed was wonderful, and the room I had was quite large. I was on the 19th floor, which brought the noise level to a reasonable pitch, and I recommend requesting a high floor. The staff was quite nice. The gym was a bit small with all machines taken at 7am, the pool was small for my liking. I do like the deli in the lobby- great Cobb salad for $7.50.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: chicritic
Reviews.Content: The bed was extremely comfortable, room clean, but dated decor. Sliding door had a proble. One big down side is it was very noisy, between the drawbridge, car alarms, bellman whistles for cabs etc, it was tough to sleep well. Stayed 3 nights, 2 unplanned due to delayed cruise departure. Staff was very nice. Exercise facilities above average, pool average, food good

Reviews.Title: “Horrible construction site- totally 1992 hotel in need of makeover”
Reviews.Author: MaloneV
Reviews.Content: I could have handed the crane operator from the building construction site next door a coffee from my balcony. Fine, but not for a CORPORATE NEGOTIATED DISCOUNT rate of $230 per night! If I had a camera you might not believe the proximity of not only the crane, but the entire view of a city under construction (of course I can't gripe to Hyatt about city-wide construction). Endless noise, peeling paint, dated room service menu, no mini bar, etc, etc, etc. I say save yourself tons of cash and stay at the Courtyard Hotel or Holiday Inn or pay the same amount and stay at the Intercontinental. All are within 2 blocks of this hotel. Safe travels everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: pierrepont
Reviews.Content: A time warp. Friendly staff, but 80s infrastructure. Somehow a tidal wave of new development in Miami has missed this corner of downtown which is a museum of awful urban renewal: concrete viaducts, garages, retaining walls, columns everywhere-- you are staying in Miami but the decor is vaguely Soviet. Terrific people upgraded me to a giant room but still there was a large unexplainable wet spot on the carpet in the living area.

Reviews.Title: “Below average, and what's with the staff's lack of area knowledge?”
Reviews.Author: plouisegb
Reviews.Content: The lobby was fine, but the rooms were sub-par. One quickly realizes that the only people staying there are stuck there because they're attending a convention (the Miami Convention Center is attached) or going on a cruise. Lobby constantly filled with people and their luggage lining up to get on buses to go to their ship. Main complaint: The staff we came across had no idea how to direct visitors to their city. Again, I imagine that due to their clientele, they aren't often asked whether there are any restaurants within walking distance. Nevertheless, we were told flatly no, save one (Capital Grill). We decided that was impossible and set out on foot anyway to discover dozens of places. We had several good meals in vibrant litte blocks of nightlife. I think Miami Ave and 10th-14th streets, and some others the other direction as well. How could they not know this? (by the way, Duo was delish though pricey, and Indochine was loud and fun and quite good, too. We walked past several restaurants en route to these, that were all packed: French, Italian, Mediterranean, bars, etc.) We asked again the next morning if there was a place we could walk to have breakfast and they said no. We said then we'll head to Key Biscayne and eat there...was there something there? Only the Ritz Carlton. Hard to believe, and again, turned out to be totally untrue. We walked out the front of the hotel and could SEE a bakery from there. Walked over and had a delicious (though casual) breakfast with mostly locals. South American sweet breads, omelettes, proper espresso. Maybe the hotel thinks their clientele only likes IHOP. Don Pan was the name of it, and it fit the bill. We wandered another block to buy water and found a street with a half dozen casual restaurants, including Quizno's and an independent Chinese and Japanese place, and a Starbucks. The concierge didn't know any of this?? Furthermore, Key Biscayne is a town, not a resort only island. Therefore, there were DOZENS of restaurants of every caliber. Cafes, Starbucks, diners, restaurants. Baffling. Anyway, despite the look of the place, the seemingly bad location with no sidewalks and construction and makeshift roads everywhere, we (two women, who never felt threatened), found great places despite the hotel staff's determination to keep us away from them.

Reviews.Title: “Not As Bad as Previous Reviews”
Reviews.Author: travelmavenLaJolla
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt Regency is located in downtown Miami. As you can see by previously posted pictures, there is a tremendous amount of construction going on in this vicinity as the area is being revitalized. Please do no think of beaches and palm trees when you book here. This is a downtown property that shuts down after business hours. We booked here for a 6 night stay and after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor we were very hesitant about staying at the hotel...not so much for the location because I know Miami very well and I knew exactly where we would be and what I wanted from the hotel. The property itself does need some sprucing up...I agree the lobby looks fine. Yes, there was a spot on the carpet by the sink, but I think it was from someone spilling something that removed the dye. I did find a place in the hall where the wallpaper was coming unglued, but the room itself was updated. Nice fabrics and amenities. As a matter of fact, while there, they even replaced the shower curtain, although it looked fine the way it was. They adjusted the shower pressure without a request. The hotel is not all Bayview...contrary to what someone wrote. When checking in the desk agent said there could be some noise on the bay side and would we prefer a quiet room? The room was clean and organized daily when we returned. We called down and our car was there when we arrived at the front door. It is possible there is uneven service...but we stayed the entire 6 nights without regret.

Reviews.Title: “Just horrible!”
Reviews.Author: merrijen
Reviews.Content: A friend and I arrived on December 16th on a gray, rainy Saturday morning for a 3 night stay. The lobby was deserted and very unwelcoming, but the girl at check in was friendly and helpful. This was the only high spot of our 2 hour stay. We arrived in our (very small!) room to be greeted by noise from the building site below that was so loud we could not hold a conversation. The view was awful, mostly a giant concrete convention center and more building sites. We went straight back to reception and were told there were no other rooms available. After going back to the room we realised how filthy it was. The carpet hadn''t been cleaned for days and the bathroom was very grotty and also not very clean. We got on to their very bad internet service and promptly booked a hotel in Fort Lauderdale, booked a cab and left after 2 hours! I cannot believe that this was a Hyatt Regency hotel. It was old, shabby and dirty and needs some serious attention. We had booked and paid in advance for 3 days but we'd rather lose the money than have to stay there. Very disappointing, as this was supposed to be a treat! Avoid at all costs until they get some renovations done!

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Construction Hat and Ear Plugs”
Reviews.Author: sportingreview
Reviews.Content: Travelocity sold me this package and charged an extra $150.00 for a "Bayview" When we arrived they didn't have our room so my kid had to sleep on a couch! But they called that an upgrade. Then we found out that the entire hotel has a Bayview. But travelocity charged us extra for what we were already getting. Watch out for travelocity. They are deceptive. The entire area around the hotel is under construction and the area is very dangerous. Go to South beach and skip this hotel. And definitely do not trust travelocity!

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: jechath
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here two times in the month of August. The rooms were ok though both had moldy odors. The beds were very comfortable but the bathrooms are incredibly outdated. I would not consider this to be on par with four star hotels or the Hyatt brand. The second time we checked in, the room we received was only half cleaned. We requested another room and were able to move but I still didn't like the inconvinience. We were not offered any sort of apology. The hotel is not in the best part of Miami. I am very familiar with the city and downtown Miami is not a safe place to roam around at night.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: northstartravels
Reviews.Content: The hotel is stylish both in its common areas and in the rooms. The lobby has different sections and levels that make it intimate, with comfortable and attractive furniture. The rooms are beautiful. The beds and desks are set in an unusual, pleasing style facing the window and balcony. The bed itself-- way comfortable. The setting of the hotel was less pleasing. It is off by itself between an elevated highway exit and a canal/river. This provides a nice river terrace, but set in an isolated concrete jungle that is hard to get out off. I am not familiar with Miami and so my complaint here may be more about this rather unappealing downtown than the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “so so”
Reviews.Author: judylee88
Reviews.Content: Hello Folks- you really get what you pay for. We stayed at this hotel for one night to board our cruise on Sun. The hotel is beautiful outside, staff at front desk was great. But they really need to renovate this hotel, there was a stench in the hallway that was very bad. The room was very outdated. But again, for the price, cant complain much. There really is not much going on around the hotel either. If you are use to hotels that is 4-5 stars (last hotel we stayed at was Wynn in LV), that really lived up to the name, this is more of a 2-3 stars max.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, the best service”
Reviews.Author: CorrieDekker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and we had a room with Bayview on the 7th. floor. Girl at the front desk (Olivera) was very nice and accurate. Rooms were beautifull, spacious, very clean and the view was great. Hotel lounge and bar were nice and the buffet restaurant was very good. Nice location near Bayside Marketplace. We'll stay there again!! Fam. Dekker & Fam van Bodegom The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: cruise7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for business. 1. The room was old and outdated. Mold in the shower. 2. Not in an area you want to walking around at night. No Shuttle. 3. food in hotel so so. The staff was great. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: glenulia
Reviews.Content: We booked our one night pre-cruise stay at the Hyatt using Priceline, and we were very pleased with the value. To get a 4-star hotel for $100 was great for us. We loved the hotel lobby and guestroom), and were pleased with the service (we requested a room on a high floor, and were given a room on the 24th floor with a view of the bay). Unfortunately there is a lot of construction in downtown Miami, which obstructed our view somewhat, and made the balcony a little too loud to sit out on, but this certainly is not the fault of the hotel. Some other reviews mention that the bridge is noisy, but we did not find this to be a problem (although maybe it would be louder on a lower floor). We dipped our feet in the pool, which seemed very nice and clean. Room service was good, as was the food in the bar. If you are looking for a place from which you can explore the city, this might not be the best bet, as there isn't much in the immediate area (it is right downtown in the business district). But by the same token, the cabs from the airport and to the port were cheap, so it might not be such a bad homebase if you are willing to pay a little extra for cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in the Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: RLG_9595
Reviews.Content: Had an awesome time in Miami however, would never consider staying at the Hyatt Regency Miami. Arrived approx. 3pm., line at check-in, one person working the desk. Room very worn!! Needs major up-date!! Hairdryer and coffee maker in the room did not work. Called for new hairdryer never brought up to the room until we called again the next day. Bed pillows had awful smell!! Did not use a pillow the entire stay!! Just gross!! Suppose to receive breakfast vouchers at check in, never did. Had to call the front desk. Would never recommend or stay again. This hotel really needs to step it up!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: hafman99
Reviews.Content: Upon checking-in, we were warned that there would be a loud party taking place on the terrace of an adjacent building. Seeing this as an opportunity to upgrade our stay, we jumped at the chance. Sure enough, after a simple request, we were given a room on the Regency Club floor - a private floor at the top with a lounge providing unlimited food and (non-alcoholic) drinks which was kept stocked throughout the breakfast and early-dinner hour. The room itself was beautiful and the views unmatched. We paid $109 per night for a room that would normally cost more than double! The "loud party" we were warned about turned out to be a concert featuring some of my favorite artists! Unlike others, I did not find the area to be too risky to walk around at night. Though it was deserted, a quick ride on the Metromover (free monorail within downtown) from Bayside got us to the hotel in under five minutes. Parking was relatively inexpensive for Miami at only $12, though no in/out privileges. I would definitely consider staying here again - hopefully there's another "loud party"!

Reviews.Title: “Get a room away from the bridge”
Reviews.Author: Svein
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one nigth pre transatlantic cruise. Checked in 2 PM, was checked in rigth away. I saw later in the afternoon lots of people queing to check in. As iI had bougth the room for $ 90 at Price-line, check out was done very quickly. We had a room facing the bridge, which is made from a steel-mesh, creating a disturbing noise trhough the whole nigth and making it almost impossible to sleep, - so get a room facing the other way. We could not find a good restaurant in this area, but felt safe walking around in this hispanic neighborhood. So we had dinner at the hotel next door to Hyatt, the Marriott CourtYard. Breakfast was not easy to catch with so many guests arriving at almost the same time. Crise port 5 min drive away from hotel. There are construction works going on, to all sides of the hotel. Nearby Flagler street had lots of shops, but the area looked outdated. I do not think I would stay in thios hotel again, and would therefore avoid using Priceline for a Miami booking, because if you choose ' downtown Miami 4-star', you would probably end up in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Fatwalleter
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hyatt as a recommendation. We thought we could see the port from this Hotel. However, with the recent construction of new sky scrapers this is no longer the case for this Hotel. We utilized this Hotel as a Pre Cruise Hotel. A better choice would be the Marriott at Biscayne. We found the service, the food, and the staff to be of excellent service. The Concierge, Dion has an Awesome personality and is very helpful. We used Priceline for this hotel and were given a suite with 2 balconies, on the top floor! Our room was very comfortable. The hotels location is an easy walk to Bayside. However, if you are in need of a rental car, there is a rental car station located in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a total revamp”
Reviews.Author: Sheryll
Reviews.Content: We did the Romance Package which upgraded us to a suite, with complimentary champagne and chocolates and free movies. The size of the suite was fine, but the bathroom quite small and then outside the bathroom was an open sink area which we did not like as if someone opened the bathroom door and you were at the sink you got hit. The hotel needed a revamp, I found it satisfactory but my Husband did not enjoy it at all and couldnt wait to leave. The restaurant was satisfactory, we had a pleasant meal our first night ( can highly recommend the Goats Cheese Ravioli with pinenuts and Balsomic cream sauce)but were not that keen to go back a second time. Breakfast Buffett was quite expensive for what was on offer, althought the service in the restaurant was very good. Would not go back, in fact our last night we stayed at the Sofitel Maimi at the Airport and it was a wonderful hotel. The Hyatt Hotel was downtown (we were advised not to go out at night or at least get a taxi or drive, not safe to walk). During the day and early evening we could walk to Bayside (where you can shop and dine and get cruises to tour the wonderful Biscayne Bay. IF you want a good honest meal but a large meal at a reasonable price to the the Bubba Gump SHrimp CO at Bayside, great value but take your appetite. There seemed to be a lot of conference and business people at this hotel, but we would not stay there again. We thought being a Hyatt Hotel it would certainly be a much higher standard than it was.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt, great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: emily174
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here a day prior to a cruise, and thought the hotel was wonderful. The room we stayed in was very clean and spacious and the decor looked very new. We had a small balcony with an amazing view of the city. The Metromover has a stop right next the hotel and provides free transportation. We went to a great shopping area and had a nice dinner there. The only downside is that the restaurant on site was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt - Miami”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelmore
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hyatt for one night before our cruise, we chose the location because it is very close to the cruise port (about $12.00 taxi ride). The hotel was very clean, with plenty of room. Ice and soda machines in the hallway. The pool is small but was nice and clean. This hotel is in the financial district, there are no stores / restaurants close by, lots of traffic since there is a convention center attached to the building. The hotel food was way too expensive for our budget (pancakes $14.00, orange juice $4.00, bacon and eggs $22.00). We got a reduced rate on the room (rack rate was $339.) through Working Advantage for $135. We would stay at this hotel again, but would have lunch before getting there and bring breakfast items for the next morning ;) I'm sure it would be perfect for the business traveler with an expense account.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE HYATT!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Jan. 7-12, but just found this website which is why I'm posting now. I LOVED the Hyatt, and can't believe the bad reviews on here. I've been in many hotels as I travel a lot, and this was one of the nicest I've stayed at. The rooms were large and beautiful. The partial wall in front of the bathroom gave a lot of privacy, and the large closet gave us an extra place to change in, as I was traveling with 2 other people. The pool was nice, and the staff was always around to hand out towels and pick up ones not being used. The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful, especially at the concierge desk. They always gave us great advice on where to go and how to get there. The Metromover was right there, and was very convenient. The bus was only a few blocks away, but I wouldn't recommend taking it all the way back to the hotel at night, as the hotel is not in a great part of town. Take the bus to Bayside, then take a cab to the hotel...it only costs a few dollars for the cab. Cabs were always available outside the hotel, and a staff member would go down to the street to get one if there wasn't. I would definitely stay at the Hyatt again. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: tybee4
Reviews.Content: Great waterfront view from balcony. Room, halls, public areas clean, yet bathroom shabby, moldy, needs updating. Very noisy in daytime due to multi construction sites all around - would help if they updated sliding balcony door (needed resealing). Employees all VERY nice. Parking by valet a pain, $23 +tips, but self parking way off-site & charged to come and go. Very close to South Beach & traffic in that area not that bad. Not an area to walk around after dusk either - drive to restaurants. Best for business travelers - not vacationers.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Dian65
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a precruise and postcruise night at the Hyatt Regency Miami. Check in was a breeze and staff very pleasant. We were upgraded to a petite suite precruise . I asked for early check in for post cruise and received it. We also were given a late checkout. The rooms are very nice and I would stay here again.Service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A four-star weekend”
Reviews.Author: friedman29
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back form a quick weekend (away from the kids) in Miami. We got a great deal on Priceline and had a wonderful stay. Unlike some places, they treated us like royalty, even though we paid way less than rack rate. The staff was very helpful and nice. The room was clean and modern and the bed was very comfy. The location is excellent and having the Metromover right there is definitely a plus, since getting around by car is difficult (better to leave it parked and walk or take the Metromover). The main downside was parking -- tough to find and expensive. But we had a great stay and look forward to going back to the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it, unless favored by a real bargain.”
Reviews.Author: sjmartins
Reviews.Content: Pro: spacious room (8th floor), basic room amenities, clean room (if you don't forget tipping), easy traffic access, link to Metromover/Metrorail. Cons: one of the worst breakfast I ever tried in USA, bellow average room service, expensive parking rate, unhelpful Concierge (!), disinterested Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: CanelaCaribena
Reviews.Content: My dad and I stayed here for one night before a cruise in January. We used the self check-in option, which was really quick and convenient as we checked in pretty late in the evening. The room itself was quite disappointing. The carpet had several stains and a candy wrapper on it, the curtains, desk and desk lamp were very dusty, and the water pressure in the sink and shower were really low. The room just had a dirty feel overall, and it was obvious that it wasn't cleaned as thoroughly after guests checked out. Luckily I received a really good deal on priceline, so my pockets weren't hit as hard as others who may have paid full price to stay here. However, I still expected the rooms to at least be clean and well kempt, especially since it is considered a 4-star hotel. One bright spot was that upon check-out, our bill reflected a pay-per-view movie that we never actually ordered, and the front desk clerk wiped it out without any fuss. I wouldn't stay here again if I had the choice.

Reviews.Title: “One night stand - enough!”
Reviews.Author: MBMiner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed her for one night in connection with an early morning meeting at INS. It proved very convenient for this purpose, as their offices are a five-minute walk just across the river. This hotel is a bit run down as previous reviewers have noted. We were greeted very warmly at the front desk. The worst aspect of our location facing the Bay and cruise port was the awful noise of the drawbridge. The noise is terrible, which wasn't helped by the fact that the sliding glass door in the room didn't close tightly. The food is very expensive and we ran up a $58 bill on just a hamburger for dinner and oatmeal and orange juice for breakfast. $4.00 for a small glass of orange juice! I might stay here again if it was essential to be in that part of Miami but not otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a renovation”
Reviews.Author: sk84fungirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Feb 20-23, 2006 after canceling reservation at Intercontinental. Stay was for business. Arrived a Miami international. Drive from airport is 20 minutes or less. Construction is terrible around airport and traffic around Miami downtown is similar to that of other large cities. It's not too go. So don't be in a hurry for a meeting. Allow yourself enough time to get to the hotel from the airport. Check-in was quick. Lobby is lackluster at best. Valet was quick and cost $23 a day. Self-park is not convenient at this hotel. Room was on the 23rd floor with Bay view. This is also the floor of the Regency club. This is a very small area that provides continental breakfast for select guests and evening snacks. Nothing to write home about. The room was clean with signs of obvious wear. Room and hotel is dated and in need of serious renovations. The outside temperature averaged low 80's during my stay. The room was always comfortable. The hotel offers Wi-Fi through T-mobile Hot Spot. I'm not a fan of the service because the signal was always weak and you have to use a credit card vs the 9.99 per day being charged to your room. I had a double room. The bed was quite comfortable. Nothing spectacular. Outside of the Regency room, I did not attempt any of the hotels amenities. I used concierge for some directions. The lady that assisted me was great. The staff at the hotel was very pleasant. I would definitely rate them Excellent. Others in my group stayed at the Intercontinental. Views from their rooms were of the bay, Port of Miami, and South Beach, Bayside, etc. Views were very nice. Externally and in the lobby, the hotel was more appealing. Because the hotel is across the street from the park, there is free parking that is very convenient. I'm sure on weekends it would be difficult to find a spot. However, there is a garage right next door as well. We utilized the tram from the hotel to Bayside for dinner. When returning from Bayside, we took a taxi for $5. The drive is no more than five minutes. However, downtown is pretty deserted after business hours. I did not feel comfortable walking from Bayside to the Hyatt. If I stayed at the Intercontinental, I would have walked as it is literally across the park. If I had to, I would stay at the Hyatt again. Overall, it was an OK stay.

Reviews.Title: “A bit run down”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Imagine my surprise when checking into a $400 a night hotel and it was run down and a bit dirty. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, but that didn't make up for the fact that our room was dated, the shower was awful, and the carpets were filthy. On top of it all, we found downtown Miami to be in similar disrepair - dirty, run down, and construction everywhere. Don't waste your money on the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Good Ammenties - Not the cleanest hotel”
Reviews.Author: msluvcruzin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night post-cruise. Check-in staff was very friendly and was able to get us checked in early. We had a 2 double room non-smoking facing the Miami River. First thing we noticed - one of the beds had sand on the bedspread from someone maybe putting a shoe on it. We didn't need the bedspread anyhow so off it went. The hotel was full so we just shrugged it off as an oversight on the cleaning staff. We tried to use the Concierge services to do early check-in for our airflights and the 2 working there looked confused and then pointed us to business services. There is a charge to use the internet $30 an hr. using their laptops and 25 cents for printouts. I thought this was extreme so we asked someone at the front desk to assist. Joseph helped us out and within a few min's we were checked in for the flights. That afternoon we checked out the bathroom area in our room. DISGUSTING. Mold everywhere. I took pictures to send to Hyatt. The floor wasn't vaccumed either and we found food between the nightstand and bed, mold on the wall and a few dead bugs (at least they weren't alive). It's such a shame as this is a beautiful hotel with nice dining and sports bar. All it would take is a good cleaning staff and some clorox-cleanup to bring it up to code.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, uninteresting location”
Reviews.Author: hkmd
Reviews.Content: This hotel itself and the staff are very adequate but being located in downtown Miami is a hinderance. It is far from the beaches and its pool and health facilities are very small, considering it is in Florida. The surrounding area is undergoing a great deal of building and renovation so currently it is noisy; I am sure it will improve in the next few years. Overall a good hotel for business meetings but not for vacationers.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, nice rooms, expensive area”
Reviews.Author: Serenat17
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights after a cruise so we could see some of Miami. Like other reviewers, it is downtown and not close to the beach, so there isn't much to see other than Bayside. However, we easily found the bus system and travelled to South Beach. The room was really nice, clean and comfortable. We overlooked the drawbridge and actually enjoyed watching the boats go up and down the canal. I didn't find the noise at all bothersome. Service was great we had a problem with the inhouse safe and they completely replaced it for us as it had been broken. The cost is more than we would normally pay for a hotel, but it was included in the cruise package we took so we quite enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Very compassionate and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt with 6 of my family mammbers in early October. We were there b/c my grandfather had been flown to Jackson Memorial Hospital from down south. The staff was extremely helpful with directions and especially when my car broke down and I had no idea where to go. We ended up staying over a week at the Hyatt and I was very pleased, we got a nice discount b/c of our circumstances and a lot of compassion that was very comforting. Thank you Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Cleptomaniacs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hyatt for the Christmas holidays this year.. i had the following problems: 1- My ipod was stolen from my car during Valet parking and for the time I was staying there they kept on saying â€œwe will work on your claim and compensate you for it. The next day after my check they left me a message that they are not responsible for any kind of theft..!! How insensitive..!! By the way The Valet parking is managed by Central Parking and the hotel completely denies ownership of responsibility. 2. The television was not working... 3. For the folks at Hyatt housekeeping means just replacing towels and making the bed. 4. Overall my experience was not that great. The positives points are: rooms are decently sized with nice bathrooms and good bay view.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as the courtyard next door”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fellow travellers we stayed for two nights post hurricane Wilma after 2 nights at the courtyard Marriot next door The hyatt was amost twice the price, not much more in terms of facilties and lacking in atmosphere...except for the door staff who were genuinely (I'm a sucker for friendly service) all over us as we jumped in the taxi off to the next hotel on our trip In particular, we hated the smoking in the sports bar and the small rooms Could do better

Reviews.Title: “A great pre-cruise stay at the Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: DonnaA73
Reviews.Content: Contrary to several of the previous reviews, I must say that we had a comfortable and pleasant stay at the Hyatt Regency Miami. After a long and frustrating 2 and a 1/2 hour flight delay, we arrived at the Hyatt at approx. 9:30 p.m. Check-in was a breeze at this hour and the lobby was fairly quiet. The staff was very friendly and accomodating and before we knew it, we were headed up to our room on the 12th floor. Our room, which was classified as a petite suite, was exactly what we were hoping for. The room was a good size and had two balconies; one in the bedroom area and one in a separate sitting area. We found the entire room to be clean and comfortable. As most of the other reviewers noted, there was some noise from the downtown traffic and drawbridge, but it was by no means, bothersome. It was also nice being able to view the cruise ships right from our balcony. With regards to the surrounding area, if you are interested in shopping, Bayside Marketplace is within walking distance. Other than that, there is not too much as far as "tourist" attractions. If you do not mind hopping on the public bus, there is a bus every 20 minutes or so that runs from Bayside to South Beach for only $1.50 per person. We found this to be very convenient and money-saving. All-in-all, the Hyatt Regency Miami is a great choice for a short stay. Given the hotel's location, however, I would not recommend for anything longer than a few nights, as you may get bored or spend every dollar you have taking taxis to the "hot spots."

Reviews.Title: “really quite liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cwagsg
Reviews.Content: As with others, I was very apprehensive about staying at this hotel. I stayed for 2 nights before a cruise and didn't encounter any problems. As others say the dropoff area outside reception is chaotic, whether there is a convention on or not, but there are ways round this as one of our taxi drivers pointed out. reception & bell staff were great. very helpful and friendly. Our standard room was on the 12th floor directly overlooking the bridge. If you are a light sleper, this may be a problem, but to be honest we got used to it. The room was really well appointed, very clean and we had no other noise issues. the pool area is pleasant although not the most peaceful owing to the bridge and traffic, but again I wasn't hampered. DON'T BE PUT OFF THIS HOTEL!! It wouldn't be my first choice if I return to Miami, however I would quite happily stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay ....”
Reviews.Author: Cartman88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Regency Club suite on the top floor for one night following a cruise. We had requested an early check in time and when we showed up at 12pm they advised our room was ready. The room was very nice and having access to the Regency Club area was great for tea/coffee/drinks plus a continental breakfast. The location was fairly central and the Bayside Markets were only a 10 min walk. We managed to get the room half price (approx $187 plus tax) and at that price it was reasonable value for money â€“ if we had to pay any extra we would say there are better alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel shares lobby and elevators with Miami Convention Center, usually crowded to very, very crowded depending on CC event. Elevators need room key to work above CC levels. If you are in the back it's very inconvenient when crowded. Traffic at hotel front is impossible gridlock when there is a big event. Food is very pricey even for Miami. Ask about ordering off the poolside menu for a better value; sandwiches, burgers, salads, etc, worked for us. Staff was very accomodating, a little Spanish goes a long way here. Neighborhood is tough to navigate on foot due to street layout. Access to people mover is all indoors and it's free. Use it to get around downtown Miami. Room is very average; not a good value for price, stay here only with a convention rate or if you really need to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Miami Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: East_coast55
Reviews.Content: After viewing the other reviews, I was very apprehensive about staying at the Miami Hyatt, especially since I would be staying for five days during a conference. I was prepared to take a look and then move to the Marriott if the Hyatt looked bad. Not only was there no need for that, I had a great stay. Every point made in the other reviews was certaintly not evident during my stay. The Hyatt was very clean and very quiet. I had a room with a city view on the 20th floor. I did hear the bridge once, but it didn't disturb me at all. There is construction near the Hyatt but it seems that the whole of Miami is under construction. If you go you should just be aware of this as it would be unavoidable wherever you stay. Having said that, the Hyatt is very quiet- no evidence of the paper walls previously mentioned. I particularily enjoyed the way the the room was divided which prevented any light from coming in under the door. Another unexpected feature was the large walk-in closet. The staff of the hotel were also great. After five days, I had a good chance to see the staff in action. Everyone from the maids to the bellmen to the front desk staff were prompt, friendly, and helpful. As far as nearby attractions, the Bayside Marketplace is a short walk from the hotel. As far as the hotel being in a bad area- Miami is a big city like any other. If you use common sense precautions such as walking during the day and taking a cab after dark you will be just fine. The Riverwalk Deli in the Lobby has good sandwiches and they make a mean Starbucks latte, which I enjoyed while listening to the player piano. Try the Hyatt - I'm glad I did.

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Regency Miami
HotelInfo.Address: 400 South East Second Ave, Miami, FL 33131-2197
